";s:3:"faq";s:4977:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>INSTALLATION: The easiest way to start uploading your photos is to login to you WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins &gt;&gt; Add New, search for NextGEN Gallery, and click to install. You can also download the zip file from this page and upload it from the Plugins &gt;&gt; Add New &gt; Upload page.</p>
<p>HOW TO USE: Just go to a page or post and click the NextGEN Gallery icon. From our Insert Gallery Window, you can create, manage, customize, and display your photo galleries. You can also manage your photo galleries and gallery settings from the central options area under the &#8220;Gallery&#8221; tab on your dashboard menu.</p>
<p>DOCUMENTATION: See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>That&#8217;s it &#8230; have fun! For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/qwNr5ZNGavo?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
</p>
<h4>Why are my photo galleries not opening up in a lightbox after I move my site?</h4>
<p>
<p>This is often due to the URL paths to the CSS and JavaScript files used by the Lightbox Effects not being changed to relevant addresses based on the new site. This article will help sort out this issue if that is the case: <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/galleries-opening-lightbox/" rel="nofollow">Why are my galleries not opening up in a lightbox?</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Do you have documentation or tutorials?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will NextGEN Gallery work with my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Part of what makes the NextGEN Gallery WordPress gallery plugin so popular is its flexibility &#8211; it works with the vast majority of premium and free themes, without requiring any coding.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the photo galleries flash based?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, NextGEN Gallery uses Javascript and jQuery based displays to ensure compatibility across the widest range of displays possible.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the galleries mobile friendly?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, since we use Javascript rather than flash, NextGEN Gallery is compatible with Android, iOS, and Blackberry. As of July 2013, all photo galleries are responsive. NextGEN Pro also includes a full screen, responsive Pro Lightbox with mobile gesture support.</p>
</p>
<h4>What is the difference between a gallery and an album?</h4>
<p>
<p>In the simplest of terms, Galleries contain your photos and Albums contain your Galleries. Albums act as links and placeholders to quickly and easily navigate your galleries &#8211; Galleries will actually display your images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I upload multiple images at once?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can batch upload entire photo galleries at one time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I password protect galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WordPress allows you to password protect pages by default &#8211; which includes all photo galleries and content for the entire page. Password protection of pages can be turned on and off at any time, with just a few clicks.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add a watermark to the photos/slideshows?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can add text or image watermarks to your gallery images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I crop thumbnails?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, each thumbnail image can be individually adjusted to suit your needs.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is there pagination for photo galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, and you can adjust the amount of images to be shown on a page at any time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I customize the lightbox?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, the lightbox can be configured with multiple options directly from the Dashboard, and there are multiple CSS styles which can be applied and modified as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add HTML to the captions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, caption areas are fully HMTL capable.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add an external links to galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Since the captions are fully HTML capable, you can add external links and any other type of mark up you wish.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is NextGEN Gallery available in foreign languages?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, the NextGEN Gallery WordPress gallery plugin has been translated into dozens of languages &#8211; <a href="https://www.imagely.com/languages/" rel="nofollow">click here to find out more.</a></p>
</p>
<h4>More Information</h4>
<p>
<p>For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:73656:"<h4>V2.2.14 &#8211; 09.18.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:   EXIF and IPTC metadata are copied to new images when generating thumbnails, watermarks, or new sizes</li>
<li>Fixed: Metadata is read and preserved when &#8220;Resized images after upload&#8221; feature is enabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.12 &#8211; 08.01.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Secured: Disabled Flash backend in plupload</li>
<li>Changed: Upgraded PHP-Parser version used when building plugin zips</li>
<li>Changed: Added DESC as an option to nggTags::find_images_for_tags()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed useage of parse_str for PHP 7 (thanks Bodo Graumann)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Made transients manager flush only expired transients</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with Spider Calendar</li>
<li>Fixed:   Problem with validation code of DataMapper Models</li>
<li>Fixed:   Convert script/style urls to arrays in the lightbox installer</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.10 &#8211; 06.14.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that the plugin works when PHP isn&#8217;t compiled against libxml</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.9 &#8211; 06.14.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   WSOD caused by setting $wp_query-&gt;is_page to false</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.8 &#8211; 06.13.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Removed custom Freemius opt-in message</li>
<li>Changed: New design and video for Upgrade to Pro page</li>
<li>Changed: Added namespacing to NGG-generated transients</li>
<li>Fixed:   Better error reporting for the XML-RPC method, ngg.uploadImage</li>
<li>Fixed:   Thumbnail editing links missing when locale uses RTL language such as Hebrew</li>
<li>Fixed:   Roles and Capabilities discrepancy with displaying NextGEN Gallery UI elements</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fancybox lightbox effect not compatible with Pro Mosaic galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic Tagcloud does not honor display type setting when editing in IGW</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic Tagcloud allows selection of Pro display types when NGG Pro is disabled</li>
<li>Fixed:   Limit display types available in &#8220;Display galleries as&#8221; setting for albums</li>
<li>Fixed:   Special characters in <code>show_slideshow_text</code> parameter causing inserted display to not be editable.</li>
<li>Fixed:   NGG Basic Slideshow not honoring transition effect setting</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image tags that are no longer should be removed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Spacing preserved when our shortcodes are placed with other content</li>
<li>Fixed:   Breadcrumbs in albums when slug is shared between gallery and album</li>
<li>Fixed:   get_unique_slug() creating invalid SQL query when gallery name contains quote characters</li>
<li>Fixed:   /ngg_tags pages displaying comments from all posts</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP warning when saving image meta data</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix incompatibility with WPML pagination due to overriding $_SERVER[&#8216;REQUEST_URI&#8217;]</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.3 &#8211; 04.05.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:    E_WARNING on Gallery Settings page due to improper use of array_combine() on PHP &lt;= 5.3</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.2 &#8211;  04.04.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:    Hyperlinks in image or photo descriptions</li>

<li>Fixed:    Removed id parameter in shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed:    Fatal error in Freemius code</li>
</ul>

<li>Changed:  Updated gallery plugin branding to Imagely</li>
<li>Changed:  Added the ability to click on a gallery title and have it open direct to Pro Lightbox</li>
<li>Fixed:    Problems with activation after initial installation</li>
<li>Fixed:    Don&#8217;t display legacy shortcodes after creating new galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:    False positive malware detection notices against &#8216;eval&#8217;</li>
<li>Fixed:    Various PHP notices and warnings</li>
<li>Fixed:    Issue with dynamic container height for Imagebrowser photo galleries</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.43 &#8211; 05.25.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added Freemius integration</li>
<li>NEW:     Added actions actions ngg_updated_image_meta, ngg_recovered_image, ngg_generated_image, ngg_moved_images, and ngg_copied_images</li>
<li>NEW:     Added patch from WPML copyping ATP galleries to new language pages when duplicating a page to a new language</li>
<li>Changed: Moved &#8216;ngg_delete_picture&#8217; action to before the image has been removed</li>
<li>Changed: Now prevent maximum_entity_count from being set to 0 or lower in Other Options</li>
<li>Changed: Updated &#8220;Roots&#8221; relative url support to re-branded &#8220;Soil&#8221; relative url</li>
<li>Changed: Updated branding so all publicly visible instances of &#8220;Photocrati&#8221; are now &#8220;Imagely&#8221;</li>
<li>Changed: Upgraded FontAwesome to 4.6.1</li>
<li>Fixed:   Album breadcrumbs when used with legacy templates</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with added WP role objects without a remove_cap() method</li>
<li>Fixed:   Default watermark setting causing images to be watermarked by text even though &#8220;image&#8221; is shown chosen on &#8220;Other Options&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed:   Navigating to albums with UTF8 characters in their name</li>
<li>Fixed:   Replaced use of get_currentuserinfo() with wp_get_current_user()</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.33 &#8211; 04.25.2016</h4>
<ul>

<li>Fixed:   Ensure that shutter reloaded can find its image assets</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.31 &#8211; 04.05.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added constant NGG_SCRIPT_VERSION that is either the plugin version or rand() should SCRIPT_DEBUG be on</li>
<li>NEW:     Added warning when saving galleries and refuse to automatically delete galleries with one or more &#8220;../&#8221; in their path.</li>
<li>Changed: ATP slug field disallow several characters (spaces, ?, |, &amp;, [, ]) by replacing them with dashes as they are typed</li>
<li>Changed:     Made get_static_url() look in the WP_CONTENT/ngg/(module_name)/static directory for CSS/JS overrides</li>
<li>Fixed:   Bug introduced in 2.1.24 allowing gallery paths &amp; slugs to contain spaces; galleries must be &#8220;saved&#8221; once to correct them</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with WPML String Translation when uploading images without title or description</li>
<li>Fixed:   Made get_image_url() encode gallery directory names &#8216;because%this%is&#8217; a valid directory</li>
<li>Fixed:   Manage Galleries &gt; Search results not saving when edited</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser gallery templates not using AJAX pagination when enabled</li>
<li>Fixed:   Resource manager breaking the layout of the Multisite Plugin Activation page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Static url generation when the nextgen-gallery directory is a symlink outside of the WordPress roots</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:    C_Gallery-&gt;validation() not working properly when sanitizing gallery title using UTF-8</li>
<li>Fixed:    NGG&#8217;s cross-frame-communication cookies not being purged</li>
<li>Fixed:    Updated C_Dynamic_Thumbnails_Manager-&gt;get_uri_from_params() with user-submitted patch</li>
<li>Fixed:    Updated C_CustomPost_DataMapper_Driver-&gt;_save_entity() with user-submitted patch</li>
<li>Fixed:    Cleaned up overview.php&#8217;s readability and removed some now-long-unused code from legacy&#8217;s ajax.php</li>
</ul>

<li>NEW:     Added filter &#8216;ngg_add_page_shortcode&#8217; to control Manage Galleries &gt; &#8216;Create new page&#8217; content</li>
<li>NEW:     Added filter &#8216;ngg_manage_albums_items_order&#8217;</li>
<li>Changed: Removed PHP4 support</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to set NextGEN Image as Featured Image</li>

<li>Fixed:   Updated custom jQuery-UI styling to resemble WordPress postbox styling</li>
<li>Fixed:   Styled plupload photo upload buttons to resemble WordPress buttons</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed &#8216;fixed&#8217; class from manage galleries table. Allows columns to adjust to content</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed note about flash support and fixed typoe (thanks Rene Wolf)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed typo in nggallery.po</li>

<li>Fixed:   Better WP-CPI detection</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed unnecessary calls to parent::initialize()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted album-compact template to always include p.ngg-album-gallery-image-counter</li>
<li>Fixed:   Replaced empty gallery rendering in is_feed() with a link</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed default settings for imagerotator, which is no longer supported</li>
<li>Fixed:   Optimized scanning of images and photos when importing a gallery</li>
<li>Fixed:   When a gallery is deleted, ensure that DB and filesystem are purged</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed Insert Gallery Window box shadow</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that file_exists() calls are prefixed with @</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.0 &#8211; 05.18.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Album breadcrumbs and pagination</li>
<li>NEW:     Ability to override builtin MVC templates</li>
<li>NEW:     Robust transient management</li>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to set post thumbnails via XML-RPC module</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8216;ngg_get_image_size_params&#8217; filter to control image generation</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8216;ngg_basic_tagcloud_title&#8217; and &#8216;ngg_basic_tagcloud_excluded_display_types&#8217; filters</li>
<li>NEW:     Added ngg_manage_images_items_per_page filter</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8220;ngg_get_image_url&#8221; filter</li>
<li>NEW:     Including Ukranian and Polish translations</li>
<li>NEW:     The ability to set template in gallery widgets</li>
<li>Changed: Default thumbnail dimensions set to 240&#215;160</li>
<li>Changed: Product now adheres to Pope 0.12 and provides get_modules_to_load()</li>
<li>Changed: Updated translations</li>
<li>Changed: Removed link to capsman plugin in Roles accordion</li>
<li>Changed: Taxnomies now use internationalized strings</li>
<li>Changed: Image date/time meta data fields are stored as UNIX timestamps</li>
<li>Secured: Uploading zips</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various PHP warnings and notices</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility fixes for WPML</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that backup image functionality fails gracefully</li>
<li>Fixed:   WP option &#8216;ngg_do_upgrade&#8217; updated in every HTTP request</li>
<li>Fixed;   Empty $_SERVER[&#8216;PATHINFO&#8217;] causing multiple routing issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   &#8220;Manage Galleries&#8221; display image alttext in the filename column</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various issues with the tag cloud display type</li>
<li>Fixed:   Integrity check when updating from 1.9.x</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image filenames substituting spaces for + which is only proper in the query string</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery Window not working with nested levels of gzip compression</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser as lightbox effect not working with pagination</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with MultiVerso Advanced File Sharing</li>
<li>Fixed:   &#8220;Add page&#8221; button not displaying on the next immediate page load</li>
<li>Fixed:   Double-escaping of non-latin characters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser pagination with custom templates</li>
<li>Fixed:   Custom CSS is enqueued late to ensure it&#8217;s one of the last stylesheets loaded</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed watermarking PNG images</li>
<li>Fixed:   Using the &#8220;Import Metadata&#8221; bulk action overwrites existing data</li>
<li>Fixed:   Seconds were not retained from CaptureTime EXIF field</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflicts created by our TinyMCE plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image mapper setting gid to gallery name, not the unique ID</li>
<li>Fixed:   Restored nggdb-&gt;get_random_images(), nggdb-&gt;search_for_file, and nggdb-&gt;find_all_albums()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow gallery slug as parameter to nggdb::get_gallery()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t minify Plupload&#8217;s i18n JavaScript</li>
<li>Fixed:   Custom template images not being given their full effect code attributes</li>
<li>Fixed:   When importing galleries from folders, allow symlinks</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use of C_Gallery_Mapper in C_Image_Wrapper</li>
<li>Fixed:   Properly handle themes that don&#8217;t call wp_footer() or wp_print_footer_scripts()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning about missing style.php file on Network Admin -&gt; Gallery page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning about getimagesize() failure when backing up an image or photo</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.0.71 &#8211; 02.19.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Module files are compiled into a single package file to reduce disk I/O</li>
<li>NEW:     All CSS stylesheets and Javascript source files are minified to reduce latency</li>
<li>NEW:     All photo lightboxes are configured using an in-memory management class.</li>
<li>NEW:     Uses Pope 2.0, benefiting from the new caching capabilities</li>
<li>NEW:     NextGEN Gallery&#8217;s functionality is disabled if NextGEN Pro is incompatible</li>
<li>NEW:     Added ngg_effect_code filter</li>
<li>Changed: Updated FontAwesome to 4.3.0</li>
<li>Changed: Updated select2 to 3.5.2</li>
<li>Changed: Removed PicLens / CoolIris gallery integration</li>
<li>Changed: Removed JSON API. Please use XML-RPC API instead</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache FS &amp; url lookups/calculations</li>
<li>Changed: Greatly reduced the # of sql queries, and eliminated anything redundant</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache datamapper and SQL queries</li>
<li>Changed: Don&#8217;t enqueue scripts or styles unless we require them</li>
<li>Changed: Reduce the number of resources we enqueue for every HTTP request</li>
<li>Changed: Ngg_Store now uses cookies instead of localStorage</li>
<li>Changed: Insert Gallery Window is routed using wp-admin/admin_init</li>
<li>Changed: Removed unused code from ngglegacy module. Created wrappers for commonly-used functions</li>
<li>Changed: LZW module removed</li>
<li>Changed: Legacy gallery template drop-down selection now using select2</li>
<li>Secured: Restrict folder browsing to NGG_IMPORT_ROOT constant</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with PHP&#8217;s transparent ZLIB compression</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser as lightbox effect not working when non-default permalink slug used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Angled quotations marks used in shortcode parameters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility between ImageBrowser gallery and TwentyFifteen theme</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow pagination to retain query string url parameters when linking to other pages</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed pagination issues with slideshow galleries displayed as thumbnails</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix C_GalleryStorage_Driver_Base-&gt;import_gallery_from_fs() not checking imgBackup</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed problem with default settings being applied multiple times</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fallback to &#8220;full&#8221; image / photo sizes if &#8220;backup&#8221; images aren&#8217;t available</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use M_DataMapper&#8217;s serialization methods throughout the codebase</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict with WordPress SEO and get_the_excerpt() call</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t run Resource Manager on wp-login.php or wp-sign.php</li>
<li>Fixed:   TinyMCE Image Editor conflict with Insert Gallery Window placeholder images/photos</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix Shutter positioning when admin bar is displayed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow deselection of a legacy gallery template</li>
<li>Fixed:   Prevent conflicts when using imagebrowser gallery as a lightbox effect</li>
<li>Fixed:   Pagination not working for slideshow galleries using thumbnail integration</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   Added the ability to find legacy templates in both the child/parent theme directories</li>
<li>Fixed:   JavaScript errors in Insert Gallery Window</li>
<li>Fixed:   Router can handle port numbers in urls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Carousel template was linking to NextGEN Basic ImageBrowser view</li>
<li>Fixed:   SQL query generated for displayed photo galleries using tags as source</li>
<li>Fixed:   3rd party compat: raise &amp; never lower pcre.backtrack_limit</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.30 &#8211; 09.25.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Restored the ability to use imagebrowser gallery type instead of a lightbox effect</li>
<li>Changed: Displayed photo galleries are no longer rendered in RSS feeds</li>
<li>Changed: Removed &#8220;Plugin Check&#8221; widget from overview page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Silence PHP warnings/errors in an output buffer for AJAX actions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with WordPress SEO and broken site maps (and large error_logs)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with AJAX Event Calendar (and possibly others)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted Photocrati Resource Manager to be third-party friendly</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed empty result set for displayed galleries selecting &#8216;All&#8217; tags</li>
<li>Fixed:   URL generation for imagebrowser gallery pagination links</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that photo and image meta is imported on creation</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that transients are removed when an external object cache is used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t load pluggable.php. This will fix some plugin conflicts</li>
<li>Fixed:   In Insert Gallery Window, galleries created in one tab weren&#8217;t showing in another</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t output frame events cookie for XML-RPC requests</li>

<h4>V2.0.7 &#8211; 08.09.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     New resource manager that fixes some plugin and theme incompatibilities</li>
<li>NEW:     Styles (custom stylesheets) should reside in wp-content/ngg_styles</li>
<li>NEW:     Added option to &#8220;Other Options -&gt; Misc&#8221; to control maximum images returned</li>
<li>Secured: Removed default connector for jQuery FileTree library</li>
<li>Changed: Updated the simplehtmldom library to version 1.5</li>
<li>Changed: jQuery is now enqueued at the beginning of every request</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with BuddyPress</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with Events+, bbPress, Custom Permalinks, and other plugins</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompcatibilities with Member Access, AMember, Magic Fields, and More Fields</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with Elegant Themes, Oxygen, Responsive, and some other themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that gallery images and photos don&#8217;t have a border by default</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict between imagebrowser gallery and album urls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Reverted default gallerypath to wp-content/gallery/</li>
<li>Fixed:   Upgrade-safe way of overriding Styles</li>
<li>Fixed:   Generation of AJAX url is now based on slug</li>
<li>Fixed:   Restore nggShowGallery and nggShowSlideshow as wrappers to new API</li>
<li>Fixed:   Always use domain as specified by WordPress Site URL</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use WordPress Home URL over Site URL when appropriate</li>
<li>Fixed:   Numerous gallery pagination issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted our forms to comply with WordPress Firewalls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Correct use of select2 DOM selector for maximum compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed:   Path and URL calculations for Windows and UNIX environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that pluggable.php is loaded at the start of every request</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fancybox: adjust CSS for further box-sizing protection from themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use PHP 5.2.1 compatible named pattern matching syntax</li>
<li>Fixed:   Remove usage of <strong>DIR</strong> constant not supported by PHP 5.2.x</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed dependency on mb_string PHP module</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow &#8220;No Lightbox&#8221; as an option for Lightbox Effects</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning: &#8220;Invalid CRT parameters detected&#8221; for Windows environments</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0 &#8211; 07.30.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Improved user experience throughout the plugin, settings and usage.</li>
<li>NEW:     Plupload queue photo uploader that allows for bulk and zip uploads within the same interface.</li>
<li>NEW:     Complete redesign of the NextGEN Gallery options panel</li>
<li>NEW:     Added new Insert Gallery Window for adding galleries from pages and posts.</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries are now mobile friendly and responsive (may need a responsive theme).</li>
<li>NEW:     Streamlined functionality for displaying galleries based on tags.</li>
<li>NEW:     Architecture based on Pope Framework (http://bitbucket.org/photocrati/pope-framework)</li>
<li>NEW:     New shortcode, “ngg_images”, and corresponding Attach to Post interface</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries have now global and instance settings</li>
<li>NEW:     Support for FastCGI environments</li>
<li>Changed: Replaces shortcodes with placeholder images, however still supports legacy shortcodes.</li>
<li>Changed: Introduced new Growl-like notifications</li>
<li>Changed: The container and it’s images are centered for slideshows</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN styles now override vs replace default styles</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN legacy templates have been deprecated (but still function)</li>
<li>FIXED:   The ability to use NextGEN image as a Featured Image.</li>
<li>FIXED:   Misc bugs and annoyances, such as PHP warnings, errors, etc.</li>
</ul>

<li>Bugfix : XSS security vulnerability (THX to Core Security Advisories Team , Pedro Varangot)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Missing $wpdb in shortcodes.php</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.1 &#8211; 23.03.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : PHP4 compat issue for Add gallery &amp; options page</li>
<li>Bugfix : WordPress gallery plugin widget can now have a empty title</li>
<li>Bugfix : Adding correct stripslash for gallery title</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.0 &#8211; 18.03.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : Support for Post thumbnail feature</li>
<li>NEW : Backup and Recover function for photos (THX to Simone Fumagalli)</li>
<li>NEW : Resize photos after upload (THX to Simone Fumagalli)</li>
<li>NEW : Added a JSON class for fetching galleries in a RESTful way (see xml/json.php)</li>
<li>NEW : Adding various new capabilities for user roles</li>
<li>NEW : Auto downloader for translation file</li>
<li>Changed : Rename query var from slideshow to callback for compat reason with other plugin</li>
<li>Changed : Convert widget function to new WP structure</li>
<li>Changed : Include lookup for tags into the backend search</li>
<li>Changed : Restructure addgallery and settings page to enable custom tabs</li>
<li>Bugfix : Select album preview from gallery preview pics instead random list</li>
<li>Bugfix : Keep fix dimension in edit thumbnail operation</li>
<li>Bugfix : Import meta data didn&#8217;t work correct for existing images</li>
<li>Bugfix : Fix onload bug for Chrome 4 in Shutter script</li>
<li>Bugfix : Remove various PHP notices for a better world</li>
<li>Removed : Canonical link is now part of WordPress 2.9</li>
</ul>

Wrapper";s:4:"slug";s:7:"shariff";s:7:"version";s:5:"4.3.0";s:6:"author";s:79:"<a href="https://de.wordpress.org/plugins/shariff/">Jan-Peter Lambeck & 3UU</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:34:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/3uu";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:3:"3uu";s:34:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/3uu";s:9:"starguide";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/starguide";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.4";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.7.7";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:62;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:63;s:15:"support_threads";i:7;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:74721;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2016-12-12 5:12pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-01";s:8:"homepage";s:41:"https://de.wordpress.org/plugins/shariff/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1122:"<p>The &#8220;original&#8221; share buttons automatically transmit data of your visitors to the social network sites as soon as they visit your website. They do not need to click on a share button for this and therefore have no choice, if they want their data to be send. The German computer magazin CT has developed &#8220;Shariff&#8221; <code>(/ˈʃɛɹɪf/)</code> that fullfills the strict data protection laws in Germany. This plugin adapts the Shariff concept and provides an easy to use solution for WordPress. We currently support 22 services like Facebook, Twitter, GooglePlus, Xing, LinkedIn and many more.</p>
<p>For more informations about the Shariff project check out the original <a href="https://github.com/heiseonline/shariff" rel="nofollow">GitHub project</a> and read about the project itself <a href="http://ct.de/shariff" rel="nofollow">c’t information page</a> (in German).</p>
<p>You can automatically add share buttons to posts, pages, the main blog page, product sites and many more as well as use it as a widget or add the shortcode <code>[shariff]</code> manually to your pages or themes.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:334:"<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere in your post and/or use the Shariff settings menu. </li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:12537:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere in your post and/or use the Shariff settings menu. </li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the Shariff buttons in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes.</p>
<p>You can use all options of the shorttag as described on the help tab in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the total amount of shares in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use</p>
<p>to simply output the total amount of shares for a post in the loop. It will return the number itself wrapped in a <code>&lt;span class="shariff-totalnumber"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</code> in order for the shariff.js to update the count. Also only cached data is used, in order to not slow down your site.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Is there an action hook to use the share counts every time they get updated?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use<br />
    function your_awesome_function( $share_counts ) {<br />
       // $share_counts is an array including all enabled services, the timestamp of the update and the url of the post.<br />
       // do stuff<br />
    }<br />
    add_action( &#8216;shariff_share_counts&#8217;, &#8216;your_awesome_function&#8217; );<br />
WARNING: This hook will get called A LOT. So be sure you know what you are doing.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the widget?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: It uses the same options that have been configured on the plugin options page. However, you can put in a shorttag that overwrites the default options. It has the same format as you use in posts. Take a look at the help section of the plugin options page for more information.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I change the options on a single post?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can change all options using the shorttag in the Shariff meta box on the right side of the post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why are shares not listed?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Shariff tries to protect the privacy of your visitors. In order to do this, the statistics have to be requested by your server, so social networks only see a request of your server and not from your visitor. However, we do not know, if you want this. Therefore it is not enabled by default.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I show the share counts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Enable it on the plugin options page in general or add <code>backend="on"</code> to the shariff shorttag in your post.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I still do not see share counts</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please have a look at the status tab on the plugin options page. It states wether share counts are enabled and if there is a problem with a service. Please also keep in mind that the plugin has a minimum refresh time of 60 seconds and that each service has their own cache as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why can&#8217;t I change the TTL to a smaller / bigger value?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: The time to live (TTL) value determines, if a share count of a post or page gets refreshed when someone visits this specific page / post of your blog. Too small values create too much useless traffic, too high values negate the goal of motivating visitors to also share a post. The value can be adjusted between 60 and 7200 seconds. Keep in mind, the actual lifespan depends on the age of the post as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I get the Facebook API error message &#8220;request limit reached&#8221;!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Facebook has a rate limit of 600 requests per 600 seconds per IP address. Especially in shared hosting environments many domains share the same IP address and therefore the same limit. To avoid this you can try to raise the TTL value or provide a Facebook App ID and Secret. Google &#8220;facebook app id secret&#8221; will provide many guides on how to get these.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the position of all buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the alignment options in the admin menu or checkout the<br />
style option.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the parameters &#8220;theme&#8221;, &#8220;orientation&#8221; and &#8220;buttonsize&#8221;. They work mostly like the original code parameters that are explained at http://heiseonline.github.io/shariff/ Or you can have a look at the test page at http://shariff.3uu.net/shariff-sample-page-with-all-options to get an<br />
overview. But please be warned: This is a test page! It is possible that you find features that are only provided in the development version. Use it only to get an impression of the design options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design of a single button?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: If you are a CSS guru please feel free to modify the css file. But of course this is a bad idea, because all changes will be destroyed with the next update! Instead take a look at the style and class attribute of the shorttag. If you put in any value it will create a DIV container with the ID &#8220;ShariffSC&#8221; around the buttons. If you are really a CSS guru you will know what does the magic from here on out. 😉</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want the buttons to stay fixed while scrolling!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: No problem. Just use the style attribute to add some CSS to the shorttag. For example in a widget (adjust the width as needed):<br />
    [shariff style=&#8221;position:fixed;width:250px&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well. It also works with the CSS style option on the plugins design options page, if you really want this applied to all buttons on your page.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a horizontal line above my Shariff buttons!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the headline option on the design tab. For example, enter the following code to create a horizontal line and a headline:</p>
<p>Please share this post:</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a different or no headline in a single widget, post or page!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Use the headline attribute to add or remove it. For example, you can use the following shorttag to remove a headline set on the plugins options page in a single widget:<br />
    [shariff headline=&#8221;&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I add [shariff] on all posts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes, check out the plugin options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: But I want to hide it on a single post!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Do you really know what you want? 😉 However, it is possible. Write anywhere in your post &#8220;hideshariff&#8221;. It will be removed and Shariff will not be added. You can also use &#8220;/hideshariff&#8221; to write &#8220;hideshariff&#8221; in your post. You might also want to take a look at the Shariff meta box on the right side of your post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What are the differences between the two Shariff plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: One is developed by us, one by someone else. 😉 The main difference is that this plugin has a few more options and a great support. 🙂 Neither of the plugins are &#8220;official&#8221; or directly developed by Heise.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Does it work with a CDN?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Pinterest does not show an image!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can add media=&#8221;http://wwww.example.com/yourImage.png&#8221;<br />
within the [shariff] shorttag or add it in on the plugin options page &#8211; of course with the link to your image.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I set a fixed URL to share?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the &#8220;url&#8221; parameter within the shortcode<br />
    [shariff url=&#8221;http://www.example.com/&#8221;]<br />
This is also available within widgets. However, it is not a good idea to manipulate the URI, because it could mislead your visitors. So you should only use it, if this is really needed and you do really know what you are doing. Therefore it is not available on the plugin options page in general.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What is the differenz between the services `mailform` and `mailto´?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: mailform will provide an e-mail form on top of the post or page and mailto will draw a link with the mailto-protocol to open the default e-mail application of the client.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What happened to `mail`?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: mail was replaced with mailform to provide an easier way of distinguishing between the two types of mail buttons.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I disable the mail form completely?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes, take a look at the Mail Form tab on the plugin options page.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What happened to the Twitter share counts and what is OpenShareCount?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please read: https://www.jplambeck.de/twitter-saveoursharecounts/</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: The buttons are not correctly beeing shown on my custom theme!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please make sure that wp_footer(); has been added to your theme. For more information please visit: https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_footer</p>
</p>
<h4>EXPERIMENTAL FEATURES</h4>
<p>
<p>Features marked as &#8220;experimental&#8221; in the admin menu are experimental! This means: We think it is a good extension to our plugin that we would like to include in a future version, but we are not sure yet about the best solution that works for all or most people. So please feel free to use and test it and report back to us about it. Experimental features might be removed in an update, if it does not work out. So please pay close attention to our changelog!</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What is the external API feature?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: First of all: Usually you do not need it! The plugin requests all share counts itself. However, there are some reasons to put the backend on another server:<br />
&#8211; avoid requests from you WP server to all the social networks<br />
&#8211; use a more powerful server for the statistic<br />
&#8211; use the original backend implementation of Heise or your own solution<br />
&#8211; make your own backend available for more than one WP installation<br />
But please have in mind that there are also some good reasons not to use external servers:<br />
&#8211; you need an additional installation of WP and the plugin or have to create your own implementation of a Shariff backend<br />
&#8211; some plugin settings (backend checks, statistic, etc.) will only work on the external server<br />
&#8211; you have to use SHARIFF_FRONTENDS as an array with all your frontend domains to enable the backend or find your own solution<br />
&#8211; we CANNOT provide support for your own implementation</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the external API?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: In the statistic settings fill in the URL to the API of the external server. For the WordPress installation on the external server you have to create a &#8220;constant&#8221; called SHARIFF_FRONTENDS to permit other domains to use it. Please have in mind that you have to fill in all subdomains you want to use! The domains must be defined like this:<br />
    define( &#8216;SHARIFF_FRONTENDS&#8217;, &#8216;example.com|www.example.com|blog.example.com|another-domain.com&#8217; );</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What does &#8220;Request external API directly.&#8221; means?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: By default, the browser request the share counts from the server your site is running on. If you have entered an external API your server will then request the counts from this external API instead of fetching them itself. Therefore, the external server will only see the IP from your server and not the one from your visitors. If you check this option, the browser of your visitors will instead directly request the share counts from the external API and therefore reveal their IP address to them. This might be faster, but it is less secure. Please also make sure to set the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header right. If your site is available using https, your external API will need to be reached by https as well. Otherwise the request will get blocked for security reasons. All options and features (e.g. the ranking tab) regarding the statistic will only work on the external server.</p>
</p>
<h4>KNOWN BUGS</h4>
<p>
<p>These are bugs or unexpected glitches that we know of, but that do not<br />
have an impact on the majority of users, are not security relevant and will perhaps be<br />
fixed in the future &#8211; if we have time to spend or you provide us with a lot of &#8220;K&#xF6;lsch&#8221; 😉</p>
<ul>
<li>If the first post on the start page is password protected and Shariff is<br />
disabled on protected posts, a widget at the end of the loop will not be<br />
rendered.</li>
</ul>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:6203:"<h4>4.3.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>new service Odnoklassniki (thanks to rockhit)</li>
<li>new meta box allows for individual settings per post or page</li>
<li>new option to hide share counts that are zero</li>
<li>new option to disable dynamic cache lifespan (not recommended)</li>
<li>new option to set the button size to small, medium or large</li>
<li>new option to add a custom class to the container around Shariff</li>
<li>new option to open links in a popup (thanks to jackennils)</li>
<li>new option to use NewShareCount instead of OpenShareCount (Twitter)</li>
<li>added timestamp variable to be accessible via shortcode</li>
<li>fixed post timestamp for caching under certain conditions</li>
<li>fixed Facebook share count error for never crawled pages</li>
<li>fixed empty tab after sharing on certain mobile devices</li>
<li>fixed custom title attribute (thanks to kschlager)</li>
<li>updated Flattr user id for the future (thanks to poetaster)</li>
<li>reduced changelog on wordpress.org (thanks to timse201)</li>
<li>minor css improvements</li>
<li>updated help section</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.2.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fixed WhatsApp button on Android when using Chrome</li>
<li>fixed Shariff being added to RSS feeds under certain conditions</li>
<li>updated to latest Facebook Graph API for share count requests</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>new option to set the rate limit for sending mails using the mail form</li>
<li>added home url as fallback for share count requests</li>
<li>added further anti-spam prevention mechanics</li>
<li>added noopener and noreferrer to share links</li>
<li>fixed double encoding of share count request links</li>
<li>updated media uploader request for translation</li>
<li>updated handling of admin notices following WordPress core</li>
<li>tested and optimized for WordPress 4.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>new fallback for share count requests in case pretty permalinks are disabled</li>
<li>new filter shariff3UU_render_atts to change options on the fly (thx Ov3rfly)</li>
<li>fixed share title in cases with html encoded characters</li>
<li>fixed double counting on ranking tab under certain conditions</li>
<li>fixed php info notice in admin notices</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>new option to disable the Shariff buttons outside of the main loop</li>
<li>fixed Facebook App ID request</li>
<li>minor css fix</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>new design option to set a custom button color for all buttons</li>
<li>new design option to set a border radius for the round theme (up to a square)</li>
<li>new design option to hide all buttons until the page is fully loaded</li>
<li>new mailform option to use a html anchor (again)</li>
<li>new statistic option to fill the cache automatically</li>
<li>new statistic option to set the amount of posts for the ranking tab</li>
<li>new statistic option to use share counts with PHP &lt; 5.4</li>
<li>fixed preventing buttons from beeing added to excerpts under certain conditions</li>
<li>fixed urlencoding of share count requests</li>
<li>improved handling of wrong or mistyped service entries</li>
<li>minor bug fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>new workaround for sites running PHP 5.2 and older</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>new option for WordPress installations with REST API not reachable in root</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>fixed an error in combination with bbpress</li>
<li>fixed ab error on very old PHP versions</li>
<li>fixed ranking tab</li>
<li>minor css improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.5</h4>
<ul>

<li>fixed xmlns for w3c</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.4</h4>

<li>minor css fixes</li>

<h4>4.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>fixed mobile services not showing on certain tablets</li>
<li>fixed type error on totalnumber when cache is empty</li>
<li>fixed share count requests when WordPress is installed in a subdirectory</li>
<li>fixed urlencoding of share url, title and media</li>
<li>added width and height to SVGs to prevent large initial icons prior to css</li>
<li>new classes shariff-buttons and shariff-link added</li>
<li>removed local translation files due to switching to wordpress.org language packs</li>
<li>minor css resets added</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>added minor css resets to prevent influence of theme css</li>
<li>fixed LinkedIn share link</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>prevent php warning messages on unsuccessful includes while WP_DEBUG is active</li>
<li>changed text domain to match plugin slug</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>complete overhaul of the plugin core</li>
<li>buttons now also work without JavaScript</li>
<li>icon font has been removed and replaced with SVGs</li>
<li>share counts now use the WP REST API</li>
<li>share counts now always show the last cached counts prior to updating them</li>
<li>fixed duplicated share count requests</li>
<li>new ranking tab shows the shares of your last 100 posts</li>
<li>new service pocket</li>
<li>new option to show the total amount of shares in the headline with %total</li>
<li>new option to use the total amount of shares in your theme (see FAQ)</li>
<li>new action hook shariff_share_counts (see FAQ)</li>
<li>new option to change the priority of the shortcode filter</li>
<li>new support for selective refresh introduced in WP 4.5</li>
<li>new external API feature replaces the external host option (experimental, see FAQ)</li>
<li>new support for SCRIPT_DEBUG</li>
<li>css and js files are now only loaded on pages with Shariff buttons</li>
<li>improved compatibility with plugin Autoptimize (force scripts in head)</li>
<li>improved compatibility with multiple caching plugins</li>
<li>all shortcodes are now being stripped from the mail message body</li>
<li>fixed potential double sending of mails</li>
<li>removed all jQuery dependencies</li>
<li>requires at least WordPress 4.4 (only for share counts)</li>
<li>we no longer support IE 8 (if it ever worked)</li>
<li>updated status tab</li>
<li>updated help section</li>
<li>minor bug fixes</li>
<li>code cleanup</li>
</ul>
<p>The complete changelog can be found here: https://plugins.svn.wordpress.org/shariff/trunk/changelog.txt</p>
";s:11:"screenshots";s:1775:"<ol><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1175769"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1175769" alt="Differently styled share buttons (all small)."></a><p>Differently styled share buttons (all small).</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1175769"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1175769" alt="Basic options."></a><p>Basic options.</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-3.png?rev=1175769"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-3.png?rev=1175769" alt="Design options."></a><p>Design options.</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-4.png?rev=1175769"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-4.png?rev=1175769" alt="Advanced options."></a><p>Advanced options.</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-5.png?rev=1175769"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-5.png?rev=1175769" alt="Mail form options."></a><p>Mail form options.</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-6.png?rev=1175788"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-6.png?rev=1175788" alt="Help section."></a><p>Help section.</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-7.png?rev=1175788"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-7.png?rev=1175788" alt="Manual shorttag with options in a post."></a><p>Manual shorttag with options in a post.</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-8.png?rev=1175788"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff/assets/screenshot-8.png?rev=1175788" alt="Widget menu. 1.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.2";s:66:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wf-cookie-consent.1.1.2.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:60:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wf-cookie-consent.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:26:"https://www.wunderfarm.com";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:70:"https://ps.w.org/wf-cookie-consent/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1330603";s:2:"2x";s:70:"https://ps.w.org/wf-cookie-consent/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1330603";}}s:13:"wordpress-seo";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:9:"Yoast SEO";s:4:"slug";s:13:"wordpress-seo";s:7:"version";s:3:"5.8";s:6:"author";s:43:"<a href="https://yoast.com/">Team Yoast</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/joostdevalk";s:12:"contributors";a:6:{s:5:"yoast";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/yoast";s:11:"joostdevalk";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/joostdevalk";s:9:"tacoverdo";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/tacoverdo";s:9:"omarreiss";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/omarreiss";s:7:"atimmer";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/atimmer";s:8:"jipmoors";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/jipmoors";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.6";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.1";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:6:{i:5;i:16067;i:4;i:425;i:3;i:114;i:2;i:83;i:1;i:433;i:0;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:17123;s:15:"support_threads";i:370;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:267;s:10:"downloaded";i:75693929;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-28 3:54pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-10-11";s:8:"homepage";s:102:"https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/#utm_source=wpadmin&utm_medium=plugin&utm_campaign=wpseoplugin";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:11265:"<p>WordPress out of the box is already technically quite a good platform for SEO. This was true when Joost wrote his original <a href="https://yoast.com/articles/wordpress-seo/" rel="nofollow">WordPress SEO</a> article in 2008 (updated every few months) and it&#8217;s still true today, but that doesn&#8217;t mean you can&#8217;t improve it further! This plugin is written from the ground up by Joost de Valk and his team at <a href="https://yoast.com/" rel="nofollow">Yoast</a> to improve your site&#8217;s SEO on <em>all</em> needed aspects. While this <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO plugin</a> goes the extra mile to take care of all the technical optimization, more on that below, it first and foremost helps you write better content.  Yoast SEO forces you to choose a focus keyword when you&#8217;re writing your articles, and then makes sure you use that focus keyword everywhere.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Premium Support</strong><br />
  The Yoast team does not always provide active support for the Yoast SEO plugin on the WordPress.org forums. One-on-one email support is available to people who bought the <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo-premium/" rel="nofollow">Premium Yoast SEO plugin</a> only.<br />
  Note that the Premium SEO plugin has several extra features too, including the option to have multiple focus keywords and a redirect manager, so it might be well worth your investment!</p>
<p>You should also check out the <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/local-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast Local SEO</a>, <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/news-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast News SEO</a> and <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/video-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast Video SEO</a> extensions to Yoast SEO. These of course come with support too.</p>
<p><strong>Bug Reports</strong><br />
  Bug reports for Yoast SEO are <a href="https://github.com/Yoast/wordpress-seo" rel="nofollow">welcomed on GitHub</a>. Please note GitHub is <em>not</em> a support forum, and issues that aren&#8217;t properly qualified as bugs will be closed.</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Write better content with Yoast SEO</h4>
<p>Using the snippet preview, you can see a rendering of what your post or page will look like in the search results, whether your title is too long or too short, and whether your meta description makes sense in the context of a search result. This way the plugin will help you not only increase rankings but also increase the click through rate for organic search results.</p>
<h4>Page Analysis</h4>
<p>The Yoast SEO plugins <a href="https://yoast.com/content-seo-wordpress-linkdex/" rel="nofollow">Page Analysis</a> functionality checks simple things you&#8217;re bound to forget. It checks, for instance, if you have images in your post and whether they have an alt tag containing the focus keyword for that post. It also checks whether your posts are long enough, whether you&#8217;ve written a meta description and if that meta description contains your focus keyword, if you&#8217;ve used any subheadings within your post, etc. etc.</p>
<p>The plugin also allows you to write meta titles and descriptions for all your category, tag and custom taxonomy archives, giving you the option to further optimize those pages.</p>
<p>Combined, this plugin makes sure that your content is the type of content search engines will love!</p>
<h4>Technical WordPress Search Engine Optimization</h4>
<p>While out of the box WordPress is pretty good for SEO, it needs some tweaks here and there. This Yoast SEO plugin guides you through some of the settings needed, for instance by reminding you to enable pretty permalinks. But it also goes beyond that, by automatically optimizing and inserting the meta tags and link elements that Google and other search engines like so much:</p>
<h4>Meta &amp; Link Elements</h4>
<p>With the Yoast SEO plugin you can control which pages Google shows in its search results and which pages it doesn&#8217;t show. By default, it will tell search engines to index all of your pages, including category and tag archives, but to only show the first pages in the search results. It&#8217;s not very useful for a user to end up on the third page of your &#8220;personal&#8221; category, right?</p>
<p>WordPress itself only shows canonical link elements on single pages, but Yoast SEO makes it output canonical link elements everywhere. Google has recently announced they would also use <code>rel="next"</code> and <code>rel="prev"</code> link elements in the <code>head</code> section of your paginated archives. This plugin adds those automatically. See <a href="https://yoast.com/rel-next-prev-paginated-archives/" rel="nofollow">this post</a> for more info.</p>
<h4>XML Sitemaps</h4>
<p>The Yoast SEO plugin has the most advanced XML Sitemaps functionality in any WordPress plugin. Once you check the box, it automatically creates XML sitemaps and notifies Google &amp; Bing of the sitemaps&#8217; existence. These XML sitemaps include the images in your posts &amp; pages too, so that your images may be found better in the search engines too.</p>
<p>These XML Sitemaps will even work on large sites, because of how they&#8217;re created, using one index sitemap that links to sub-sitemaps for each 1,000 posts. They will also work with custom post types and custom taxonomies automatically, while giving you the option to remove those from the XML sitemap should you wish to.</p>
<p>Because of using <a href="https://yoast.com/xsl-stylesheet-xml-sitemap/" rel="nofollow">XSL stylesheets for these XML Sitemaps</a>, the XML sitemaps are easily readable for the human eye too, so you can spot things that shouldn&#8217;t be in there.</p>
<h4>RSS Optimization</h4>
<p>Are you being outranked by scrapers? Instead of cursing at them, use them to your advantage! By automatically adding a link to your RSS feed pointing back to the original article, you&#8217;re telling the search engine where they should be looking for the original. This way, the Yoast SEO plugin increases your own chance of ranking for your chosen keywords and gets rid of scrapers in one go!</p>
<h4>Breadcrumbs</h4>
<p>If your theme is compatible, and themes based on for instance Genesis or by WooThemes often are, you can use the built-in Breadcrumbs functionality. This allows you to create an easy navigation that is great for both users and search engines, and will support the search engines in understanding the structure of your site.</p>
<p>Making your theme compatible isn&#8217;t hard either, check <a href="https://kb.yoast.com/kb/implement-wordpress-seo-breadcrumbs/" rel="nofollow">these instructions</a>.</p>
<h4>Edit your .htaccess and robots.txt file</h4>
<p>Using the built-in file editor, you can edit your WordPress blog&#8217;s <code>.htaccess</code> and <code>robots.txt</code> file, giving you direct access to the two most powerful files, from an SEO perspective, in your WordPress install.</p>
<h4>Social Integration</h4>
<p>SEO and Social Media are heavily intertwined. That&#8217;s why this plugin also comes with a Facebook OpenGraph implementation and will soon also support Google+ sharing tags.</p>
<h4>Multi-Site Compatible</h4>
<p>The Yoast SEO plugin, unlike some others, is fully Multi-Site compatible. The XML Sitemaps work fine in all setups and you even have the option, in the Network settings, to copy the settings from one blog to another, or make blogs default to the settings for a specific blog.</p>
<h4>Import &amp; Export functionality</h4>
<p>If you have multiple blogs, setting up plugins like this one on all of them might seem like a daunting task. Except that it&#8217;s not, because what you can do is simple: you set up the plugin once. You then export your settings and simply import them on all your other sites. It&#8217;s that simple!</p>
<h4>Import functionality for other WordPress SEO plugins</h4>
<p>If you&#8217;ve used All In One SEO Pack or HeadSpace2 before using this plugin, you might want to import all your old titles and descriptions. You can do that easily using the built-in import functionality. There&#8217;s also import functionality for some of the older Yoast plugins, like Robots Meta and RSS footer.</p>
<p>Should you have a need to import from another SEO plugin to Yoast SEO, or from a theme like Genesis or Thesis, you can use the <a href="https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/seo-data-transporter/" rel="nofollow">SEO Data Transporter</a> plugin, which will easily convert your SEO meta data from and to a whole set of plugins like Platinum SEO, SEO Ultimate, Greg&#8217;s High Performance SEO, and themes like Headway, Hybrid, WooFramework, Catalyst etc.</p>
<p>Read <a href="https://yoast.com/all-in-one-seo-pack-migration/" rel="nofollow">this migration guide</a> if you still have questions about migrating from another SEO plugin to Yoast SEO.</p>
<h4>Yoast SEO Plugin in your Language!</h4>
<p>Currently a huge translation project is underway, translating Yoast SEO in as much as 24 languages. So far, the translations for French and Dutch are complete, but we still need help on a lot of other languages, so if you&#8217;re good at translating, please join us at <a href="http://translate.yoast.com" rel="nofollow">translate.yoast.com</a>.</p>
<h4>News SEO</h4>
<p>Be sure to also check out the premium <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/news-seo/" rel="nofollow">News SEO module</a> if you need Google News Sitemaps. It tightly integrates with Yoast SEO to give you the combined power of News Sitemaps and full Search Engine Optimization.</p>
<h4>Further Reading</h4>
<p>For more info, check out the following articles:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <a href="https://kb.yoast.com/kb/category/yoast-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Knowledgebase</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://yoast.com/articles/wordpress-seo/" rel="nofollow">WordPress SEO &#8211; The definitive Guide by Yoast</a>.</li>
<li>Once you have great SEO, you&#8217;ll need the <a href="https://yoast.com/articles/wordpress-hosting/" rel="nofollow">best WordPress Hosting</a>.</li>
<li>The <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Plugin</a> official homepage.</li>
<li>Other <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/" rel="nofollow">WordPress Plugins</a> by the same team.</li>
<li>Follow Yoast on <a href="https://facebook.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a> &amp; <a href="http://twitter.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>From within WordPress</h3>
<ol>
<li>Visit &#8216;Plugins &gt; Add New&#8217;</li>
<li>Search for &#8216;Yoast SEO&#8217;</li>
<li>Activate Yoast SEO from your Plugins page.</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>Manually</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>wordpress-seo</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the Yoast SEO plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>After activation</h3>
<ol>
<li>You should see (a notice to start) the Yoast SEO configuration wizard.</li>
<li>Go through the configuration wizard and set up the plugin for your site.</li>
<li>You&#8217;re done!</li>
</ol>

Br&auml;kling</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/braekling";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:9:"braekling";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/braekling";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.4";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:72;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:83;s:15:"support_threads";i:5;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:5;s:10:"downloaded";i:1365656;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-10-15 7:59pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-06-04";s:8:"homepage";s:45:"http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-piwik/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:4502:"<p>This plugin uses the Piwik API to show your Piwik statistics in your WordPress dashboard. It&#8217;s also able to add the Piwik tracking code to your blog and to do some modifications to the tracking code. Additionally, WP-Piwik supports WordPress networks and manages multiple sites and their tracking codes.</p>
<p>To use this plugin the Piwik web analytics application is required. If you do not already have a Piwik setup (e.g., provided by your web hosting service), you have two simple options: use either a <a href="http://piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">self-hosted Piwik</a> or a <a href="https://www.innocraft.cloud/?pk_campaign=WP-Piwik" rel="nofollow">cloud-hosted Piwik by InnoCraft</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Requirements:</strong> PHP 7.0 (or higher), WordPress 4.0 (or higher), Piwik 3.0 (or higher)</p>
<p><strong>Languages:</strong> English, Albanian, Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil). Partially supported: Azerbaijani, Belarusian, Hindi, Lithuanian, Luxembourgish, Norwegian, Persian, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish, Ukrainian</p>
<h4>What is Piwik?</h4>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/OslfF_EH81g?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span><br />
<a href="https://piwik.org/what-is-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Learn more.</a></p>
<h4>First steps</h4>
<ul>
<li>Learn how to install your own Piwik instance: <a href="https://piwik.org/docs/requirements/" rel="nofollow">Requirements</a>, <a href="https://piwik.org/docs/installation-optimization/" rel="nofollow">Installation</a>.</li>
<li>If you need support about Piwik, please have a look at the <a href="https://forum.piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">Piwik forums</a>.</li>
<li>Finally, you can start <a href="https://piwik.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/" rel="nofollow">setting up WP-Piwik</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Shortcodes</h4>
<p>You can use following shortcodes if activated:</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="overview" title="" period="day" date="yesterday"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows overview table like WP-Piwik&#8217;s overview dashboard. See Piwik API documentation on VisitsSummary.get to get more information on period and day. Multiple data arrays will be cumulated. If you fill the title attribute, its content will be shown in the table&#8217;s title.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="opt-out" language="en" width="100%" height="200px"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the Piwik opt-out Iframe. You can change the Iframe&#8217;s language by the language attribute (e.g. de for German language) and its width and height using the corresponding attributes.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="post" range="last30" key="sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the chosen keys value related to the current post. You can define a range (format: lastN, previousN or YYYY-MM-DD,YYYY-MM-DD) and the desired value&#8217;s key (e.g., sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors, nb_visits or nb_hits &#8211; for details see Piwik&#8217;s API method Actions.getPageUrl using a range).</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik]
</code></pre>
<p>is equal to <em>[wp-piwik module=&#8221;overview&#8221; title=&#8221;&#8221; period=&#8221;day&#8221; date=&#8221;yesterday&#8221;]</em>.</p>
<h4>Credits</h4>
<ul>
<li>Graphs powered by <a href="http://www.jqplot.com/" rel="nofollow">jqPlot</a> (GPL 2.0 and MIT) and and <a href="http://omnipotent.net/jquery.sparkline/" rel="nofollow">jQuery Sparklines</a> (New BSD License).</li>
<li>All translators at the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</li>
<li>Donations: Marco L., Rolf W., Tobias U., Lars K., Donna F., Kevin D., Ramos S., Thomas M., John C., Andreas G., Ben M., Myra R. I., Carlos U. R.-S., Oleg I., M. <li>All users who send me mails containing criticism, commendation, feature requests and bug reports &#8211; you help me to make WP-Piwik much better!</li>
</ul>
<p>Thank you all!</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:2426:"<h4>General Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>First, you have to set up a running Piwik instance. You can get Piwik <a href="http://piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">here</a> and its documentation <a href="http://piwik.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>If you want to update your Piwik instance, you should set your WordPress blog to maintenance while the update process is running.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Install WP-Piwik on a simple WordPress blog</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload the full <code>wp-piwik</code> directory into your <code>wp-content/plugins</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Open the new &#8216;Settings/WP-Piwik Settings&#8217; menu and follow the instructions to configure your Piwik connection. Save settings.</li>
<li>If you have view access to multiple site stats and did not enable &#8220;auto config&#8221;, choose your blog and save settings again.</li>
<li>Look at &#8216;Dashboard/WP-Piwik&#8217; to see your site stats.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install WP-Piwik on a WordPress blog network (WPMU/WP multisite)</h4>
<p>There are two differents methods to use WP-Piwik in a multisite environment:</p>
<ul>
<li>As a Site Specific Plugin it behaves like a plugin installed on a simple WordPress blog. Each user can enable, configure and use WP-Piwik on his own. Users can even use their own Piwik instances (and accordingly they have to). </li>
<li>Using WP-Piwik as a Network Plugin equates to a central approach. A single Piwik instance is used and the site admin configures the plugin completely. Users are just allowed to see their own statistics, site admins can see each blog&#8217;s stats.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Site Specific Plugin</em></p>
<p>Just add WP-Piwik to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable the Plugins page for individual site administrators. Each user has to enable and configure WP-Piwik on his own if he want to use the plugin.</p>
<p><em>Network Plugin</em></p>
<p>The Network Plugin support is still experimental. Please test it on your own (e.g. using a local copy of your WP multisite) before you use it in an user context.</p>
<p>Add WP-Piwik to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable it as <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network#WordPress_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Network Plugin</a>. Users can access their own statistics, site admins can access each blog&#8217;s statistics and the plugin&#8217;s configuration.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:6280:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>General Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>First, you have to set up a running Piwik instance. You can get Piwik <a href="http://piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">here</a> and its documentation <a href="http://piwik.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>If you want to update your Piwik instance, you should set your WordPress blog to maintenance while the update process is running.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Install WP-Piwik on a simple WordPress blog</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload the full <code>wp-piwik</code> directory into your <code>wp-content/plugins</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Open the new &#8216;Settings/WP-Piwik Settings&#8217; menu and follow the instructions to configure your Piwik connection. Save settings.</li>
<li>If you have view access to multiple site stats and did not enable &#8220;auto config&#8221;, choose your blog and save settings again.</li>
<li>Look at &#8216;Dashboard/WP-Piwik&#8217; to see your site stats.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install WP-Piwik on a WordPress blog network (WPMU/WP multisite)</h4>
<p>There are two differents methods to use WP-Piwik in a multisite environment:</p>
<ul>
<li>As a Site Specific Plugin it behaves like a plugin installed on a simple WordPress blog. Each user can enable, configure and use WP-Piwik on his own. Users can even use their own Piwik instances (and accordingly they have to). </li>
<li>Using WP-Piwik as a Network Plugin equates to a central approach. A single Piwik instance is used and the site admin configures the plugin completely. Users are just allowed to see their own statistics, site admins can see each blog&#8217;s stats.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Site Specific Plugin</em></p>
<p>Just add WP-Piwik to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable the Plugins page for individual site administrators. Each user has to enable and configure WP-Piwik on his own if he want to use the plugin.</p>
<p><em>Network Plugin</em></p>
<p>The Network Plugin support is still experimental. Please test it on your own (e.g. using a local copy of your WP multisite) before you use it in an user context.</p>
<p>Add WP-Piwik to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable it as <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network#WordPress_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Network Plugin</a>. Users can access their own statistics, site admins can access each blog&#8217;s statistics and the plugin&#8217;s configuration.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I find the Piwik URL and the Piwik auth token?</h4>
<p>
<p>To use this plugin you will need your own Piwik instance. If you do not already have a Piwik setup, you have two simple options: use either a <a href="http://piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">self-hosted Piwik</a> or <a href="https://www.innocraft.cloud/?pk_campaign=WP-Piwik" rel="nofollow">cloud-hosted Piwik by InnoCraft</a>.</p>
<p>As soon as Piwik works, you&#8217;ll be able to configure WP-Piwik: The Piwik URL is the same URL you use to access your Piwik, e.g. for the demo site: http://demo.piwik.org. The auth token is some kind of a secret password, which allows WP-Piwik to get the necessary data from Piwik. To get your auth token, log in to Piwik, click at the preferences gear icon (top right) and click at &#8220;API&#8221; (left sidebar menu, near the bottom).</p>
<p>You can get a more detailed description here: https://piwik.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/</p>
</p>
<h4>I get this message: &#8220;WP-Piwik was not able to connect to Piwik using our configuration&#8221;. How to proceed?</h4>
<p>
<p>First, please make sure your configuration is valid, e.g., if you are using the right Piwik URL (see description above). Then, go to the &#8220;Support&#8221; tab and run the test script. This test script will try to get some information from Piwik and shows the full response. Usually, the response output gives a clear hint what&#8217;s wrong:</p>
<p>The response output contains&#8230;<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden</strong>: WP-Piwik is not allowed to connect to Piwik. Please check your Piwik server&#8217;s configuration. Maybe you are using a password protection via .htaccess or you are blocking requests from localhost/127.0.0.1. If you aren’t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found</strong>: The Piwik URL is wrong. Try to copy &amp; paste the URL you use to access Piwik itself via browser.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and no further HTTP response code: The Piwik server does not respond. Very often, this is caused by firewall or mod_security settings. Check your server logfiles to get further information. If you aren’t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.</p>
</p>
<h4>PHP Compatibility Checker reports PHP7 compatbility issues with WP-Piwik.</h4>
<p>
<p>The Compatibility Checker shows two false positives. WP-Piwik is 100% PHP7 compatible, you can ignore the report.</p>
</p>
<h4>Overview shortcode shows no unique visitors using a yearly range.</h4>
<p>
<p>See <a href="http://piwik.org/faq/how-to/#faq_113" rel="nofollow">Piwik FAQ</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>WP-Piwik only shows the first 100 sites of my multisite network. How can I get all other sites?</h4>
<p>
<p>The Piwik API is limited to 100 sites by default. Add the following line to the section [General] of Piwik&#8217;s config/config.ini.php file:</p>
<pre><code>API_datatable_default_limit = 1000
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>Tracking does not work on HostGator!</h4>
<p>
<p>Try to enable the &#8220;avoid mod_security&#8221; option (WP-Piwik settings, Tracking tab) or create a mod_security whitelist.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I contribute to WP-Piwik as a translator?</h4>
<p>
<p>You like to contribute to WP-Piwik translations? Please use the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</p>
<p>Of course, I will add missing languages if requested, and I will also upload the existing language files of older WP-Piwik releases.</p>
<p>If you can&#8217;t (or don not want to) use transifex, you can also translate languages/wp-piwik.pot delivered with WP-Piwik.</p>
<p>Thank you very much! 🙂</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:25330:"<h4>1.0.19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security fix: Escape request var</li>
<li>Language updates</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.18</h4>
<ul>
<li>WPML.org support: Use different site IDs for different languages</li>
<li>Ecommerce widgets</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Header issue solved which caused incompatibilities with other plugins like Yoast SEO</li>
<li>Update of InnoCraft cloud links (InnoCraft is the team behind Piwik)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid a broken page if Piwik is misconfigured and WordPress debugging enabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added InnoCraft Cloud support (the new service created by the people behind Piwik). Piwik.pro is still usable via HTTP mode, the configuration will be updated automatically.</li>
<li>Added search functionality to site browser</li>
<li>Added preload DNS option, see https://piwik.org/blog/2017/04/important-performance-optimizations-load-piwik-javascript-tracker-faster/</li>
<li>Added option to set link and download classes (expert settings)</li>
<li>Added option to choose which post types should be considered for annotations</li>
<li>Bugfix: Opening Piwik stats of a specific network site does not lead to the sitebrowser anymore</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid unnecessary notices</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid a warning in proxy script</li>
<li>Bugfix: NoScript code is working again</li>
<li>Replaced deprecated wp_get_sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Allow to modify the tracked user ID using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_user_id&#8221;</li>
<li>Bugfix: Output of &#8220;post&#8221; shortcode was incorrectly placed, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/post-shortcode-values-are-incorrectly-placed/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Usage of WP_PROXY_BYPASS_HOSTS, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/bug-considering-wp_proxy_bypass_hosts-in-proxy-setups/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Proxy script did not work with cURL, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Piwik/issues/48</li>
<li>Bugfix: RSS feed tracking did not use proxy URL</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221; was extended by a site ID parameter, so it will deliver the Piwik site ID of the created site</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed an issue with Piwik site creation</li>
<li>Bugfix: Allow changes of a manually defined tracking code on networks, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Piwik/issues/46</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Readme typo fixes (thx to ujdhesa)</li>
<li>Perform your own code after site creation by using the action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221;</li>
<li>Improved caching ID to avoid interferences, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Piwik/issues/42</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.12</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed notices and warnings</li>
<li>Allow to modify the tracking code using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_code&#8221;</li>
<li>Network: Don&#8217;t show plugin overview settings link on individual sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security improvements</li>
<li>Removed some division by zero warnings</li>
<li>Option to disable SSL host verification (additional to peer verification)</li>
<li>Overview widget: Do not show unique visitors row if value is not available</li>
<li>Bugfix: Post shortcode is fixed and will work again</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security fix</li>
</ul>

</ul>
<h4>1.0.8</h4>
