<li>Bugfix: Fixed user tracking (moved the user tracking changes from general modifications to runtime modifications)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed namespace error. Thx to thelfensdrfer, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Piwik/pull/18</li>
<li>Bugfix: Warning on blog name change, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/wp-piwik-triggers-warning-when-changing-blog-name</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.7</h4>

<li>Feature: Allow a local config file to affect the proxy script, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/proxy-config-require-wp-loadphp-path</li>
<li>Bugfix: No script tag is not auto-inserted if the tracking code is manually defined.</li>
</ul>

</ul>

<h4>0.10.0.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: In some cases the update message did not disappear -&gt; fixed</li>
<li>Important change: If you want to upgrade from 0.8.x to 0.10.x, please install 0.9.9.18 first: https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.0.9.9.18.zip</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Settings link in admin notices fixed</li>
<li>Bugfix: Shortcode result will appear where expected</li>
<li>Bugfix: 0.9.9.18 settings will be kept (if WP-Piwik was not reconfigured after updating to 0.10.0.3, yet)</li>
<li>Feature: If Piwik returns an error instead of a tracking code, this error will be visible</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Public beta of WP-Piwik 1.0</li>
<li>Full refactored code</li>
<li>Feature: Limit referral cookie lifetime</li>
<li>Feature: Enable content tracking</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Define additional file extensions for tracking downloads</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a POT file to support translators (Note: 1.0 will change a lot, so please don&#8217;t spend too much time in translating the current version, e.g., by creating an all new translation. With 1.0 I will also offer a translation platform to support your work.)</li>
<li>Improvement: If necessary, you can force Piwik to use HTTP or HTTPS now (e.g., to avoid redirections from http to https)</li>
<li>Avoided a naming collision with Woo Theme</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Updated the Piwik proxy script and added cURL support if url_fopen is not available</li>
<li>Bugfix: Setup bug, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/piwik-urlpath-not-saved</li>
<li>Bugfix: CDN URL notice, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/tracking-cdn-blank-gives-php-notice-which-breaks-the-trackback-js-code</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed zlib compression notice, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/v09914-is-bad</li>
<li>Bugfix: Proxy script label links to proxy script checkbox</li>
<li>Fixed a typo in German language file</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: PHP API causes plain text output issue (see 0.9.9.11)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Shortcode output translated</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: One more commit error</li>
<li>Bugfix: Adding up problem related to the overview widget</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixes missing brackets on ob_start</li>
<li>Hotfix: Adds /0.9.9.15 to js/index.php to force a reload</li>
<li>Bugifx: Replaced broken support link</li>
<li>Added a bitcoin donation link</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Commit errors in 0.9.9.13</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Only activate/ load admin components if an admin page is actually loaded. Thanks to Michael!</li>
<li>Bugfix: Proxy tracking will work again. Piwik 2.7 or higher is recommended.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid a PHP notice in dashboard</li>
<li>NOTE: If you update Piwik and use the &#8220;add tracking code&#8221; feature, please also update your WP-Piwik tracking code: Just open the WP-Piwik tracking code settings and save them again. </li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.12</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid forced relogin on site change (WP network)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid multiple annotations on post updates</li>
<li>Bugfix: Use mergeSubdomains instead of mergeAliasURLs</li>
<li>Feature: Added mergeAliasURLs as additional feature</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: PHP API causes plain text output issue, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/bug-cant-access-to-tabs-in-setting-after-configuration</li>
<li>Bugfix: PHP API causes WordPress multisite login issue, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/causes-multisite-superadmin-subsite-login-problem</li>
<li>Bugfix: Removed PHP warning if annotations are enabled and annotations will work again, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/warning-message-everywhere-in-the-backend-call_user_func_array-expects</li>
<li>Feature: &#8220;Track visitors across all subdomains&#8221; script changes are done by Piwik now, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/track-across-subdomains-wp-on-subdomain?replies=2</li>
<li>Update: Flattr API update</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Multisite login issue, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/0999-multisite-frontend-not-logged-in</li>
<li>Bugfix: wpMandrill compatibility, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/version-0999-conflicts-with-wpmandrill</li>
<li>Feature: Show page views (actions) in &#8220;visitors last 30&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update: PHP API will use namespaces (Piwik 2.x compatibility)</li>
<li>Update: Piwik URL isn&#8217;t necessary to use PHP API anymore.</li>
<li>Feature: Limit cookie lifetime</li>
<li>Feature: Track visitors across all subdomains</li>
<li>Feature: Disable custom var box if necessary</li>
<li>Feature: Choose if you like to add the tracking code to your site&#8217;s footer or header</li>
<li>Feature: New shortcode (post)</li>
<li>Feature: Add data-cfasync=false to script tag if necessary.</li>
<li>Feature: Add annotations on new posts, see http://linuxundich.de/webhosting/beim-veroeffentlichen-von-wordpress-posts-eine-anmerkung-in-piwik-setzen/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Do not load sparklines plugin if toolbar not shown</li>
<li>Bugfix: PHP API will work again (urlencoding removed)</li>
<li>jqPlot and jquery.sparkline updated</li>
<li>Partly refactored code</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.8</h4>

<h4>0.9.8.1</h4>

<li>Reset/uninstall script bugfix regarding network mode</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.5 compatibility fix: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/v35-errors-fix?replies=5 (Thanks Christian Foellmann!)</li>

<li>Site Search stats added</li>
<li>Use js/index.php: Replaces piwik.js and piwik.php by js/ (instead of piwik.js only)</li>
<li>Connection timeout setting added</li>
<li>Full reset option added</li>
<li>Uninstall script added</li>
<li>Stats metaboxes: Date formatted</li>
<li>Use proxy settings defined in wp-config.php</li>
<li>Piwik.php proxy script added (see http://piwik.org/faq/how-to/#faq_132)</li>
<li>Bugfix: After upgrade, Piwik automatically places cookies again (https://wordpress.org/support/topic/after-upgrade-piwik-automatically-places-cookies-again)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.7</h4>

being replaced by <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailpoet/">MailPoet 3</a>.</p>
<p>Version 2 will remain available right here on the repository. <a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/faq-mailpoet-version-2/" rel="nofollow">Read more the complete FAQ.</a></p>
<h4>Check out this 2 minute video.</h4>
<p><div class="embed-vimeo" style="text-align: center;"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/130151897" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe></div>
</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<p>Please visit <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailpoet/">MailPoet version 3 features</a> instead.</p>
<h4>Premium version</h4>
<p>MailPoet Premium offers these nifty extra features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Send to more than 2000 subscribers</li>
<li>A beautiful statistics dashboard to compare your newsletters and subscribers</li>
<li>Detailed stats for each subscriber and newsletter</li>
<li>Automated bounce handling that keeps your subscribers&#8217; list clean</li>
<li>Test your SPAM score before you send a newsletter to your subscribers</li>
<li>Improve deliverability with DKIM signature</li>
<li>Simple install process</li>
<li>Priority support</li>
</ul>
<h4>Support</h4>
<p>This version is no longer officially supported. Paying customer will continue to be supported until further notice.</p>

";s:12:"installation";s:970:"<p>There are 3 ways to install this plugin:</p>
<h4>1. The super easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Search for <code>mailpoet</code></li>
<li>Click to install</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>2. The easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page</li>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Select the tab &#8220;Upload&#8221;</li>
<li>Upload the .zip file you just downloaded</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>3. The old and reliable way (FTP)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>wysija-newsletters</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1308:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>There are 3 ways to install this plugin:</p>
<h4>1. The super easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Search for <code>mailpoet</code></li>
<li>Click to install</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>2. The easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page</li>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Select the tab &#8220;Upload&#8221;</li>
<li>Upload the .zip file you just downloaded</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>3. The old and reliable way (FTP)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>wysija-newsletters</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Got questions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Our <a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/support" rel="nofollow">support site</a> has plenty of articles and a ticketing system.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/faq-mailpoet-version-2/" rel="nofollow">Read more the complete FAQ on version 2.</a></p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:58152:"<h4>2.8.1 &#8211; 2017-11-28</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added poll and discounts</li>
<li>Fixed editor sidebar missing if plugins enqueue the mediaelement script on WP 4.9</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.8 &#8211; 2017-11-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added support for ReCaptcha to protect subscription forms from automated abuse</li>
<li>Fixed editor sidebar missing if a theme uses wp_enqueue_media() function on WP 4.9</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.15.1 &#8211; 2017-11-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved IP throttling to work independently of subscribers table (for robustness)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.14 &#8211; 2017-10-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed SWFUpload support</li>
<li>Fixed path for TinyMCE styles</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.13 &#8211; 2017-09-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added throttling of repeated subscriptions from an IP address</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.12.1 &#8211; 2017-09-19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update messages in regards to official launch of MailPoet version 3</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.11.3 &#8211; 2017-07-21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed Premium version download link</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.11.1 &#8211; 2017-07-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved welcome and update pages</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.10 &#8211; 2017-04-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Introduced minor changes to the premium page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.9 &#8211; 2017-04-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by Craig Smith. Thanks!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.8 &#8211; 2017-03-03</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed sending issues when MailPoet&#8217;s sending service is selected</li>
<li>Fixed sending post notifications when tag filters are used</li>
<li>Fixed the display of incorrect newsletter title in browser preview</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices associated with sending on multisite hosts</li>
<li>Fixed broken DKIM signing</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.7 &#8211; 2017-01-31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed activation issues on PHP 5.2</li>
<li>Removed PHPMailer library in compliance with the new WordPress security policy. Please report any sending issues!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.6 &#8211; 2017-01-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed post categories not being displayed in sent newsletters</li>
<li>Fixed PHPMailer vulnerability</li>
<li>Fixed PEAR POP3&#8217;s usage of static methods</li>
<li>Fixed direct manipulation of the $wp_filter global</li>
<li>Fixed BBPress unsubscribe compatibility</li>
<li>Added ElasticEmail unsubscribe tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.5 &#8211; 2016-08-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed subscription form widget</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.4 &#8211; 2016-08-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed error appearing during newsletter creation</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.3 &#8211; 2016-08-08</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed issue with emoji when saving newsletters</li>
<li>Prevent encoding of &#8220;tel:&#8221; URLs</li>
<li>Fixed SQL injection vulnerability (Thanks to Force Interactive)</li>
<li>Fixed XSS vulnerability (Thanks to Sipke Mellema from Securify B.V.)</li>
<li>Fixed PHP warnings on Bounce management</li>
<li>Escape commma and quote marks during export</li>
<li>Fixed some editor issues</li>
<li>Fixed double signed DKIM emails</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.2 &#8211; 2016-06-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed broken CSS for Premium page</li>
<li>Fixed Custom Fields not saving on front-end</li>
<li>Fixed image ratio for specific locations</li>
<li>Fixed issue with missing rule (onlyNumberSp) in Italian &amp; German translations</li>
<li>Fixed broken email validation in Dutch language with long extensions</li>
<li>Fixed undefined property notice on Bounce pages</li>
<li>Added SparkPost API support</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks again to Falk Huber (T-Systems) for reporting them</li>
<li>Added new menu icon (New MailPoet Branding)</li>
<li>Fixed sending preview of an email with an empty subject</li>
<li>Added Ukrainian JS validation language</li>
<li>Replaced deprecated get_currentuserinfo() with wp_get_current_user()</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices that may have appeared during the sending process</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.1 &#8211; 2016-03-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Falk Huber for letting us now.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7 &#8211; 2016-01-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enabled PHP7 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Immunity and Netsparker (https://www.netsparker.com) for alerting us.</li>
<li>Fixed an issue with newsletters not saving during the creation process</li>
<li>Disabled SSL verification on hosts with invalid SSL certificates and PHP 5.6</li>
<li>Updated SendGrid mailer</li>
<li>Improved URL validation logic</li>
<li>Addressed PHP notices that appeared in cron output</li>
<li>Fixed other minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.19 &#8211; 2015-10-13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a URL validation issue when WP&#8217;s home &amp; site URLs are different. Kudos to Divaldo for pointing it out.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.18 &#8211; 2015-09-21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed URL validation issue</li>
<li>Improved newsletter/subscriber search</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.17 &#8211; 2015-09-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enhanced redirection check in email URLs.</li>
<li>Fixed old-style PHP constructors.</li>
<li>Fixed newsletter preview bug.</li>
<li>Fixed import issues on old PHP versions.</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.16 &#8211; 2015-06-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added HHVM support</li>
<li>Added MariaDB support</li>
<li>Fixed import issue where existing subscriber&#8217;s data was not updated</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.15 &#8211; 2015-02-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed hidden signup confirmation when the theme &#8220;Twenty Fifteen&#8221; is activated</li>
<li>Fixed import issue on Windows servers, all valid subscribers CSV files can be imported now</li>
<li>Fixed the filter &#8220;Subscribers in no list&#8221; in the Subscribers&#8217; listing in the backend</li>
<li>Fixed bug in the frontend subscriptions page with the shortcode [wysija_page] not being replaced</li>
<li>Fixed rendering issue when sending WordPress Post notifications including multiple levels of nested HTML lists(ul &amp; ol)</li>
<li>Improved performance in the Subscribers&#8217; listing</li>
<li>Improved scheduled tasks process responses for greater reliability</li>

<h4>2.6 &#8211; 2014-03-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>This is the juiciest of all releases. Ready?</li>
<li>a new statistics dashboard in Premium. The beauty of the big picture</li>
<li>add more fields in your subscription forms, like phone number, address, or whatever you like</li>
<li>display an archive of your past newsletters in a page with a shortcode. Find it in the settings</li>
<li>display your posts&#8217; author names and categories in the newsletter editor</li>
<li>insert several posts at once in the editor, instead of one at a time. Time saver</li>
<li>a dozen new display options when you drop your posts in the newsletter, for the control freaks</li>
<li>find a list of add-ons in the settings. Plug your MailPoet with your other favorite plugins, like Gravity Forms</li>
<li>select your own WordPress pages for your confirmation and unsubscribe pages</li>
<li>use your MailPoet shortcodes in your confirmation emails, like [user:firstname | default:reader]</li>
<li>MailPoet now abides to German privacy laws. Guten tag Alex!</li>
<li>the browser version of your newsletter now include the Google Analytics tracking code (Premium)</li>
<li>right to left language improvements</li>
<li>our user interface is now styled for 3.8</li>
<li>needless to say, hundreds of mini improvements</li>
<li>we hand over to you 6 months of hard work. Enjoy!</li>
</ul>

Thumbnails Advanced";s:4:"slug";s:30:"regenerate-thumbnails-advanced";s:7:"version";s:7:"1.5.2.3";s:6:"author";s:50:"<a href="http://ciprianturcu.com">turcuciprian</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/turcuciprian";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:12:"turcuciprian";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/turcuciprian";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.1";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:8;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:9;s:15:"support_threads";i:2;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:70919;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-28 9:42pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-07-10";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://ciprianturcu.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1900:"<p>Quick Tutorial:</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/a5F5OsWZC28?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
<p>A plugin that makes regenerating thumbnails even easier than before and more flexible.<br />
If you install a new theme, it might have different image sizes it wants to use. those image sizes are cropped and resized into thumbnails only when you upload new images. So what happens with your old images?<br />
the ones you already uploaded? They need to be regenerated, this is what this plugin does. It takes each image and generates the thumbnails for each and every one of them.You have the ability to regenerate thumbnails for a aspecific image<br />
by cicking a added button on the media page. You will not be redirected to another page, everything happens on that page with REST api and ajax.</p>
<p>Features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Removes ( cleans up ) the thumbnails of the existing images that are no longer of any use (since version 1.5.2 )</li>
<li>You can select a period in time for the images to be regenerated from</li>
<li>The period is last day, last week, last month or all</li>
<li>Clean simple interface where you have a progress bar showing you the percentage of images regenerated</li>
<li>You get to see the total number of images affected by your period, as well as the images affected so far when processing</li>
<li>You can regenerate individual image withouth navigating away from the page, everything happening on the media page with 1 click of the image you want to modify</li>
<li>plugin is available for translation in any language with the rta text domain.</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:288:"<p>This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.</p>
<p>e.g.</p>
<ol>
<li>Upload regenerate-thumbnails-advanced directory to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:272:"
<h4>Can I regenerate just a few images</h4>
<p>
<p>You have the option to select from: all, past day, past week, past month</p>
</p>
<h4>What happens if I close the page and the script is loading?</h4>
<p>
<p>The script stops, it does not run in the background</p>
</p>

1.5";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.5.zip";s:5:"1.1.6";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.6.zip";s:5:"1.1.7";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.7.zip";s:5:"1.1.8";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.8.zip";s:5:"1.1.9";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.9.zip";s:3:"1.2";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.2.zip";s:5:"1.2.3";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.2.3.zip";s:5:"1.3.3";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.3.3.zip";s:3:"1.4";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.zip";s:5:"1.4.1";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.1.zip";s:5:"1.4.2";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.2.zip";s:5:"1.4.3";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.3.zip";s:5:"1.4.6";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.6.zip";s:5:"1.5.0";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.5.0.zip";s:7:"1.5.2.2";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.5.2.2.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:82:"https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MU4RJNNF74QKY";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1214510";s:2:"2x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1214510";}}s:21:"really-simple-captcha";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:21:"Really Simple CAPTCHA";s:4:"slug";s:21:"really-simple-captcha";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.0.1";s:6:"author";s:62:"<a href="https://ideasilo.wordpress.com/">Takayuki Miyoshi</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/takayukister";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:12:"takayukister";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/takayukister";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.4";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:87;i:4;i:15;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:12;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:115;s:15:"support_threads";i:7;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:5807859;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2017-08-23 11:06am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-03-10";s:8:"homepage";s:33:"https://contactform7.com/captcha/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2807:"<p>Really Simple CAPTCHA does not work alone and is intended to work with other plugins. It is originally created for <a href="https://contactform7.com/" rel="nofollow">Contact Form 7</a>, however, you can use it with your own plugin.</p>
<p>Note: This product is &#8220;really simple&#8221; as its name suggests, i.e., it is not strongly secure. If you need perfect security, you should try other solutions.</p>
<h4>How does it work?</h4>
<p>Really Simple CAPTCHA does not use PHP &#8220;Sessions&#8221; for storing states, unlike many other PHP CAPTCHA solutions, but stores them as temporary files. This allows you to embed it into WordPress without worrying about conflicts.</p>
<p>When you generate a CAPTCHA, Really Simple CAPTCHA creates two files for it; one is an image file of CAPTCHA, and the other is a text file which stores the correct answer to the CAPTCHA.</p>
<p>The two files have the same (random) prefix in their file names, for example, &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.png&#8221; and &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.txt.&#8221; In this case, for example, when the respondent answers &#8220;K5GF&#8221; as an answer to the &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.png&#8221; image, then Really Simple CAPTCHA calculates hash of &#8220;K5GF&#8221; and tests it against the hash stored in the &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.txt&#8221; file. If the two match, the answer is confirmed as correct.</p>
<h4>How to use with your plugin</h4>
<p>Note: Below are instructions for plugin developers.</p>
<p>First, create an instance of ReallySimpleCaptcha class:</p>
<pre><code>$captcha_instance = new ReallySimpleCaptcha();
</code></pre>
<p>You can change the instance variables as you wish.</p>
<pre><code>// Change the background color of CAPTCHA image to black
$captcha_instance-&gt;bg = array( 0, 0, 0 );
</code></pre>
<p>See really-simple-captcha.php if you are interested in other variables.</p>
<p>Generate a random word for CAPTCHA.</p>
<pre><code>$word = $captcha_instance-&gt;generate_random_word();
</code></pre>
<p>Generate an image file and a corresponding text file in the temporary directory.</p>
<pre><code>$prefix = mt_rand();
$captcha_instance-&gt;generate_image( $prefix, $word );
</code></pre>
<p>Then, show the image and get an answer from respondent.</p>
<p>Check the correctness of the answer.</p>
<pre><code>$correct = $captcha_instance-&gt;check( $prefix, $the_answer_from_respondent );
</code></pre>
<p>If the $correct is true, go ahead. Otherwise, block the respondent &#8212; as it would appear not to be human.</p>
<p>And last, remove the temporary image and text files, as they are no longer in use.</p>
<pre><code>$captcha_instance-&gt;remove( $prefix );
</code></pre>
<p>That&#8217;s all.</p>
<p>If you wish to see a live sample of this, you can try <a href="https://contactform7.com/captcha/" rel="nofollow">Contact Form 7</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:416:"<p>In most cases you can install automatically from WordPress.</p>
<p>However, if you install this manually, follow these steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the entire <code>really-simple-captcha</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
</ol>
<p>FYI: There is no &#8220;control panel&#8221; for this plugin.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1260:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>In most cases you can install automatically from WordPress.</p>
<p>However, if you install this manually, follow these steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the entire <code>really-simple-captcha</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
</ol>
<p>FYI: There is no &#8220;control panel&#8221; for this plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>CAPTCHA does not work; the image does not show up.</h4>
<p>
<p>Really Simple CAPTCHA needs GD and FreeType library installed on your server. Ask your server administrator if they are installed.</p>
<p>Also, make the temporary file folder writable. The location of the temporary file folder is managed by the instance variable <code>tmp_dir</code> of ReallySimpleCaptcha class. Note that the setting varies depending on the calling plugin. For example, Contact Form 7 uses <code>wp-contents/uploads/wpcf7_captcha</code> as the temporary folder basically, but it can use different folder depending on your settings.</p>
<p>If you have any further questions, please submit them <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/really-simple-captcha" rel="nofollow">to the support forum</a>.</p>
</p>

<li>Add $max argument to cleanup() to prevent an endless file cleanup.</li>
</ul>
";s:11:"screenshots";s:237:"<ol><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/really-simple-captcha/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=880406"><img src="https://ps.w.org/really-simple-captcha/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=880406" alt="screenshot-1.png"></a><p>screenshot-1.png</p></li></ol>";}s:17:"short_description";s:138:"Really Simple CAPTCHA is a CAPTCHA module intended to be called from other plugins. It is originally created for my Contact Form 7 plugin.";s:13:"download_link";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.2.0.1.zip";s:11:"screenshots";a:1:{i:1;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/really-simple-captcha/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=880406";s:7:"caption";s:16:"screenshot-1.png";}}s:4:"tags";a:1:{s:7:"captcha";s:7:"captcha";}s:8:"versions";a:14:{s:3:"1.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.0.zip";s:3:"1.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.1.zip";s:3:"1.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.2.zip";s:3:"1.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.3.zip";s:3:"1.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.4.zip";s:3:"1.5";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.5.zip";s:3:"1.6";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.6.zip";s:3:"1.7";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.7.zip";s:3:"1.8";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.8.zip";s:7:"1.8.0.1";s:72:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.8.0.1.zip";s:3:"1.9";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.1.9.zip";s:3:"2.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.2.0.zip";s:5:"2.0.1";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.2.0.1.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/really-simple-captcha.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:32:"https://contactform7.com/donate/";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:74:"https://ps.w.org/really-simple-captcha/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1047241";s:2:"2x";s:74:"https://ps.w.org/really-simple-captcha/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1047241";}}s:16:"disable-comments";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:16:"Disable Comments";s:4:"slug";s:16:"disable-comments";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.7.1";s:6:"author";s:53:"<a href="http://www.rayofsolaris.net/">Samir Shah</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/solarissmoke";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:12:"solarissmoke";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/solarissmoke";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.1";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.1";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:191;i:4;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:199;s:15:"support_threads";i:6;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:4605460;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-18 3:25am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-05-27";s:8:"homepage";s:47:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:3034:"<p>This plugin allows administrators to globally disable comments on any post type (posts, pages, attachments, etc.) so that these settings cannot be overridden for individual posts. It also removes all comment-related fields from edit and quick-edit screens. On multisite installations, it can be used to disable comments on the entire network.</p>
<p>Additionally, comment-related items can be removed from the Dashboard, Widgets, the Admin Menu and the Admin Bar.</p>
<p><strong>Important note</strong>: Use this plugin if you don&#8217;t want comments at all on your site (or on certain post types). Don&#8217;t use it if you want to selectively disable comments on individual posts &#8211; WordPress lets you do that anyway. If you don&#8217;t know how to disable comments on individual posts, there are instructions in <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/faq/">the FAQ</a>.</p>
<p>If you come across any bugs or have suggestions, please use the plugin support forum. I can&#8217;t fix it if I don&#8217;t know it&#8217;s broken! Please check the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/faq/">FAQ</a> for common issues.</p>
<p>Want to contribute? Here&#8217;s the <a href="https://github.com/solarissmoke/disable-comments" rel="nofollow">GitHub development repository</a>.</p>
<p>A <a href="https://github.com/solarissmoke/disable-comments-mu" rel="nofollow">must-use version</a> of the plugin is also available.</p>
<h3>Details</h3>
<p>The plugin provides the option to <strong>completely disable the commenting feature in WordPress</strong>. When this option is selected, the following changes are made:</p>
<ul>
<li>All &#8220;Comments&#8221; links are hidden from the Admin Menu and Admin Bar;</li>
<li>All comment-related sections (&#8220;Recent Comments&#8221;, &#8220;Discussion&#8221; etc.) are hidden from the WordPress Dashboard;</li>
<li>All comment-related widgets are disabled (so your theme cannot use them);</li>
<li>The &#8220;Discussion&#8221; settings page is hidden;</li>
<li>All comment RSS/Atom feeds are disabled (and requests for these will be redirected to the parent post);</li>
<li>The X-Pingback HTTP header is removed from all pages;</li>
<li>Outgoing pingbacks are disabled.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Please delete any existing comments on your site before applying this setting, otherwise (depending on your theme) those comments may still be displayed to visitors. You can use the Delete Comments tool to delete any existing comments on your site.</strong></p>
<h3>Advanced Configuration</h3>
<p>Some of the plugin&#8217;s behaviour can be modified by site administrators and plugin/theme developers through code:</p>
<ul>
<li>Define <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_REMOVE_COMMENTS_TEMPLATE</code> and set it to <code>false</code> to prevent the plugin from replacing the theme&#8217;s comment template with an empty one.</li>
</ul>
<p>These definitions can be made either in your main <code>wp-config.php</code> or in your theme&#8217;s <code>functions.php</code> file.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:398:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>The plugin settings can be accessed via the &#8216;Settings&#8217; menu in the administration area (either your site administration for single-site installs, or your network administration for network installs).</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2519:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>The plugin settings can be accessed via the &#8216;Settings&#8217; menu in the administration area (either your site administration for single-site installs, or your network administration for network installs).</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Nothing happens after I disable comments on all posts &#8211; comment forms still appear when I view my posts.</h4>
<p>
<p>This is because your theme is not checking the comment status of posts in the correct way.</p>
<p>You may like to point your theme&#8217;s author to <a href="http://www.rayofsolaris.net/blog/2012/how-to-check-if-comments-are-allowed-in-wordpress/" rel="nofollow">this explanation</a> of what they are doing wrong, and how to fix it.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I remove the text that says &#8220;comments are closed&#8221; at the bottom of articles where comments are disabled?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin tries its very best to hide this (and any other comment-related) messages.</p>
<p>If you still see the message, then it means your theme is overriding this behaviour, and you will have to edit its files manually to remove it. Two common approaches are to either delete or comment out the relevant lines in <code>wp-content/your-theme/comments.php</code>, or to add a declaration to <code>wp-content/your-theme/style.css</code> that hides the message from your visitors. In either case, make you you know what you are doing!</p>
</p>
<h4>I only want to disable comments on certain posts, not globally. What do I do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Don&#8217;t install this plugin!</p>
<p>Go to the edit page for the post you want to disable comments on. Scroll down to the &#8220;Discussion&#8221; box, where you will find the comment options for that post. If you don&#8217;t see a &#8220;Discussion&#8221; box, then click on &#8220;Screen Options&#8221; at the top of your screen, and make sure the &#8220;Discussion&#8221; checkbox is checked.</p>
<p>You can also bulk-edit the comment status of multiple posts from the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Posts_Screen" rel="nofollow">posts screen</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>I want to delete comments from my database. What do I do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Go to the settings page for the disable comments plugin and utlize the Delete Comments tool to delete all comments or according to the specified post types from your database.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:5180:"<h4>1.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Small enhancements to hiding comment-related functionality in the admin.</li>

<h4>1.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Dropped logic to try and hide the comments link from the Meta widget. Administrators should manually add styling to hide this link, or replace the Meta widget with an alternative.</li>
<li>Removed the <code>disable_comments_allow_persistent_mode</code> filter. Define <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_ALLOW_PERSISTENT_MODE</code> instead.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added a tool for deleting comments in bulk.</li>
</ul>

<li>Fix Javascript errors when the Meta widget is enabled.</li>
<li>Hide comments link from the Welcome panel.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Hide existing comments if there are any.</li>
<li>Filter the comments link in the Meta widget if it is enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Remove the comments feed link from the head in WP 4.4 and higher.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Delay loading of translation text domain until all plugins are loaded. This allows plugins to modify translations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Hide the troublesome &#8220;persistent mode&#8221; option for all sites where it is not in use. This option will be removed in a future release.</li>
</ul>

<li>Added gettext support and German translation.</li>
<li>Added links to GitHub development repo.</li>
<li>Allow network administrators to prevent the use of persistent mode.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Remove X-Pingback header when comments are completely disabled.</li>
<li>Disable comment feeds when comment are completely disabled.</li>
<li>Simplified settings page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Now supports Network Activation &#8211; disable comments on your entire multi-site network.</li>
<li>Simplified settings page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Add &#8220;persistent mode&#8221; to deal with themes that don&#8217;t use filterable comment status checking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Allow temporary disabling of comments site-wide by ensuring that original comment statuses are not overwritten when a post is edited.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added the option to disable the Recent Comments template widget.</li>
<li>Bugfix: don&#8217;t show admin messages to users who don&#8217;t can&#8217;t do anything about them.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Other admin menu items could inadvertently be hidden when &#8216;Remove the &#8220;Comments&#8221; link from the Admin Menu&#8217; was selected.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: A typo on the settings page meant that the submit button went missing on some browsers. Thanks to Wojtek for reporting this.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Custom post types which don&#8217;t support comments shouldn&#8217;t appear on the settings page</li>
<li>Add warning notice to Discussion settings when comments are disabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Some dashboard items were incorrectly hidden in multisite</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility fix for WordPress 3.3</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added the ability to remove links to comment admin pages from the Dashboard, Admin Bar and Admin Menu</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.2.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Usability improvements to help first-time users configure the plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Make sure pingbacks are also prevented when comments are disabled.</li>
</ul>

NavXT";s:4:"slug";s:16:"breadcrumb-navxt";s:7:"version";s:5:"5.7.1";s:6:"author";s:42:"<a href="http://mtekk.us/">John Havlik</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/mtekk";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:5:"mtekk";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/mtekk";s:5:"hakre";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/hakre";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.4";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:94;i:4;i:8;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:111;s:15:"support_threads";i:9;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:4911356;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-06-30 2:19pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-12-01";s:8:"homepage";s:38:"http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2306:"<p>Breadcrumb NavXT, the successor to the popular WordPress plugin Breadcrumb Navigation XT, was written from the ground up to be better than its ancestor. This plugin generates locational breadcrumb trails for your WordPress powered blog or website. These breadcrumb trails are highly customizable to suit the needs of just about any website running WordPress. The Administrative interface makes setting options easy, while a direct class access is available for theme developers and more adventurous users.</p>
<h4>PHP Requirements</h4>
<p>Breadcrumb NavXT 5.2 and newer require PHP5.3<br />
Breadcrumb NavXT 5.1.1 and older require PHP5.2</p>
<h4>Features (non-exhaustive)</h4>
<ul>
<li>RDFa format Schema.org BreadcrumbList compatible breadcrumb generation.</li>
<li>Extensive breadcrumb customization control via a settings page with appropriate default values for most use cases.</li>
<li>Network admin settings page for managing breadcrumb settings for all subsites with <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/controlling-breadcrumb-navxt-settings-from-the-network-settings-page/" title="Go to the article on configuring the network settings priority." rel="nofollow">configurable global priority</a>.</li>
<li>Built in WordPress Widget.</li>
<li>Extensible via OOP and provided <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/2/#action_reference" title="Go to the Breadcrumb NavXT Documentation's action reference." rel="nofollow">actions</a> and <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/2/#filter_reference" title="Go to the Breadcrumb NavXT Documentation's filter reference." rel="nofollow">filters</a>.</li>
<li>WPML compatible (enhanced compatibility with WPML extensions plugin).</li>
<li>Polylang compatible (enhanced compatibility with Polylang extensions plugin).</li>
<li>bbPress compatible (enhanced compatibility with bbPress extensions plugin).</li>
<li>BuddyPress compatible (enhanced compatibility with BuddyPress extensions plugin).</li>
</ul>
<h4>Translations</h4>
<p>Breadcrumb NavXT now supports WordPress.org language packs. Want to translate Breadcrumb NavXT? Visit <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/breadcrumb-navxt/" rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s WordPress.org translation project</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:816:"<p>Open the appropriate file for your theme (typically header.php). This can be done within WordPress’ administration panel through Presentation &gt; Theme Editor or through your favorite text editor. Place the following code where you want the breadcrumb trail to appear.</p>
<p>Save the file (upload if applicable). Now you should have a breadcrumb trail on your WordPress powered site. To customize the breadcrumb trail you may edit the default values for the options in the administrative interface. This is located in your administration panel under Settings &gt; Breadcrumb NavXT.</p>
<p>Please visit <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/" title="Go to Breadcrumb NavXT's Documentation." rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s Documentation</a> page for more information.</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:14057:"<h4>5.7.1</h4>
<p>Release date: June 30th, 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed erroneous use of <code>$linked</code> that caused a PHP warning in <code>bcn_display_json_ld()</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where removing a breadcrumb from the trail could cause one or more breadcrumb separators to inappropriately disappear.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.7.0</h4>
<p>Release date: April 21st, 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_display_json_ld(</code>) function for producing Schema.org BreadcrumbList compliant JSON-LD markup.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the uninstaller caused PHP Errors when ran from WP CLI.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::find_type()</code> caused a PHP Warnings in certain circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed typo in the administrative interface.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.6.0</h4>
<p>Release date: December 23rd, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>New feature: Added fourth parameter, <code>$force</code>, to <code>bcn_display()</code>, and <code>bcn_display_list()</code> allowing the internal caching mechanism to be bypassed.</li>
<li>New feature: Moved to multiple line text boxes rather than regular single line text inputs for the breadcrumb templates in the settings page to enhance visibility.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where general searches had the blog breadcrumb in the breadcrumb trail.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the blog breadcrumb options were erroneously made available when a Posts Page was not set.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.2</h4>
<p>Release date: September 30th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the “blog breadcrumb” setting does not affect the inclusion of the blog breadcrumb in the breadcrumb trail.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.1</h4>
<p>Release date: August 13th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::find_type()</code> that identified pages as posts, causing the erroneous inclusion of the post root in the breadcrumb trail for pages. </li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.0</h4>
<p>Release date: August 12th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Internal mechanics to handle post parents as the hierarchy for a post (of any post type) has changed to use &#8216;BCN_POST_PARENT&#8217; rather than &#8216;page&#8217; for the taxonomy_type.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Internal mechanics to handle dates as the hierarchy for a post (of any post type) has changed to use &#8216;BCN_DATE&#8217; rather than &#8216;date&#8217; for the taxonomy_type.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Taxonomy term hierarchy selection logic in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::pick_post_term()</code> has changed to picking the deepest known child of the first hierarchy found in the list of terms returned by <code>get_the_terms()</code> rather than the first term with a child.</li>
<li>New feature: Added support for referer influenced taxonomy selection for a post&#8217;s (any post type) breadcrumb trail.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>translate</code> and <code>lang</code> as valid attributes for tags within breadcrumb templates.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>srcset</code> and <code>sizes</code> as valid attributes for <code>img</code> tags within breadcrumb templates.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>itemprop</code> as a valid attribute for the <code>meta</code> tags within breadcrumb templates.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed various issues caused by other plugins/themes modifying the <code>$post</code> global.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where WPML Extensions would cause a CPT without a set root page to use the Post post type&#8217;s root page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.0</h4>
<p>Release date: March 15th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Migrated to new adminKit version, some functions previously in the admin classes are now handled upstream.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_post_terms</code> filter to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::post_terms()</code> to control the terms included in a non-hierarchical term breadcrumb for a post.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_add_post_type_arg</code> filter to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::maybe_add_post_type_arg()</code> to control when the post_type argument is added to URLs for archives.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_pick_post_term</code> filter to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::post_hierarchy()</code> to allow overriding Breadcrumb NavXT’s default term selection behavior.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue with untranslatable title on the settings page.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Cleanup of several trivial differences between <code>bcn_admin</code> and <code>bcn_network_admin</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed improper display of “Your settings are out of date. Migrate now.” message on fresh installs.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Clarified verbiage in regards to the paged breadcrumb.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added translation wrappers for date format strings in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_archive_by_date()</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::is_builtin()</code> would cause PHP warnings when the passed in post type was not an actual post type.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue that would cause a PHP error if <code>WP_Widget</code> is unavailable.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.3.1</h4>
<p>Release date: December 14th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed alignment issue of the main content of the settings page on WordPress 4.4.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed error caused by options upgrading not re-establishing new settings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed PHP error caused by <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::get_type_string_query_var()</code> returning an array when the post_type query variable is an array.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.3.0</h4>
<p>Release date: November 12th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb NavXT will no longer default to setting the root page for CPTs.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb NavXT will no longer inject a breadcrumb for a CPT archive page if a root page is set for that CPT.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb NavXT now defaults to <code>BCN_SETTINGS_USE_LOCAL</code> rather than <code>BCN_SETTINGS_USE_NETWORK</code> if all of the <code>BCN_SETTINGS_*</code> globals are not defined.</li>
<li>Behavior change: The included widget now supports RDFA style, Schema.org BreadcrumbList format rather than the deprecated Google Breadcrumbs format.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Default settings for breadcrumb templates now conform to RDFA style, Schema.org BreadcrumbList format rather than the deprecated Google Breadcrumbs format.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_widget_display_trail</code> action to enhance the included widget’s extensibility.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_widget_display_types</code> action to enhance the included widget’s extensibility.</li>
<li>New feature: The plugin uninstaller has been re-factored, includes support for uninstalling in PHP5.2.</li>
<li>New feature: Unit tests added for all non-deprecated features in bcn_breadcrumb.</li>
<li>New feature: Unit tests added for the uninstaller.</li>
<li>New feature: Date based hierarchies are now available for CPTs.</li>
<li>New feature: Date archives restricted by CPT are now supported.</li>
<li>New feature: Taxonomy archives restricted by CPT are now supported.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the multibyte supplicant functions were not always being included due to WordPress shipping with its own subset of theses functions.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where on an archive for a post type the archive breadcrumb would appear twice.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.2.2</h4>
<p>Release date: June 1st, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the current item would use a built in default template rather than the breadcrumb template in the settings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Updated currently distributed translations set and list to match the current set of translations that achieve the 90% completeness threshold for inclusion.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where a PHP warning would be displayed when BCN_SETTINGS_USE_NETWORK is defined.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.2.1</h4>
<p>Release date: May 25th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Added additional checks for empty URLs and templates within <code>bcn_breadcrumb</code> to prevent various bugs when empty URLs and/or templates are passed in.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Move away from building URLs for search breadcrumbs and instead using <code>get_search_link()</code> to fix support for pretty permalinks.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where media items (attachments) that have not been attached to a post yet would cause an incorrect breadcrumb trail to be generated.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments of the front page would cause PHP Warnings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments of the front page would have duplicate breadcrumbs for the home page.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments of pages would have an extraneous breadcrumb relating to the page for posts.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue with the text domain/domain path in the plugin header.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.2.0</h4>
<p>Release date: January 9th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Deprecated: The Max Breadcrumb Length setting has been deprecated in favor of <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/trimming-breadcrumb-title-lengths-with-css/" title="Go to the article presenting how to shorten the breadcrumb title length using CSS" rel="nofollow">using CSS styling to perform the length limiting</a>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: The archive page for a post type is now generated for the top ancestor post rather than for the current page when &#8220;post parent&#8221; is used as the post&#8217;s hierarchy.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Now requires PHP5.3 or newer.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_type_archive_post_type</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Settings depending on another setting to be enabled are disabled when the dependency setting is disabled.</li>
<li>New feature: More descriptive messages on settings saving (notify user on success, failure, and no changes to save).</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed awkward wording in the settings page for post hierarchy settings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed missed default templates for post formats when all taxonomy settings had the tax_ prefix added in 5.1.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed bulk of compatibility issues with bbPress.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.1.1</h4>
<p>Release date: July 29th, 2014</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments and their parents have the same link when &#8216;link current item&#8217; is enabled.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Pass the same parameters into the widget title and (pre) text filters as the default WordPress widgets.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where PHP warnings would be thrown on author pages for authors that do not have any posts.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Reduced severity of <code>$post</code> global not being of type <code>WP_Post</code>, will silently exit on non-WP_DEBUG enabled sites.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.1.0</h4>
<p>Release date: June 9th, 2014</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_post()</code> now expects to be passed in a valid WP_Post object.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>breadcrumb_navxt::version</code> changed to a constant to allow uninstantiated access of the plugin version.</li>
<li>New feature: Support Google&#8217;s RDFa Breadcrumbs microformat by default.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_opts_update_prebk</code> filter.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Validate HTML5 options on tab traversal.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the settings importer parsed the version string incorrectly.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added &#8216;typeof&#8217; to list of valid HTML tag attributes.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Prefixed all taxonomies with &#8216;tax_&#8217; to prevent name collisions.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added ID to Post and Taxonomy Term Elements in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_root()</code> as is done everywhere else.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue with <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_author()</code> returning the incorrect user under some circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where saving twice on a tab in the settings page would cause the next page load to open the general tab rather than the current tab.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added bcn_breadcrumb_template filter back into <code>bcn_breadcrumb::set_template()</code>, was a regression in 5.0 from 4.4.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the included widget did not check against default settings, causing PHP Warnings to show up on the frontend under some circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where we didn&#8217;t handle <code>WP_POST::has_archive</code> correctly when it was a string, causing issues with CPTs generated by some plugins.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the default taxonomy selected for a CPT could be a non-public taxonomy.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Attachments get their own title within the settings page now.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Filter the title and pre text in the widget.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.1</h4>
<p>Release date: December 31st, 2013</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior Change: Notify multisite users when settings may be overridden by the network settings and vice versa.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Updated tab style to match WordPress 3.8 look and feel.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::display_list()</code> would produce multiple instances of the class attribute.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed several issues with the uninstaller.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.0</h4>
<p>Release date: November 20th, 2013</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior Change: Moved <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::trail</code> to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::breadcrumbs</code></li>
<li>Behavior Change: When WordPress is in multisite/network mode, the settings set in the network settings page take priority over subsite settings.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail_object</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_li_attributes</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_breadcrumb_types</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added Network Admin Settings page.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>xmlns:v</code> and <code>property</code> to the valid tag attributes.</li>
<li>Bug fix: The current_item breadcrumb for search results should result in a valid HTTPS link when appropriate.</li>
</ul>
";s:3:"faq";s:862:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>Open the appropriate file for your theme (typically header.php). This can be done within WordPress’ administration panel through Presentation &gt; Theme Editor or through your favorite text editor. Place the following code where you want the breadcrumb trail to appear.</p>
<p>Save the file (upload if applicable). Now you should have a breadcrumb trail on your WordPress powered site. To customize the breadcrumb trail you may edit the default values for the options in the administrative interface. This is located in your administration panel under Settings &gt; Breadcrumb NavXT.</p>
<p>Please visit <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/" title="Go to Breadcrumb NavXT's Documentation." rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s Documentation</a> page for more information.</p>
</p>

ess.org/zbtirrell";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.1";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1229;i:4;i:84;i:3;i:47;i:2;i:33;i:1;i:95;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1488;s:15:"support_threads";i:278;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:94;s:10:"downloaded";i:9168119;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-21 9:51pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-01-19";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:17724:"<p>Create an events calendar and manage it with ease. The Events Calendar plugin provides professional-level quality and features backed by a team you can trust.</p>
<p>Packed with loads of useful features, The Events Calendar by Modern Tribe is ready to go right out of the box. It’s extensible, easy to use, and completely customizable.</p>
<p>Looking for additional functionality including recurring events, ticket sales, publicly submitted events, new views, Facebook event integration and more?</p>
<p><strong>Check out <a href="http://m.tri.be/mj" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a> and <a href="http://m.tri.be/2a" rel="nofollow">other add-ons</a></strong></p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>New Import Tool!</strong><br />
  We’ve made bulk event imports easier to manage than ever. This add-on service for The Events Calendar allows you to import events from your favorite sources, including Facebook, Meetup, Google Calendar, iCalendar, CSV, and ICS.<br />
  <a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Check out Event Aggregator now</a>.</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>BUILT SOLID &amp; SUPPORTED</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is crafted the WordPress way.</p>
<p>The Events Calendar plugin has been audited by many WordPress industry experts, including core developer Mark Jaquith for security &amp; plugin review team member Pippin Williamson for best practices and plugin compatibility.</p>
<p>Our dedicated support team has poured hundreds of hours into QA, monthly usability tests, and numerous user interviews to guarantee quality and ease-of-use.  We stand behind our work and offer light support weekly for the community via the WordPress.org support forums.</p>
<p>If you need a deeper level of support or a faster response to your specific question, our Events Calendar PRO add-on includes access to our premium support forums with a 24-48 hour response time during the workweek.</p>
<p>Enjoy using The Events Calendar, know how to get under the hood and want to make money helping people? We’re growing our community team and would love to hear from you. If you’re interested, <a href="http://m.tri.be/mk" rel="nofollow">check this out!</a></p>
<h4>PLUG-N-PLAY or HIGHLY CUSTOMIZABLE</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is built to work out of the box. Just turn it on, configure the settings to match your needs and you’ll be making events in less than 5 minutes.<br />
Or customize it to suit your specific needs. The Events Calendar is built by developers, for developers…it’s ready to be the foundation for your wildest hack sessions:</p>
<p>The Events Calendar is built to work out of the box. Just turn it on, configure the settings to match your needs and you&#8217;ll be making events in less than 5 minutes.</p>
<ul>
<li>WP REST API support</li>
<li>Skeleton stylesheet to theme fast &amp; efficiently</li>
<li>Partial template overrides</li>
<li>Template tags, hooks, and filters</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">Extensive documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/theeventscalendar" rel="nofollow">Library of code snippets</a> on GitHub.</li>
</ul>
<p>Whether your vision is big or small, you’re in good company. Hundreds of thousands of churches, eateries, small businesses, musicians, venues, and non-profits are publishing and promoting their events with The Events Calendar.</p>
<p>The Events Calendar has been scaled to work on networks with over 25 million unique visitors per month and hundreds of thousands of events. Fortune 100 companies, major universities, government institutions and some seriously epic startups push their events with our platform.</p>
<h4>FEATURES</h4>
<p>Whether you’re operating a hyperlocal hub listing thousands of events, a university with many thousands of users, or you’re a sole business owner listing your classes, The Events Calendar has your back.</p>
<p>Just getting started? Definitely watch and read through the <a href="http://m.tri.be/2d" rel="nofollow">New User Primer</a> before going much further.</p>
<ul>
<li>Rapidly create events</li>
<li>Saved venues &amp; organizers</li>
<li>Calendar month view with tooltips</li>
<li>List view</li>
<li>Day view</li>
<li>Event search</li>
<li>Google maps</li>
<li>Widget: Upcoming events list</li>
<li>Events Taxonomies (Categories &amp; Tags)</li>
<li>Google Calendar and iCal exporting</li>
<li>WP REST API endpoints (READ)</li>
<li>Completely ajaxified for super smooth browsing</li>
<li>Completely responsive from mobile to tablet to desktop</li>
<li>Tested on the major theme frameworks such as Avada, Genesis, Woo Themes, Thesis and many more.</li>
<li>Increase your SEO with Microformats</li>
<li>Internationalized &amp; Translated</li>
<li>Multiple stylesheets (Skeleton, Default, Tribe Event Styles) to improve integration</li>
<li>Extensive Template Tags for Customization</li>
<li>Hook &amp; Filters up the wazoo</li>
<li>Caching Support</li>
<li>Debug Mode for Developers</li>
</ul>
<p>Looking for something else? We’ve got add-ons available to take your calendar to the next level.</p>
<h4>PRO Features</h4>
<p>Add recurring events, a whole recurring events, a whole range of new views ( week / map / photo / venue / organizer) &amp; widgets (calendar / featured venue / week / event countdown), shortcodes, custom event attributes, default content, location search, much more with <a href="http://m.tri.be/2c" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a></p>
<h4>Event Ticketing</h4>
<p>Collect free RSVPs with Event Tickets or add paid ticketing features with <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wg" rel="nofollow">Event Tickets Plus</a>, including the ability to sell tickets, collect sales, and manage attendees all from within your WordPress dashboard! Works with your favorite eCommerce plugin (WooCommerce or Easy Digital Downloads).</p>
<h4>Bulk Event Import</h4>
<p>Fill your calendar with events from your favorite sources, including Facebook, Meetup, Google Calendar, iCalendar, CSV, and ICS. <a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Event Aggregator</a> provides a convenient dashboard to manage scheduled imports, manual imports, filters, one-way sync, import history, and more.</p>
<h4>User-Submitted Events</h4>
<p>Running a community calendar? <a href="http://m.tri.be/2g" rel="nofollow">Community Events</a> lets users add events directly to your calendar without needing access to your admin.</p>
<h4>Advanced User Search &amp; Filters</h4>
<p>Have so many amazing events that your users get overwhelmed? <a href="http://m.tri.be/52" rel="nofollow">Filter Bar</a> adds a configurable set of filters to your event pages so users can view and search for the exact events that interest them.</p>
<h4>Integrate With Eventbrite</h4>
<p>Connect your calendar with your Eventbrite.com account! <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wf" rel="nofollow">Eventbrite Tickets</a> allows you to import/export between The Events Calendar and Eventbrite, and incorporate ticket sales.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.facebook.com/theeventscalendar/" rel="nofollow">Join us on Facebook</a> to be part of our active community, check us out <a href="https://twitter.com/TheEventsCal" rel="nofollow">on Twitter</a>, and <a href="http://m.tri.be/rm" rel="nofollow">sign up for our newsletter</a> for release announcements and discounts.</p>
<h4>SUBMITTING PATCHES</h4>
<p>If you’ve identified a bug and want to submit a patch, we’d welcome it at our <a href="https://github.com/moderntribe/the-events-calendar" rel="nofollow">GitHub page for The Events Calendar</a>. Simply cue up your proposed patch as a pull request, and we’ll review as part of our monthly release cycle and merge into the codebase if appropriate from there. (If a pull request is rejected, we’ll do our best to tell you why). Users whose pull requests are accepted will receive credit in the plugin&#8217;s changelog. For more information, check out the readme at our GitHub page. Happy coding!</p>
<h3>Documentation</h3>
<p>All of our online documentation can be found on <a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">our documentation site</a>.</p>
<p>Some links you may find particularly useful are:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2l" rel="nofollow">The Events Calendar New User Primer</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2m" rel="nofollow">The Themer&#8217;s Guide to The Events Calendar</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wm" rel="nofollow">Knowledgebase</a></li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any questions about this plugin, you can post a thread in our <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar" rel="nofollow">WordPress.org forum</a>. Please search existing threads before opening a new one.</p>
<p>The <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Modern Tribe premium support forums</a> are available for you to read. You won&#8217;t, however, be able to post a message in any forums beyond Pre-Sale Questions unless you have purchased a premium license.</p>
<h3>Add-Ons</h3>
<p>But wait: there&#8217;s more! We&#8217;ve got a whole stable of plugins available to help you be awesome at what you do. Check out a full list of the products below, and over on <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wn" rel="nofollow">our website</a>.</p>

</ul>

<ul>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wi" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Event Aggregator</a> (service)</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wk" rel="nofollow">Event Tickets Plus</a></li>

<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2e" rel="nofollow">The Events Calendar: Eventbrite Tickets</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Translations</h3>
<p>The Events Calendar is translated by volunteers at <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/the-events-calendar/stable" rel="nofollow">translate.wordpress.org</a>. There you can find a list of available languages, download translation files, or help update the translations. Thank you to everyone who helps to maintain our translations!</p>
<h3>Help</h3>
<p>Welcome to The Events Calendar, a full-featured events management system for WordPress. Thank you so much for using the labor of our love. We are Modern Tribe and we are here to help you be awesome.</p>
<p>If you aren&#8217;t familiar with The Events Calendar, check out our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2p" rel="nofollow">new user primer</a>. It&#8217;ll introduce you to the basics of what the plugin has to offer and will have you creating events in no time. From there, the resources below &#8212; extensive template tag documentation, FAQs, video walkthroughs and more &#8212; will give you a leg up as you dig deeper.</p>
<p>Additional resources available include:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/release-schedule/" rel="nofollow">Release Schedule</a></li>
<li><a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/known-issues/" rel="nofollow">Known Issues</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2n" rel="nofollow">FAQ</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2t" rel="nofollow">Help Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2u" rel="nofollow">Tutorials</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2v" rel="nofollow">Release Notes</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Forums</a></li>
</ul>
<p>We hit the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar/" rel="nofollow">The Events Calendar forum here on WordPress.org</a> about once a week, assisting users with basic troubleshooting and identifying bugs that have been reported. (If you are looking for more active support, might we suggest buying a PRO license? Our team hits the <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Premium Forums</a> daily.)</p>
<p>Some things to consider before posting on the forum:</p>
<ul>
<li>Look through existing threads before posting a new one and check that there isn&#8217;t already a discussion going on for your issue.</li>
<li>Your issue will be solved more quickly if you run a few checks before making a support request. Deactivate your plugins one by one &#8211; if the issue is fixed by deactivating a plugin you know you&#8217;ve got a plugin conflict. To test your Theme, revert to the default Twenty Twelve Theme to see if you are still experiencing the problem. If not, your Theme is the issue. Please provide this information when making your support request.</li>
<li>Sometimes, just resetting your permalinks can fix the issue. Visit Events -&gt; Settings -&gt; Permalinks, save your permalinks with a different option and then save with your preferred choice again. This can solve events-related problems and can is worth a shot before creating a new thread.</li>
</ul>
<p>Still not happy? Shoot us an email to support@theeventscalendar.com or tweet to <a href="https://twitter.com/TheEventsCal" rel="nofollow">@TheEventsCal</a> and tell us why. We&#8217;ll do what we can to make it right.</p>
<h3>Contributors</h3>
<p>The plugin is made with love by <a href="http://m.tri.be/2s" rel="nofollow">Modern Tribe Inc</a>.</p>
