";s:3:"faq";s:825:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>To do a new installation of the plugin, please follow these steps</p>
<ol>
<li>Download the broken-link-checker.zip file to your computer.</li>
<li>Unzip the file</li>
<li>Upload <code>broken-link-checker</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
<p>To enable/disable various features and tweak the plugin&#8217;s configuration go to <em>Settings -&gt; Link Checker</em>.</p>
<p>To upgrade your installation</p>
<ol>
<li>Deactivate the plugin</li>
<li>Retrieve and upload the new files (do steps 1. &#8211; 3. from &#8220;new installation&#8221; instructions)</li>
<li>Reactivate the plugin. Your settings will be retained from the previous version.</li>
</ol>
</p>

Maintenance Mode";s:4:"slug";s:19:"wp-maintenance-mode";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.0.9";s:6:"author";s:47:"<a href="http://designmodo.com/">Designmodo</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/bueltge";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:10:"designmodo";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/designmodo";s:10:"georgejipa";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/georgejipa";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.4";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:82;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:136;i:4;i:18;i:3;i:14;i:2;i:7;i:1;i:27;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:202;s:15:"support_threads";i:9;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:8;s:10:"downloaded";i:3366345;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-10-13 6:25pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-02-26";s:8:"homepage";s:22:"http://designmodo.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1497:"<p>Add a maintenance page to your blog that lets visitors know your blog is down for maintenance, or add a coming soon page for a new website. User with admin rights gets full access to the blog including the front end.</p>
<p>Activate the plugin and your blog is in maintenance-mode, works and only registered users with enough rights can see the front end. You can use a date with a countdown timer for visitor information or set a value and unit for information.<br />
Also works with WordPress Multisite installs (each blog from the network has it&#8217;s own maintenance settings).</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fully customizable (change colors, texts and backgrounds);</li>
<li>Subscription form (export emails to .csv file);</li>
<li>Countdown timer (remaining time);</li>
<li>Contact form (receive emails from visitors);</li>
<li>Coming soon page;</li>
<li>Landing page templates;</li>
<li>WordPress multisite;</li>
<li>Responsive design;</li>
<li>Social media icons;</li>
<li>Works with any WordPress theme;</li>
<li>SEO options;</li>
<li>Exclude URLs from maintenance.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Bugs, technical hints or contribute</h4>
<p>Please give us feedback, contribute and file technical bugs on <a href="https://github.com/Designmodocom/WP-Maintenance-Mode" rel="nofollow">GitHub Repo</a>.</p>
<h4>Credits</h4>
<p>Developed by <a href="https://designmodo.com/" rel="nofollow">Designmodo</a> &amp; <a href="http://strictthemes.com/" rel="nofollow">StrictThemes – WordPress Themes</a></p>
";s:12:"installation";s:362:"<ol>
<li>Unpack the download package</li>
<li>Upload all files to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory, include folders</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to <code>Settings</code> page, where you can change what settings you need (pay attention to <strong>Exclude</strong> option!)</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:932:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Unpack the download package</li>
<li>Upload all files to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory, include folders</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to <code>Settings</code> page, where you can change what settings you need (pay attention to <strong>Exclude</strong> option!)</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>How to use plugin filters</h4>
<p>
<p>See [GitHub Repo] (https://github.com/Designmodocom/WP-Maintenance-Mode) FAQ.</p>
</p>
<h4>Cache Plugin Support</h4>
<p>
<p>WP Maintenance Mode can be unstable due the cache plugins, we recommend to deactivate any cache plugin when maintenance mode is active.</p>
</p>
<h4>Exclude list</h4>
<p>
<p>If you change your login url, please add the new slug (url: http://domain.com/newlogin, then you should add: newlogin) to Exclude list from plugin settings -&gt; General Tab.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:18078:"<h4>2.0.9 (29/11/2016)</h4>
<ul>
<li>new hook (<code>wpmm_after_body</code>) in maintenance mode template (thanks @ <a href="https://github.com/vyskoczilova" rel="nofollow">Karolína Vyskočilová</a>)</li>
<li>pt_PT (portuguese) language update (thanks @ <a href="https://github.com/pedro-mendonca" rel="nofollow">Pedro Mendonça</a>)</li>
<li>maintenance mode template can also be loaded from theme/child-theme folder (thanks @ <a href="https://github.com/Mahjouba91" rel="nofollow">Florian Tiar</a> and <a href="https://github.com/lachieh" rel="nofollow">Lachlan Heywood</a>)</li>
<li>new hooks for contact form (if you want to add new fields): <code>wpmm_contact_form_start</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_form_before_message</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_form_after_message</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_form_end</code></li>
<li>new hook for contact form validation (if you want to validate new fields): <code>wpmm_contact_validation</code></li>
<li>new hooks for contact form template (if you want to display new fields): <code>wpmm_contact_template_start</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_template_before_message</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_template_after_message</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_template_end</code></li>
<li>some javascript improvements</li>
<li>small css fix for contact form (thanks @ <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/please-fix-modal-window-of-contact-form/" rel="nofollow">frontenddev</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.8 (09/09/2016)</h4>
<ul>
<li>add wp_scripts() function (in helpers.php) to maintain backward compatibility (for those with WP &lt; 4.2.0)</li>
<li>css fix for subscribe button on maintenance page</li>
<li>fix multisite administrator access issue</li>
<li>pt_PT (portuguese) language update (thanks @ Pedro Mendonça)</li>
<li>new hooks for Contact module: <code>wpmm_contact_template</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_subject</code>, <code>wpmm_contact_headers</code></li>
<li>jQuery (google cdn) path fix when SCRIPT_DEBUG is true</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.7 (06/07/2016)</h4>
<ul>
<li>reset_settings _wpnonce check (thanks # Wordfence)</li>
<li>modules &gt; google analytics code sanitization (thanks @ Wordfence)</li>
<li>move sidebar banners from our servers to plugin folder&#8230; as WordPress staff requested</li>
<li>Subscribe button error on Mobile version (thanks @ Hostílio Thumbo)</li>
<li>replace $wp_scripts global with wp_scripts() function</li>
<li>de_DE language file update (thanks @ tt22tt)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.6 (20/06/2016)</h4>
<ul>
<li>notifications update</li>
<li>languages update</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.5 (17/06/2016)</h4>
<ul>
<li>roles (array) fix</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.4 (17/06/2016)</h4>
<ul>
<li>fixed issue: responsive subscribe form</li>
<li>fixed issue: jQuery was loaded from a different folder on some WP installations</li>
<li>fixed issue: errors after update (strstr on empty strings because of saving empty lines on exclude list)</li>
<li>fixed issue: if &#8220;Redirection&#8221; from &#8220;General&#8221; tab is active, also redirects ajax calls</li>
<li>fixed issue: settings page title was wrong placed</li>
<li>&#8220;contact&#8221; feature update &#8211; nice email template + reply-to email header</li>
<li>refactoring for some methods</li>
<li>all assets are now minified</li>
<li>rewrite count db records function (used on subscribers count)</li>
<li>compatible with https://github.com/afragen/github-updater</li>
<li>compatible with wp-cli http://wp-cli.org/</li>
<li>improved responsivity</li>
<li>improved roles access; now you can set multiple roles (editor, author, subscriber, contributor) and administrator will always have access to backend and frontend</li>
<li>it_IT translation by benedettogit (https://github.com/benedettogit)</li>
<li>updated all language files (need help for 100% translation)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.3 (07/10/2014)</h4>
<ul>
<li>WP_Super_Cache issue was fixed</li>
<li>fixed &#8220;Subscribe&#8221; button issue on Safari mobile</li>
<li>fixed color of subscribe-success message (same color as subscribe_text)</li>
<li>&#8220;Social networks&#8221; module edits: settings for links target + a new social network: linkedin</li>
<li>new module &#8220;Google Analytics&#8221;</li>
<li>loginform shortcode reintroduced</li>
<li>dashboard link on maintenance page reintroduced</li>
<li>the content editor accepts new css inline properties: min-height, max-height, min-width, max-width. Use them wisely! 🙂</li>
<li>Settings &amp; sidebar view + old translation files edited</li>
<li>Update from old version 1.x to 2.x issue was fixed</li>
<li>Translate on activation issue was fixed</li>
<li>de_DE translation by Frank Bültge (http://bueltge.github.io/)</li>
<li>pt_PT translation (100% translated) by Pedro Mendonça (http://www.pedromendonca.pt)</li>
<li>ru_RU translation (100% translated) by affectiosus (https://github.com/affectiosus)</li>
<li>nl_NL translation by dhunink (https://github.com/dhunink)</li>
<li>es_ES translation (100% translated) by Erick Ruiz de Chavez (http://erickruizdechavez.com/)</li>
<li>fr_FR translation by Florian TIAR (https://github.com/Mahjouba91)</li>
<li>pt_BR translation by Jonatas Araújo (http://www.designworld.com.br/)</li>
<li>sv_SE translation by Andréas Lundgren (http://adevade.com/)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.2 (04/09/2014)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed &#8220;Author Link&#8221; option from General</li>
<li>Countdown &#8211; save details fix</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.1 (02/09/2014)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Reintroduced some deprecated actions from old version (but still available in next 4 releases, after that will be removed) and replaced with new ones:</li>
<li><code>wm_head</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_head</code></li>
<li><code>wm_footer</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_footer</code></li>
<li>Multisite settings link fix</li>
<li>WP_Maintenance_Mode: init (array checking for custom_css arrays, move delete cache part into a helper, etc.), add_subscriber, send_contact, redirect fixes &amp; optimizations </li>
<li>WP_Maintenance_Mode_Admin: save_plugin_settings fixes, delete_cache (new method)</li>
<li>Settings &amp; Maintenance views fixes</li>
<li>Readme.txt changes</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.0 (01/09/2014)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed design and functionality, new features</li>
<li>Changed multisite behaviour: now you can activate maintenance individually (each blog from the network has it&#8217;s own maintenance settings) </li>
<li>Removed actions: <code>wm_header</code>, <code>wm_footer</code>, <code>wm_content</code></li>
<li>Removed filters: <code>wm_header</code> </li>
<li>Removed [loginform] shortcode</li>
<li>Some filters are deprecated (but still available in next 4 releases, after that will be removed) and replaced with new ones:</li>
<li><code>wm_heading</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_heading</code>, </li>
<li><code>wp_maintenance_mode_status_code</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_status_code</code></li>
<li><code>wm_title</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_meta_title</code></li>
<li><code>wm_meta_author</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_meta_author</code></li>
<li><code>wm_meta_description</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_meta_description</code></li>
<li><code>wm_meta_keywords</code> -&gt; <code>wpmm_meta_keywords</code></li>
<li>Added new filters:</li>
<li><code>wpmm_backtime</code> &#8211; can be used to change the backtime from page header</li>
<li><code>wpmm_meta_robots</code> &#8211; can be used to change <code>Robots Meta Tag</code> option (from General)</li>
<li><code>wpmm_text</code> &#8211; can be used to change <code>Text</code> option (from Design &gt; Content)</li>
<li><code>wpmm_scripts</code> &#8211; can be used to embed new javascripts files</li>
<li><code>wpmm_styles</code> &#8211; can be used to embed new css files</li>
<li><code>wpmm_search_bots</code> &#8211; if you have <code>Bypass for Search Bots</code> option (from General) activated, it can be used to add new bots (useragents)</li>
<li>Removed themes and now we have a &#8220;Design&#8221; &amp; &#8220;Modules&#8221; tabs, where the look and functionality of the maintenance page can be changed as you need</li>
</ul>

ownloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.0.zip";s:5:"2.0.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.1.zip";s:5:"2.0.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.2.zip";s:5:"2.0.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.3.zip";s:5:"2.0.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.4.zip";s:5:"2.0.5";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.5.zip";s:5:"2.0.6";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.6.zip";s:5:"2.0.7";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.7.zip";s:5:"2.0.8";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.8.zip";s:5:"2.0.9";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.9.zip";s:9:"psd-files";s:72:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.psd-files.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/wp-maintenance-mode/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1746218";s:2:"2x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/wp-maintenance-mode/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1746218";}}s:16:"user-role-editor";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:16:"User Role Editor";s:4:"slug";s:16:"user-role-editor";s:7:"version";s:4:"4.38";s:6:"author";s:60:"<a href="https://www.role-editor.com">Vladimir Garagulya</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/shinephp";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:8:"shinephp";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/shinephp";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.1";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:165;i:4;i:9;i:3;i:6;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:11;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:191;s:15:"support_threads";i:42;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:5;s:10:"downloaded";i:5129893;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-27 2:56am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-03-22";s:8:"homepage";s:27:"https://www.role-editor.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3214:"<p>With User Role Editor WordPress plugin you can change user role (except Administrator) capabilities easy, with a few clicks.<br />
Just turn on check boxes of capabilities you wish to add to the selected role and click &#8220;Update&#8221; button to save your changes. That&#8217;s done.<br />
Add new roles and customize its capabilities according to your needs, from scratch of as a copy of other existing role.<br />
Unnecessary self-made role can be deleted if there are no users whom such role is assigned.<br />
Role assigned every new created user by default may be changed too.<br />
Capabilities could be assigned on per user basis. Multiple roles could be assigned to user simultaneously.<br />
You can add new capabilities and remove unnecessary capabilities which could be left from uninstalled plugins.<br />
Multi-site support is provided.</p>
<p>To read more about &#8216;User Role Editor&#8217; visit <a href="http://www.shinephp.com/user-role-editor-wordpress-plugin/" rel="nofollow">this page</a> at <a href="http://shinephp.com" rel="nofollow">shinephp.com</a></p>
<p>Do you need more functionality with quality support in a real time? Do you wish to remove advertisements from User Role Editor pages?<br />
<a href="https://www.role-editor.com" rel="nofollow">Buy Pro version</a>.<br />
<a href="https://www.role-editor.com" rel="nofollow">User Role Editor Pro</a> includes extra modules:</p>
<ul>
<li>Block selected admin menu items for role.</li>
<li>Hide selected front-end menu items for no logged-in visitors, logged-in users, roles.</li>
<li>Block selected widgets under &#8220;Appearance&#8221; menu for role.</li>
<li>Show widgets at front-end for selected roles.</li>
<li>Block selected meta boxes (dashboard, posts, pages, custom post types) for role.</li>
<li>&#8220;Export/Import&#8221; module. You can export user roles to the local file and import them then to any WordPress site or other sites of the multi-site WordPress network.</li>
<li>Roles and Users permissions management via Network Admin  for multisite configuration. One click Synchronization to the whole network.</li>
<li>&#8220;Other roles access&#8221; module allows to define which other roles user with current role may see at WordPress: dropdown menus, e.g assign role to user editing user profile, etc.</li>
<li>Manage user access to editing posts/pages/custom post type using posts/pages, authors, taxonomies ID list.</li>
<li>Per plugin users access management for plugins activate/deactivate operations.</li>
<li>Per form users access management for Gravity Forms plugin.</li>
<li>Shortcode to show enclosed content to the users with selected roles only.</li>
<li>Posts and pages view restrictions for selected roles.</li>
</ul>
<p>Pro version is advertisement free. Premium support is included.</p>
<h3>Additional Documentation</h3>
<p>You can find more information about &#8220;User Role Editor&#8221; plugin at <a href="http://www.shinephp.com/user-role-editor-wordpress-plugin/" rel="nofollow">this page</a></p>
<p>I am ready to answer on your questions about plugin usage. Use <a href="http://www.shinephp.com/user-role-editor-wordpress-plugin/" rel="nofollow">plugin page comments</a> for that.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:522:"<p>Installation procedure:</p>
<ol>
<li>Deactivate plugin if you have the previous version installed.</li>
<li>Extract &#8220;user-role-editor.zip&#8221; archive content to the &#8220;/wp-content/plugins/user-role-editor&#8221; directory.</li>
<li>Activate &#8220;User Role Editor&#8221; plugin via &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress admin menu. </li>
<li>Go to the &#8220;Users&#8221;-&#8220;User Role Editor&#8221; menu item and change your WordPress standard roles capabilities according to your needs.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1284:"<ul>
<li>Does it work with WordPress in multi-site environment?<br />
Yes, it works with WordPress multi-site. By default plugin works for every blog from your multi-site network as for locally installed blog.<br />
To update selected role globally for the Network you should turn on the &#8220;Apply to All Sites&#8221; checkbox. You should have superadmin privileges to use User Role Editor under WordPress multi-site.<br />
Pro version allows to manage roles of the whole network from the Netwok Admin.</li>
</ul>
<p>To read full FAQ section visit <a href="http://www.shinephp.com/user-role-editor-wordpress-plugin/#faq" rel="nofollow">this page</a> at <a href="shinephp.com" rel="nofollow">shinephp.com</a>.</p>

<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>Installation procedure:</p>
<ol>
<li>Deactivate plugin if you have the previous version installed.</li>
<li>Extract &#8220;user-role-editor.zip&#8221; archive content to the &#8220;/wp-content/plugins/user-role-editor&#8221; directory.</li>
<li>Activate &#8220;User Role Editor&#8221; plugin via &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress admin menu. </li>
<li>Go to the &#8220;Users&#8221;-&#8220;User Role Editor&#8221; menu item and change your WordPress standard roles capabilities according to your needs.</li>
</ol>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:9014:"<h4>[4.38] 27.11.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security: XSS vulnerability was fixed at URE&#8217;s options page. Bug was discovered and fixed at tab index value numeric type checking. Tab index value is additionally escaped before output also.</li>
<li>Security: Deprecated code for debug output to the .log file in case of database query error was removed.</li>
<li>Security: Multiple select jQuery plugin (https://github.com/wenzhixin/multiple-select/) was updated to the latest available version 1.2.1, which fixed XSS vulnerability, existed in earlier versions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.37] 01.11.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: New option was added to the &#8220;Settings-&gt;User Role Editor-&gt;General&#8221; tab. It&#8217;s possible to set a default value for a quant of columns at capabilities section of the main User Role Editor page.</li>
<li>Update: User capabilities are shown for custom post types which use the WordPress built-in &#8216;post&#8217; or &#8216;page&#8217; capability type. (0/0) was shown earlier instead of the quantity of user capabilities really used.</li>
<li>Update: Restriction was added for &#8216;do_not_allow&#8217; user capability (used internally by WordPress). You can not add it manually.</li>
<li>Fix: URE hides users with &#8216;administrator&#8217; role by default from any other user. Quantity of users of &#8216;All&#8217; view (tab) at &#8216;Users&#8217; page is decreased now for the quantity of hidden administrators.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.36.1] 02.10.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update: Direct access to the global $current_user variable was excluded. Current user data is initialized via WordPress core functions wp_get_current_user() or get_current_user_id().</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.36] 19.09.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: It&#8217;s possible to set any URE&#8217;s option value programmatically: use custom filter &#8216;ure_get_option_&#8217;. It takes a single parameter with current/default value for required options.<br />
Full list of User Role Editor options is available here: https://www.role-editor.com/documentation/options-list</li>
<li>Update: Users page &#8211; Grant Roles. It&#8217;s possible to change just &#8220;Other roles&#8221; for multiple users and leave their primary roles untouched. Just leave a &#8220;Primary role&#8221; field empty. If you select the &#8220;- No role for this site -&#8221; option from a &#8220;Primary role&#8221; drop-down list, plugin will revoke all roles from the selected users.</li>
<li>Update: Options page screen help text was updated.</li>
<li>Fix: Additional (other) default roles set at URE&#8217;s settings page are not granted to a new user now, if they were deselected at a &#8216;Add New User&#8217; page. </li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.35.3] 20.07.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Multiple roles assignment (including default roles) did not work at &#8220;Users-&gt;Add New&#8221; new-user.php (contexts: add-existing-user, add-new-user) page for WordPress multisite.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.35.2] 18.07.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Multiple default roles (if defined at URE&#8217;s settings) are selected automatically at new-user.php (context: add-new-user) page.</li>
<li>Update: Code enhancement for protection of users with &#8216;administrator&#8217; role from each other. Current user can see his own record and edit own profile.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.35.1] 10.07.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: &#8220;Grant Roles&#8221; button at the bottom of &#8220;Users&#8221; page did not work as had the same ID as a similar button at the top of this page.</li>
<li>Update: when bbPress plugin is active, &#8220;Grant Roles&#8221; does not revoke bbPress role granted to user anymore.</li>
<li>Fix: The same ID &#8220;move_from_no_role&#8221; and &#8220;move_from_no_role_dialog&#8221; were included twice to the &#8220;Users&#8221; page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.35] 11.06.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update: Bulk capabilities selection checkbox is not shown for &#8216;administrator&#8217; role for single site WP, and is shown if current user is superadmin for multisite WP. It was done to exclude sudden revoke of all capabilities from the &#8216;administrator&#8217; role.</li>
<li>Update: Full copy of JQuery UI 1.11.4 custom theme CSS file (jquery-ui.css) was included.</li>
<li>Fix: User-&gt;User Role Editor page apparently loads own jQuery UI CSS (instead of use of WordPress default one) in order to exclude the conflicts with themes and plugins which can load own jQuery UI CSS globally not for own pages only.</li>
<li>Fix: &#8220;Change Log&#8221; link was replaced with secure https://www.role-editor.com/changelog</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.34] 02.06.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Multisite &#8216;upgrade_network&#8217; capability support was added for compatibility with WordPress 4.8.</li>
<li>New: Multisite &#8216;delete_sites&#8217; capability support was added.</li>
<li>Update: Users-&gt;Grant Roles: if a single user was selected for &#8220;Grant Roles&#8221; bulk action, dialog will show the current roles of selected user with checkboxes turned ON (pre-selected).</li>
<li>Fix: Transients caching was removed from URE_Lib::_get_post_types() function. It cached post types list too early in some cases.</li>
<li>Fix: jQuery UI CSS was updated to fix minor view inconsistency at the URE&#8217;s Settings page.</li>
<li>Fix: &#8220;Reset&#8221; presentation code remainders were removed from the main User Role Editor page.</li>
<li>Fix: &#8216;manage_links&#8217; capability was included into a wrong subgroup instead of &#8220;Core-&gt;General&#8221;. It was a mistake in the capabilities group counters for that reason.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.33] 19.05.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: &#8220;Users-&gt;Without Roles&#8221;, &#8220;Users-&gt;Grant Roles&#8221; are shown only to the users with &#8216;edit_users&#8217; capability.</li>
<li>Fix: Roles were updated for all sites of all networks for WordPress multisite. &#8220;Apply to All Sites&#8221; option updates roles inside a current network only.</li>
<li>Update: &#8220;Reset&#8221; button moved from the &#8220;Users-&gt;User Role Editor&#8221; main page to the &#8220;Settings-&gt;User Role Editor-&gt;Tools&#8221; tab.</li>
<li>Update: &#8220;Users-&gt;Grant Roles&#8221; button worked only for superadmin or user with &#8216;ure_manage_options&#8217; capability. User with &#8216;edit_users&#8217; can use this feature now.</li>
<li>New: boolean filter &#8216;ure_bulk_grant_roles&#8217; allows to not show &#8220;Users-&gt;Grant Roles&#8221; button if you don&#8217;t need it.</li>
<li>New: boolean filter &#8216;ure_users_select_primary_role&#8217; can hide &#8216;Primary role&#8217; selection controls from the user profile edit page. </li>
<li>New: boolean filter &#8216;ure_users_show_wp_change_role&#8217; can hide &#8220;Change Role&#8221; bulk action selection control from the Users page. So it&#8217;s possible to configure permissions for user who can change just other roles of a user without changing his primary role.</li>
<li>Update: Settings tabs and dialog stylesheets was updated to jQuery UI 1.11.4 default theme.  </li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.32.3] 03.04.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Boolean false was sent to WordPress core wp_enqueue_script() function as the 2nd parameter instead of an empty string. We should respect the type of parameter which code author supposed to use initially.</li>
<li>Fix: Bulk grant to users multiple roles JavaScript code is loaded now for users.php page only, not globally.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.32.2] 17.03.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: &#8220;Users-&gt;Grant Roles&#8221; button did not work with switched off option &#8220;Count Users without role&#8221; at &#8220;Settings-&gt;User Role Editor-&gt;Additional Modules&#8221; tab. &#8220;JQuery UI&#8221; library was not loaded.</li>
<li>Update: minimal PHP version was raised to 5.3.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.32.1] 09.03.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: URL to users.php page was built incorrectly after bulk roles assignment to the users selected at the 1st page of a users list.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.32] 09.03.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Button &#8220;Grant Roles&#8221; allows to &#8220;Assign multiple roles to the selected users&#8221; directly from the &#8220;Users&#8221; page.</li>
<li>Update: singleton template was applied to the main User_Role_Editor class. While GLOBALS[&#8216;user-role-editor&#8217;] reference to the instance of User_Role_Editor class is still available for the compatibility purpose, call to User_Role_Editor::get_instance() is the best way now to get a reference to the instance of User_Role_Editor class.</li>
<li>Fix: Missed &#8216;unfiltered_html&#8217; capability is shown now at the &#8216;General&#8217; capabilities group too.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.31.1] 06.01.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: WP transients get/set were removed from URE_Own_Capabilities class. It leaded to the MySQL deadlock in some cases.</li>
<li>Update: Base_Lib::get_request_var() sanitizes user input by PHP&#8217;s filter_var() in addition to WordPress core&#8217;s esc_attr().</li>
</ul>
<p>For full list of changes applied to User Role Editor plugin look changelog.txt file.</p>

rel="nofollow">Shortcodes Ultimate</a> is a comprehensive collection of various visual and functional elements, which you can use in the post editor, text widgets or even in template files. Using Shortcodes Ultimate you can easily create tabs, buttons, boxes, sliders and carousels, responsive videos and much, much more.</p>
<h4>Feature highlights</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://getshortcodes.com/shortcodes/" rel="nofollow">50+ beautiful shortcodes</a></li>
<li>1-click shortcode insertion with live preview</li>
<li>Works with any theme</li>
<li>Modern responsive design</li>
<li><a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/" rel="nofollow">Comprehensive documentation</a></li>
<li>Custom CSS editor</li>
<li>Custom widget</li>
<li>Translated into 9 languages</li>
<li>RTL support</li>
<li>Powerful API</li>
</ul>

";s:3:"faq";s:3339:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>Unzip plugin file and upload &#8220;shortcodes-ultimate&#8221; folder under your &#8220;/wp-content/plugins/&#8221; directory.</p>
<p>Resulted plugin path should be:<br />
&#8220;/wp-content/plugins/shortcodes-ultimate/**&#8221;</p>
<p>Activate the plugin at &#8220;Dashboard – Plugins&#8221; administration page.</p>
<p><a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/13-plugin-installation" rel="nofollow">Complete installation guide</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>How this plugin works</h4>
<p>
<p><a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/36-shortcodes-ultimate" rel="nofollow">How Shortcodes Ultimate plugin works</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Shortcodes do not work. Why?</h4>
<p>
<p>The most common reasons of this issue are listed <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/41-shortcodes-do-not-work" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Insert shortcode button do not work. Why?</h4>
<p>
<p>The most common reasons of this issue are listed <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/42-insert-shortcode-button-do-not-work" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I remove default shortcodes?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can remove default shortcodes using &#8216;su/data/shortcodes&#8217; filter. Tutorial: <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/51-how-to-remove-default-shortcodes" rel="nofollow">How to remove default shortcodes</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I create custom shortcodes?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can create custom shortcodes using &#8216;su/data/shortcodes&#8217; filter. Tutorial: <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/45-how-to-add-custom-shortcodes" rel="nofollow">How to add custom shortcodes</a>.<br />
Alternatively, you can use <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/add-ons/shortcode-creator/" rel="nofollow">Shortcode Creator add-on</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I use shortcodes in template files?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/52-using-of-shortcodes-in-template-files" rel="nofollow">How to use shortcodes in template files</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will this plugin work with my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! Shortcodes Ultimate is designed to work with any theme, but your theme must include very basic things: &#8216;wp_head&#8217; and &#8216;wp_footer&#8217; template tags. Sometimes, the plugin may not work properly because of javascript errors caused by third-party plugins/themes.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I report a bug?</h4>
<p>
<p>You should <a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate/" rel="nofollow">create an issue at GitHub</a> or <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/account/open-support-ticket/" rel="nofollow">open new support ticket</a> (for premium add-ons only).</p>
</p>
<h4>Where to find additional information?</h4>
<p>
<p>Plugin has comprehensive <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/" rel="nofollow">documentation</a>.<br />
Also, you can find more answers at <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/support/" rel="nofollow">support page</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I get support or talk to other users?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you get stuck, you can ask for help in <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate" rel="nofollow">official plugin forum</a>.<br />
For help with premium add-ons, please <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/account/open-support-ticket/" rel="nofollow">open new support ticket</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:24720:"<h4>5.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: serious security vulnerability, which allows attacker to run any code using filter in meta, post, or user shortcodes. Thanks to Robert L Mathews.</li>
<li>Fixed: changed admin menu position (it was replacing &#8216;Settings&#8217; menu on some installations)</li>
<li>Fixed: shortcodes prefix field now accepts special characters</li>
<li>Fixed: old bug when unwanted code parts was added with shortcode</li>
<li>Fixed: bug, where backslashes were removed from custom CSS code</li>
<li>Added: new attribute &#8216;ID&#8217; for [button] shortcode</li>
<li>Added: new filter &#8216;su/slides_query&#8217;, which can be used to modify posts query for slider, carousel and custom_gallery shortcodes</li>
<li>Added: new filter &#8216;su/assets/custom_css/template&#8217; to filter custom css output</li>
<li>Minor fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Read <a href="https://vanokhin.com/whats-new-in-shortcodes-ultimate-5/" rel="nofollow">this blog post</a> to learn more about update</li>
<li>New project website <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/" rel="nofollow">getshortcodes.com</a></li>
<li>New documentation <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/" rel="nofollow">docs.getshortcodes.com</a></li>
<li>Added: &#8216;Available shortcodes&#8217; admin menu</li>
<li>Removed: &#8216;Examples&#8217; admin menu</li>
<li>Removed: &#8216;Cheatsheet&#8217; admin menu</li>
<li>Fixed: [feed] shortcode (now it uses SimplePie)</li>
<li>Changed default content for [tabs], [row] and [accordion] shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed: [user] shortcode works when user is not logged in</li>
<li>Changed: Security improvement. Plugin will now strip all HTML tags from Custom CSS code</li>
<li>Minor improvements and fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.10.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved: compatibility with PHP7 ([user] and [post] shortcodes)</li>
<li>Fixed: [slider] and [custom_gallery] markup (skipped whitespaces among link attributes)</li>
<li>Removed: user capability check in [permalink]</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.10.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: lightbox javascript</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.10.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: security vulnerability at &#8216;Examples&#8217; admin page (insecure call of file_get_contents() at inc/core/tools.php:774)</li>
<li>Fixed: added access check to permalink shortcode. <a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate/pull/20" rel="nofollow">Pull request #20</a>.</li>
<li>Added: PHP7 compatibility. Checked with <a href="https://github.com/sstalle/php7cc" rel="nofollow">php7cc</a> and <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/php-compatibility-checker/">PHP Compatibility Checker</a>. <a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate/pull/45" rel="nofollow">Pull request #45</a>.</li>
<li>Added: https support for Google Maps. <a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate/pull/40" rel="nofollow">Pull request #40</a>.</li>
<li>Added: https support for Youtube. <a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate/pull/39" rel="nofollow">Pull request #39</a>.</li>
</ul>

<li>Added: completely redesigned search feature. Now it&#8217;s like a Google, but for shortcodes =)</li>

<h4>4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/metro-skins/" rel="nofollow">5 metro skins</a></li>
<li>New screencast &#8211; <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kCWyO2F7jTw" rel="nofollow">How to create image gallery</a></li>
<li>New attribute &#8220;center&#8221; for [button]. Buttons can now be centered on the page</li>
<li>Updated [frame]. Now it can contain other shortcodes</li>
<li>Updated caching mechanism. Cache now will be reseted on plugin activation</li>
<li>Fixed many PHP warnings when debug mode enabled</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [media]. Shortcode has basic support for youtube and vimeo videos</li>
<li>Fixed bug with hidden single [tab]</li>
<li>Added attribute &#8220;active&#8221; for tabs container. This option allows you to select tab number that will be open by default</li>
<li>Fixd button style 3D</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [frame]</li>
<li>Fixed [column] margins</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [tabs]. Now it accepts style=3 and vertical attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [spoiler]. Now it accepts 0 and 1 as values for attribute open. Also, it now accepts style attribute (1, 2, default, fancy, simple)</li>
<li>Added custom CSS import from previous versions. Styles will be imported automatically and prepended to the existing CSS-code</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [highlight]. Now it accepts bg and background attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [label]. Now it accepts style and type attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [dropcap]. Now it accepts 1, 2 and 3 as style values</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [permalink]. Now it accepts p and id attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [button]. Need to test</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [members]. Now it accepts style and login attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [box]. Now it accepts color and box_color attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [note]. Now it accepts color and note_color attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [column]. Now it accepts attribute last and can be not wrapped with [row]</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [document]. Now it accepts file and url attributes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/" rel="nofollow">Official plugin page</a></li>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/maker/" rel="nofollow">Premium add-on for creating custom shortcodes</a></li>
<li>Plugin based on <a href="https://github.com/gndev/sunrise" rel="nofollow">Sunrise Plugin Framework</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate" rel="nofollow">GitHub repo</a>. Now you can easily fork and modify best plugin in the world (:</li>
<li>Brand new Shortcode Generator, <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DR2c266yWEA" rel="nofollow">demo video</a></li>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/kb/shortcodes-ultimate-api-overview/" rel="nofollow">Shortcodes API</a></li>
<li>Completely reorganized code. Added and removed some shortcodes</li>
<li>For security maniacs: timthumb.php replaced by native WordPress mechanism</li>
<li>For speed-up maniacs: completely rewritten assets mechanism. Now css and js files included on page depend on used shortcodes</li>
<li>Added new shortcode [posts]. This is awesome and flexible mechanism to display your content in many different ways</li>
<li>Now you can create your own custom skins for shortcodes</li>
<li>Columns, google maps, google document viewer, youtube player, vimeo player and custom audio player is now fully responsive</li>
</ul>

Velocity Minify";s:4:"slug";s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.2.2";s:6:"author";s:50:"<a href="http://fastvelocity.com">Raul Peixoto</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alignak";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:7:"alignak";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alignak";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.1";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:66;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:71;s:15:"support_threads";i:24;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:18;s:10:"downloaded";i:250266;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-12 4:22pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-06-21";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://fastvelocity.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2866:"<p>This plugin reduces HTTP requests by merging CSS &amp; Javascript files into groups of files, while attempting to use the least amount of files as possible. It minifies CSS and JS files with PHP Minify (no extra requirements).</p>
<p>Minification is done in real time and done on the frontend only during the first uncached request. Once the first request is processed, any other pages that require the same set of CSS and JavaScript will be served that same static cache file.</p>
<p>This plugin includes options for developers and advanced users, however the default settings should work just fine for most sites.</p>
<h4>Aditional Optimization</h4>
<p>I can offer you aditional <code>custom made</code> optimization on top of this plugin. If you would like to hire me, please visit my profile links for further information.</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Merge JS and CSS files into groups to reduce the number of HTTP requests</li>
<li>Google Fonts merging and optimization</li>
<li>Handles scripts loaded both in the header &amp; footer separately</li>
<li>Keeps the order of the scripts even if you exclude some files from minification</li>
<li>Supports localized scripts (https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_localize_script)</li>
<li>Minifies CSS and JS with PHP Minify only, no third party software or libraries needed.</li>
<li>Option to use YUI Compressor rather than PHP Minify (you you have &#8220;exec&#8221; and &#8220;java&#8221; available on your system).</li>
<li>Option to defer JavaScript and CSS files.</li>
<li>Stores the cache files in the uploads directory.</li>
<li>View the status and logs on the WordPress admin page.</li>
<li>Option to Minify HTML for further improvements.</li>
<li>Ability to turn off minification</li>
<li>Ability to turn off CSS or JS optimization seperatly (by disabling either css or js processing)</li>
<li>Ability to manually ignore scripts or css</li>
<li>Support for conditional scripts and styles</li>
<li>Support for multisite installations</li>
<li>Support for gzip_static on Nginx</li>
<li>Support for the CDN Enabler plugin</li>
<li>Auto purging of cache files on W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Wp Fastest Cache, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, Nginx Cache (by Till Krüss ), SG Optimizer, Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine (read the FAQs)</li>
<li>Support for preconnect and preload headers</li>
<li>and some more&#8230;</li>
</ul>
<h4>Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>The JavaScript minification is by <a href="https://github.com/matthiasmullie/minify" rel="nofollow">PHP Minify</a></li>
<li>The alternative JavaScript minification is by <a href="http://yui.github.io/yuicompressor/" rel="nofollow">YUI Compressor</a></li>
<li>Compatible with Nginx, HHVM and PHP 7. </li>
<li>Minimum requirements are PHP 5.5 and WP 4.4, from version 1.4.0 onwards</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:318:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:17726:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>How can I exclude certain assets by wildcard?</h4>
<p>
<p>By default, each line on the ignore list will try to match a substring against all css or js urls, for example: <code>//yoursite.com/wp-content/plugins/some-plugin/js/</code> will ignore all files inside that directory. You can also shorten the url like <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> and then it will match any css or js url that has <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> on the path. Obviously, doing <code>/js/</code> would match any files inside any &#8220;/js/&#8221; directory and in any location, so to avoid unexpected situations please always use the longest, most specific path you can use.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is the ignore list not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>The ignore list is working but you need to remove query vars from static urls (ex: ?ver=) and use partial (see wildcard help above) and use relative urls only.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are there several or a lot&#8217;s of js and css files listed on the status page?</h4>
<p>
<p>Those files are created whenever a new set of javascript or css files are found on your front end and it&#8217;s due to your plugins and themes needing different js and css files per page, post, category, tag, homepage or even custom post types. If you always load the exact same css and javascript in every page on your site, you won&#8217;t see as many files. Likewise, if you have some dynamic url for css or js that always changes in each pageview, you should add it to the ignore list.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I update other plugins and themes?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, but it&#8217;s recommended that you purge the cached files (from the plugin status page) in order for the merging and minification cache files to be regenerated. The plugin will try to automatically purge some popular cache plugins. We still recommend, however, that you purge all caches on your cache plugin (whatever you use) &#8220;after&#8221; purging Fast Velocity Minify cache.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with other caching plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin will try to automatically purge several popular cache plugins, however we still recommend you to purge all caches (on whatever you use) if you also  manually purge the cache on the plugin settings for some reason.<br />
The automatic purge is active for the following plugins and hosting: W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Wp Fastest Cache, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, SG Optimizer, Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it resource intensive, or will it use too much CPU on my shared hosting plan?</h4>
<p>
<p>No it&#8217;s not. The generation of the minified files is done only once per group of CSS or JS files (and only if needed). All pages that request the same group of CSS or JS files will also make use of that cache file. The cache file will be served from the uploads directory as a static file and there is no PHP involved.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with multisites?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, it generates a new cache file for every different set of JS and CSS requirements it finds.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with Adsense and other ad networks?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin is compatible with any add network but also depends on how you&#8217;re loading the ads into the site. We only merge and minify css and javascript files enqueued in the header and footer which would exclude any ads. If you&#8217;re using a plugin that uses JS to insert the ads on the page, there could be issues. Please report on the support forum if you found such case.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why did my site became slow?</h4>
<p>
<p>Please note that the cache regeration happen&#8217;s once per page or if the requested CSS + JS files change. If you need the same set of CSS and JS files in every page, the cache file will only be generated once and reused for all other pages. If you have a CSS or JS that uses a different name on every pageview, try to add it to the ignore list by using wildcards.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How do I use the precompressed files with gzip_static on Nginx?</h4>
<p>
<p>When we merge and minify the css and js files, we also create a <code>.gz</code> file to be used with <code>gzip_static</code> on Nginx. You need to enable this feature on your Nginx configuration file if you want to make use of it. If you&#8217;re upgrading from 1.2.3 or earlier, you need to clear the plugin cache.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Where is the YUI Compressor option gone to?</h4>
<p>
<p>This functionality depends on wheter you have exec and java available on your system. It will be visible on the basic Settings page under the JavaScript Options section and it only applies to JS files.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why is my design or layout broken or some images and sliders are not showing?</h4>
<p>
<p>First thing to check is, are you doing double minification?<br />
You must disable any features on your theme and other plugins, that perform minification of css, html and js.<br />
You cannot also have other optimization plugins, because you are forcing wordpress to do double work.<br />
I recommend W3 Total Cache (with css, js and html minifcation disabled) + Fast Velocity Minify, for minification of CSS and JS files.<br />
Also, kindly review the &#8220;Why are some of the CSS and JS files not being merged or why is my layout broken ?&#8221; below for better insights.</p>
<p>Additionally, the Advanced Otions should only be used by advanced users or developers that understand what the settings mean and do, especially the &#8220;defer JS&#8221; options. Having said that, this is how you can solve most issues on the settings tab when not using any options on the advanced tab:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><code>Disabling CSS processing but keeping JS processing enabled:</code> This will leave CSS files alone and it&#8217;s useful to determine if the problem is CSS or JS related. If isabling CSS processing fixed the layout problems, now you know it&#8217;s related to CSS&#8230;<br />
Likewise, you can keep CSS processing and disable JS processing to find out if the problem is on JS processing.<br />
If you determine it&#8217;s a CSS issue, check the log file on the status page for possible css file urls that should not be there (such as Internet Explorer only files) and add them to the ignore list.<br />
Also kindly report those files on the support forum so they can be blacklisted for future releases.<br />
Sometimes there are JS files than conflict with each other when merged so they may need to be excluded too.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><code>JS Defer:</code> If you have a theme that heavily relies on javascript and jQuery (usually with sliders, paralax animations, etc) most probably, you cannot <code>defer JavaScript</code> for all JS files, but you could try to add the jQuery library as well as the specific JS files that need to be render blocking to the ignore list.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><code>Developers only:</code> Note that if you defer jQuery, the library will not run until after the html DOM page loads. That means that whatever jQuery code is inlined on the HTML will not work and trigger an &#8220;undefined&#8221; error on the browser console log.<br />
On Google Chrome you can look at the console by pressing CTRL + SHIFT + J on your keyboard and refreshing the page. If there are errors you need to track down which JS file is causing trouble and add it to the ignore list.<br />
If you have no idea which files to add, I recommend checking the log file on the status page, adding them all to the ignore list and then one by one trying to delete each url until you find the one causing trouble.<br />
Also beware of any cache plugin in use (and cloudflare) when testing, because that cache needs to be off or purged when configuring things around.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are some of the CSS and JS files not being merged or why is my layout broken ?</h4>
<p>
<p>There are thousands of plugins and themes out there and not every developer follows the standard way of enqueueing their files on WordPress.</p>
<p>For example, some choose to &#8220;print&#8221; the html tag directly into the header or footer, rather than to use the official method outlined here: https://developer.wordpress.org/themes/basics/including-css-javascript/</p>
<p>Some developers enqueue all files properly but still &#8220;print&#8221; conditional tags, such as IE only comments around some CSS or JS files , while they should be following the example as explained on the codex: https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/wp_script_add_data/</p>
<p>Because &#8220;printing CSS and JS tags on the header and footer&#8221; is evil (seriously), we cannot capture those files and merge them together.<br />
There are also files meant to be loaded for IE users only, mobile users, desktop users, printers, so the enqueing of all the files needs to follow the official method of enqueing data and files.</p>
<p>This can also cause layout issues because some files that should be for IE only can be merged together with other users, thus overwriting the usual layout (please check if any of those got merged together and add it to the ignore list). Also, to avoid some of these, we have implemented an IE only blacklist of &#8220;known&#8221; file names that are &#8220;always&#8221; added to the ignore list behind the scenes.</p>
<p>Please feel free to open a support topic if you found some more JS or CSS files on your theme or plugins that &#8220;must always&#8221; also blacklisted and why.</p>
<p>The default ignore list can be found here:<br />
https://fastvelocity.com/api/fvm/ignore.txt</p>
<p>The IE only blacklist (mostly IE only files or that cause trouble most of the times when merged with others), can be found here: https://fastvelocity.com/api/fvm/ie_blacklist.txt</p>
<p>These files are downloaded directly by the plugin, once every 24 hours from our cdn provider.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is it that even though I have disabled or removed the plugin, the design is still broken?</h4>
<p>
<p>While this is rare, it can happen if you have some sort of cache enabled on your site or server. A cache means that the site or server makes a static copy of your page and serves it for a while (until it&#8217;s deleted or expires) instead of loading wordpress directly to the users. Some hosting providers such as Godaddy (and their derivates) enforce their own cache plugin to be installed and creates a new menu which allows you to purge the cache.</p>
<p>If you don&#8217;t see any option anywhere to clear your cache, you can contact your hosting provider or developer to clear the cache for you or ask them how you can do it in the future.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is my frontend editor not working ?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some plugins and themes need to edit the layout and styles on the frontend. When they need to do that, they enqueue several extra js and css files that are caught by this plugin and get merged together, thus sometimes, it breaks things. If you encounter such issue of your page editor not working on the frontend, kindly enable the &#8220;Fix Page Editors&#8221; on the Troubleshooting page.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>What is the &#8220;Fix Page Editors&#8221; on the Troubleshooting page ?</h4>
<p>
<p>This hides all optimization from editors and administrators, as long as they are logged in. This also means that you will see the site exactly as it was before installing the plugin and it&#8217;s meant to fix compatibility with frontend page editors, or plugins that edit things in preview mode using the frontend.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with Visual Composer and other editors ?</h4>
<p>
<p>Visual composer, adds some style tags into your header and/or footer, however they simply print the code and don&#8217;t use the wordpress <code>wp_add_inline_style</code> hook.<br />
This means, we cannot easily capture that csa code and therefore it&#8217;s left out of all the merging by Fast Velocity Minify.<br />
You may have all else merged and minified correctly, however if that generated visual composer css code is important, those styles might be overwritten by the merged file, or that code can also overwrite the rules inside the css generated file.<br />
If you experience some styles missing, this could be the cause&#8230; but try the ignore list first.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How should I use the &#8220;Preload Images&#8221; and what is it for?</h4>
<p>
<p>Certain themes and plugins, either load large images or sliders on the homepage. Most of them will also load &#8220;above the fold&#8221; causing the &#8220;Prioritize visible content&#8221; or the &#8220;Eliminate render-blocking JavaScript and CSS in above-the-fold content&#8221; message on pagespeed insights (see the previous faq question above).</p>
<p>How you can use the &#8220;Preload Images&#8221; is by adding the url of the first relevant images that load above the fold, such as the first background image (and the first image only) of the slider. Any big or large enough image that is above the fold should be added here, however note that the images you add here &#8220;must&#8221; actually exist on the page, else it will trigger a warning on the browser console such as &#8220;The resource [&#8230;] was preloaded using link preload but not used within a few seconds from the window&#8217;s load event. Please make sure it wasn&#8217;t preloaded for nothing.&#8221; which is not good practice.</p>
<p>Don&#8217;t put too many resources here as those are downloaded in high priority and it will slow down the page load on mobile or slower connections (because the browser won&#8217;t process the rest until it finishes downloading all of those big &#8220;preload&#8221; images).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>What are the recommended cloudflare settings for this plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>On the &#8220;Speed&#8221; tab, deselect the Auto Minify for JavaScript, CSS and HTML as well as the Rocket Loader option. There is no benefit of using them with our plugin (we already minify things). Those options sometimes can also break the design due to double minification or the fact that the Rocket Loader is still experimental (you can read about that on the &#8220;Help&#8221; link under each selected option on cloudflare).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How to undo all changes done by the plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin itself doesn&#8217;t do any &#8220;changes&#8221; to your site and all original files are untouched. It intercepts the enqueued CSS and JS files, processes and hides them, while enqueuing the newly optimized cached version of those files. As with any plugin, simply disable or uninstall the plugin, purge all caches you may have in use (plugins, server, cloudflare, etc) and the site will go back to what it was before installing it. The plugin doesn&#8217;t delete anything from the database or modify any of your files.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>I have a complaint or I need support right now. Why haven&#8217;t you replied to my topic on the support forum yet?</h4>
<p>
<p>Before getting angry because you have no answer within a few hours (even with paid plugins, sometimes it takes weeks&#8230;), please be informed about how wordpress.org and the plugins directory work.</p>
<p>The plugins directory is an open source, free service where developers and programmers contribute (on their free time) with plugins that can be downloaded and installed by anyone &#8220;at their own risk&#8221; and are all released under the GPL license.</p>
<p>While all plugins have to be approved and reviewed by the wordpress team before being published ( for dangerous code, spam, etc ) this doesn&#8217;t change the license or add any warranty. All plugins are provided as they are, free of charge and should be used at your own risk (so you should make backups before installing any plugin or performing updates) and it&#8217;s your sole responsability if you break your site after installing a plugin from the plugins directory.</p>
<p>Support is provided by plugin authors on their free time and without warranty of a reply, so you can experience different levels of support level from plugin to plugin. As the author of this plugin I strive to provide support on a daily basis and I can take a look and help you with some issues related with my plugin, but please note that this is done out of my goodwill and in no way I have any legal or moral obligation for doing this. I&#8217;m also available for hiring if you need custom made speed optimizations (check my profile links).</p>
<p>For a full version of the license, please read: https://wordpress.org/about/gpl/</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I get support or report bugs?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get support on the official wordpress plugin page at: https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/fast-velocity-minify<br />
You can also see my profile and check my links if you wish to hire me for custom speed optimization on wordpress or extra features.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I donate to the plugin author?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you would like to donate any amount to the plugin author (thank you in advance), you can do it via Paypal at https://goo.gl/vpLrSV</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>

can view the logs and purge the cache files.";}i:2;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1655584";s:7:"caption";s:18:"The settings page.";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:7:"combine";s:7:"combine";s:11:"concatenate";s:11:"concatenate";s:5:"merge";s:5:"merge";s:10:"php-minify";s:10:"PHP Minify";s:14:"yui-compressor";s:14:"YUI Compressor";}s:8:"versions";a:25:{s:5:"1.5.3";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.1.5.3.zip";s:5:"2.0.0";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.0.zip";s:5:"2.0.1";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.1.zip";s:5:"2.0.2";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.2.zip";s:5:"2.0.3";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.3.zip";s:5:"2.0.4";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.4.zip";s:5:"2.0.5";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.5.zip";s:5:"2.0.6";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.6.zip";s:5:"2.0.7";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.7.zip";s:5:"2.0.8";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.8.zip";s:5:"2.0.9";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.0.9.zip";s:5:"2.1.0";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.0.zip";s:5:"2.1.1";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.1.zip";s:5:"2.1.2";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.2.zip";s:5:"2.1.3";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.3.zip";s:5:"2.1.4";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.4.zip";s:5:"2.1.5";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.5.zip";s:5:"2.1.6";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.6.zip";s:5:"2.1.7";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.7.zip";s:5:"2.1.8";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.8.zip";s:5:"2.1.9";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.1.9.zip";s:5:"2.2.0";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.0.zip";s:5:"2.2.1";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.1.zip";s:5:"2.2.2";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.2.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:1:{s:2:"1x";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/icon-128x128.jpg?rev=1440946";}}s:12:"a3-lazy-load";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:12:"a3 Lazy Load";s:4:"slug";s:12:"a3-lazy-load";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.8.2";s:6:"author";s:47:"<a href="https://a3rev.com/">a3rev Software</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/a3rev";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:5:"a3rev";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/a3rev";s:14:"nguyencongtuan";s:45:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/nguyencongtuan";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.0";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:52;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:59;s:15:"support_threads";i:7;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:137983;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-10 4:12am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-20";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:6268:"<p>a3 Lazy Load is a Mobile Oriented, very simple to use plugin that will speed up sites page load speed. The more content heavy your site the better the plugin will perform and the more you will see the improvements in performance. See <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/stresstest1000img.htm" rel="nofollow">this demo</a> of a page with 1,000 images (yes 1,000 images) to load.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is inspired by and powered by the ressio <a href="https://github.com/ressio/lazy-load-xt" rel="nofollow">Lazy-Load-xt JavaScript</a>.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is the most fully featured, incredibly easy to set up lazy load plugin for WordPress. Use the plugins admin settings to easily define what elements are lazy loaded and when they become visible in the users browser. As the user scrolls down the page the next lot of elements you have applied lazy Load to are only loaded as they become visible in the view port.</p>
<h4>IMAGE LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>Images are the number one element that slows page load and increases bandwidth use. From the a3 Lazy Load admin panel turn load images by a3 Lazy Load ON | OFF. For more flexibility when ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for images in</p>
<ul>
<li>Post and Pages (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Widgets (Sidebar, header and footer)</li>
<li>Apply to post thumbnails</li>
<li>Apply to gravatars</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE THAN JUST IMAGES</h4>
<h4>VIDEO LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load supports all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video &#8211; for a full list see the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Embeds" rel="nofollow">WordPress Codex Embeds</a> list. The WordPress embed method of copying and pasting the video url into posts and pages content area is fully supported. Note &#8211; embed video by WordPress shortcode is not supported.</p>
<p>From the a3 lazy Load admin panel turn Video Support ON | OFF. When ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for videos in</p>
<ul>
<li>Post and Pages (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Widgets (Sidebar, header and footer)</li>
<li>Youtube <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/youtube-iframe.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Video <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/video-html5.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Fully Compatible with the popular <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/youtube-embed/">Youtube Embed Plugin</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>iFRAME LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in support for content that is added by iframe from any source in content and widgets  examples</p>
<ul>
<li>WordPress embedded media</li>
<li>Facebook Like boxes with profiles, Like buttons, Recommend</li>
<li>Google+ Profile</li>
<li>Google Maps</li>
</ul>
<h4>POST EMBED</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fully compatible with WordPress embed post on any site feature introduced in version WP version 4.4</li>
<li>Makes embed post load much faster</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDPRESS AMP</h4>
<ul>
<li>Built in auto support for WordPress AMP plugin</li>
<li>Built in support for Better AMP plugin</li>
<li>There are no setting options for exclude /amp &#8211; Lazy Load is just never applied to the /amp endpoint</li>
<li>When the url is loaded in browser without /amp Lazy Load is applied  </li>
</ul>
<h4>LAZY LOAD EFFECTS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to lazy load images with a FADE IN or SPINNER effect</p>
<ul>
<li>FADEIN <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/fadein.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>SPINNER <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/spinner.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Option to create a custom Lazy Load pre-load background colour</li>
</ul>
<h4>WOOCOMMERCE</h4>
<p>a3 lazy Load is built and tested to be fully compatible with the very widely used WooCommerce plugin</p>
<h4>PERFORMANCE TWEAKS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to load its script from your sites HEAD or from the FOOT.</p>
<ul>
<li>Note that your theme must have the wp_footer() function if you select FOOTER load.</li>
<li>Note the plugin CSS is always loaded from the HEAD.</li>
</ul>
<h4>EXCLUDE IMAGES &amp; VIDEO</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load allows you to easily exclude any images and video by class name from having the Lazy Load effect applied.</p>
<h4>JAVASCIPT DISABLED FALLBACK</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in Noscript fallback if user has JavaScript turned off in their browser. Developers who use underscore.js in their applications can use the Noscript parameter to exclude their plugins content from Lazy Load.</p>
<h4>PLUGIN COMPATIBILITY</h4>
<ul>
<li>Work with any WordPress theme that follows the WordPress Theme Codex</li>
<li>Fully compatible with WPTouch plugin &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if WPTouch is installed</li>
<li>Fully compatible with MobilePress plugin &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if MobilePress is installed</li>
<li>Will not conflict with any plugin that has lazy load built in</li>
<li>Plugin Developers a3 lazy load filter allows them to let lazy load apply to their plugin</li>
<li>Tested 100% compatible with WP Super Cache and W3 Total Cache plugins</li>
<li>Tested 100% compatible with Amazon Cloudfront</li>
<li>Fully compatible with CDN architecture.</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE FEATURES</h4>
<ul>
<li>Full support of jQueryMobile framework</li>
<li>WordPress Multi site ready.</li>
<li>Backend support for RTL display.</li>
<li>Translation ready</li>
</ul>
<h4>JOIN THE a3 LAZY LOAD COMMUNITY</h4>
<p>When you download a3 lazy Load, you join our community. Regardless of if you are a WordPress newbie or experienced developer if youre interested in contributing to a3 Lazy Load development head over to the <a href="https://github.com/a3rev/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">a3 Lazy Load GitHub Repository</a> to find out how you can contribute.<br />
Want to add a new language to a3 Lazy Load? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">translate.wordpress.org</a></p>
<h3>USAGE</h3>
<ol>
<li>Install and activate the plugin</li>
<li>Open WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Click on a3 Lazy Load menu</li>
<li>Turn ON Lazy Load and all preferred settings</li>
<li>Save Changes and enjoy the improved performance Lazy Load will give your site</li>
</ol>
";s:12:"installation";s:142:"<h4>Minimum Requirements</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 4.5</li>
<li>PHP version 5.5.0 or greater</li>
<li>MySQL version 5.5.0 or greater</li>
</ul>
";s:9:"changelog";s:14621:"<h4>1.8.2 &#8211; 2017/06/02</h4>
