<li>Fix &#8211; WordPress Admin Tool Bar User Avatar conflict Issue #2</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.1 &#8211; 2017/05/31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Use correct object A3_Lazy_Load instead of this as it was causing a fatal error</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.0 &#8211; 2017/05/30</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature  Updated for compatibility with Better AMP plugin</li>
<li>Feature  Launched a3Lazy Load Github public Repository</li>
<li>Feature  WordPress Translation activation. Add text domain declaration in file header.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change global $$variable to global ${$variable} for compatibility with PHP 7.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update a3 Revolution to a3rev Software on plugins description</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update plugin framework to latest version</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.7.5</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with PHP 7.0</li>
<li>Fix  Exclude images by class</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Register fontawesome in plugin framework with style name is &#8216;font-awesome-styles&#8217;</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update plugin framework to latest version</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.0 &#8211; 2016/03/01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Full compatibility with AMP plugin. No settings for it just hardcoded that Lazy Load is not applied for any url appended with /amp endpoint. Lazy load is applied to the url without the endpoint</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new &#8216;Background Color&#8217; type on plugin framework with ON | OFF switch to disable background or enable it</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; hextorgb() &#8211; for convert hex color to rgb color on plugin framework</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; generate_background_color_css() &#8211; for export background style code on plugin framework that is used to make custom style</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Saved the time number into database for one time customize style and Save change on the Plugin Settings</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Replace version number by time number for dynamic style file are generated by Sass to solve the issue get cache file on CDN server</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Define new &#8216;strip_methods&#8217; argument for Uploader type, allow strip http/https or no</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Upgraded to the latest version of a3 plugin framework</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.2</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5.2</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Define new placeholder image data for iframe. Microsoft browsers smartscreen filter was blocking the .gif placeholder loading inside iframes and throwing an unsafe website message</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0 &#8211; 2016/01/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add support for Lazy loading images, video or iframe inside content that is loaded by AJAX</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Full support for loading Product Thumbnails within the WooCommerce cart widget</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.1</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.2 &#8211; 2015/12/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change on enqueue styles and scripts for faster load</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Register new script &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt-srcset&#8217; for enqueue when lazyload script is called , full support for WP 4.4 Responsive Images</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Filter for change the &#8216;srcset&#8217; attribute name to &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; name to prevent browsers loading the image while page is loading</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Create a new script for when image comes into view port that it changes &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; to &#8216;srcset&#8217; so image is loaded then by lazy load</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.1 &#8211; 2015/12/11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the placeholder image name from &#8216;placeholder.gif&#8217; to &#8216;lazy_placeholder.gif&#8217; to avoid conflict if thumb image has name like placehoder.gif</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change pattern parameter from &#8220;/data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to &#8220;/ data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to check &#8216;data-src&#8217; exists as attribute of video, image, iframe, Solve the issue when 3rd party script adds attribute with format of name &#8216;***-data-src&#8217; to html tag.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Use preg_match( &#8220;/src=.*lazy_placeholder.gif[&#8216;\&#8221;]/s&#8221;, $imgHTML ) On themes that have loop code was causing loading of the placeholder instead of the image</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.0 &#8211; 2015/12/10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Change media uploader to New UI of WordPress media uploader with WordPress Backbone and Underscore</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Apply Lazy Load for new Embed Post feature on WordPress 4.4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update the uploader script to save the Attachment ID and work with New Uploader</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated a3 Plugin Framework to the latest version</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Full compatibility with Responsive Image feature on WordPress 4.4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the PlaceHolder image from data image to real image placeholder.gif for fix display on IE</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.4</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check if &#8216;HTTP_USER_AGENT&#8217; is defined before call it from strpos</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.1 &#8211; 2015/08/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; include new CSSMin lib from https://github.com/tubalmartin/YUI-CSS-compressor-PHP-port into plugin framework instead of old CSSMin lib from http://code.google.com/p/cssmin/ , to avoid conflict with plugins or themes that have CSSMin lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; make __construct() function for &#8216;Compile_Less_Sass&#8217; class instead of using a method with the same name as the class for compatibility on WP 4.3 and is deprecated on PHP4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; change class name from &#8216;lessc&#8217; to &#8216;a3_lessc&#8217; so that it does not conflict with plugins or themes that have another Lessc lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Plugin Framework DB query optimization. Refactored settings_get_option call for dynamic style elements, example typography, border, border_styles, border_corner, box_shadow</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.3.0</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for setup correct default settings on first installed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for reset to correct default settings when hit on &#8216;Reset Settings&#8217; button on each settings tab</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.0 &#8211; 2015/06/17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Plugin framework Mobile First focus upgrade</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Massive improvement in admin UI and UX in PC, tablet and mobile browsers</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Introducing opening and closing Setting Boxes on admin panels.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Plugin Framework Customization settings. Control how the admin panel settings show when editing.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added House Keeping &#8211; Clean up on Deletion function. ON | OFF switch is in the Plugin Framework Settings Box.  </li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added a 260px wide images to the right sidebar for support forum link, Documentation links.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce Version 2.3.11</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed Add-Ons Menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Moved plugin menu from WordPress Dashboard admin menu to a sub menu on the WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added Settings link to the plugins listing on plugin.php menu for easy access to plugin</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check &#8216;request_filesystem_credentials&#8217; function, if it does not exists then require the core php lib file from WP where it is defined</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3.0 &#8211; 2015/06/05</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Image Load Threshold with set threshold pixel dynamic setting. Default is 0px</li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/setting-threshold?replies=3" rel="nofollow">Onisforos and Matt Pain</a> for suggesting and explaining the new Threshold feature</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.2 &#8211; 2015/06/03</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_put_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_get_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.1 &#8211; 2015/05/26</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update url of dynamic stylesheet in uploads folder to the format <code>//domain.com/</code> so it&#8217;s always is correct when loaded as <code>http</code> or <code>https</code></li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to WordPress member hero12 for bringing the matter <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/css-is-not-loaded-properly-on-https?replies=1" rel="nofollow">to our attention</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.0 &#8211; 2015/05/18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added new extend script to support event when click or tap on tab to load images without having to scroll to initiate load.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested and Tweaked for full compatibility with WordPress Version 4.2.2</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed Permission 777 to 755 for style folder inside the uploads folder</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Chmod 644 for dynamic style and .less files from uploads folder</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.1 &#8211; 2015/04/21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested and Tweaked for full compatibility with WordPress Version 4.2.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update style of plugin framework. Removed the [data-icon] selector to prevent conflict with other plugins that have font awesome icons</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.0 &#8211; 2015/01/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for content that is added by iframe from any source in post and page content and widgets</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added ON | OFF option for Noscript parameter for both images and video and iframes &#8211; fallback if user does not have JavaScript support turned on in browser.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Reworked the plugins admin panel for new feature options. Separate settings for Images and Video / iframes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated all the admin panel text and add new help text.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress description with new features.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress screenshot</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress banner image.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Updated &#8216;a3_lazy_load_enable&#8217; function to edit their image or video attribute to enable a3 lazy load images or videos loaded by 3rd party application.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_image_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute to enable a3 lazy load to apply images loaded by 3rd party applications.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute so a3 lazy load script can apply to the videos, iframe.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Include &#8216;var a3_lazyload_params = {&#8220;apply_images&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;,&#8221;apply_videos&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;};&#8217; JavaScript variable into frontend that get the option that are set from admin panel. Plugin and Theme developers can use that variable inside own script to check when Lazy Load apply for Image and for Video instead of use &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; functions in PHP code</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Remove &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_classes&#8217; filter tag, we will replace another filter for separate filters for image and videos</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_images_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for images that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_videos_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for video that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to videos that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_videos&#8217; filter. Plugin and Theme developers can use this filter and parse the content with videos or iframe and the filter will return content with change on videos or iframe that a3 Lazy Load support</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.2 &#8211; 2015/01/20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Include wp_deregister_script( &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt&#8217; ) before wp_enqueue_script( &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt&#8217; ) for compatibility with a3 Portfolio plugin which supports video slides</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Add new parameter $noscript boolen type for &#8216;a3_lazy_load_html&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_images&#8217; filters to exclude or include noscript from content return of 3rd party plugins.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to images that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.1 &#8211; 2014/12/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Applied lazy load for &#8216;wp_get_attachment_image_attributes&#8217; filter tag for WordPress default [gallery] shortcode</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added link to a3 Lazy Load wordpress.org support forum on plugins description that show on plugins menu</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_enable&#8217; function when Enable Lazy Load is set to ON. Plugin and Theme developers can use the function to edit their image attribute so that a3 lazy load script can apply to the images.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for images that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Lazy Load does not apply to images added by shortcode, excluding the WordPress default [gallery] shortcode</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0 &#8211; 2014/12/20</h4>
<ul>
<li>First working release</li>
</ul>

Podcast Publisher";s:4:"slug";s:39:"podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.6.2";s:6:"author";s:40:"<a href="http://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/eteubert";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:8:"eteubert";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/eteubert";s:8:"chemiker";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/chemiker";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.0";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:26;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:2;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:28;s:15:"support_threads";i:2;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:88461;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-06-26 8:17pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-06-26";s:8:"homepage";s:28:"http://publisher.podlove.org";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3419:"<p>We built the Podlove Podcast Publisher because existing solutions are stuck in the past, complex and unwieldy. The Publisher helps you save time, worry less and provides a cutting edge listening experience for your audience.</p>
<p>Official Site: <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">publisher.podlove.org</a></p>
<h4>Video Tutorial: Getting started with Podlove Publisher</h4>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hmrm-jUe6u4?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span>
<h4>Compatible Feeds</h4>
<p>The Publisher makes it easy to create highly expressive, efficient and super compatible podcast feeds with fine grained control over client behavior (e.g. GUID control to replace faulty episodes and for clients to reload) supporting all important meta data.</p>
<h4>Multi-Format Publishing</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes multi-format publishing &#8211; embracing all modern and legacy audio and video codecs &#8211; a snap. By adopting simple file name conventions, the plugin allows the podcaster to provide individual feeds for certain use cases or audiences without adding work for the podcaster during the publishing process.</p>
<h4>Optimized Web Player</h4>
<p>The Publisher also comes with integrated with the Podlove Web Player plugin (which you do not need to install separately) and fully support its advanced options including multiple audio (MP4 AAC, MP3, Vorbis, Opus) and video (MP4 H.264, WebM, Theora) format support for web browsers. This Web Player is fully HTML5 compatible (but provides Flash fallback for ancient environments) and is ready for all touch based clients too.</p>
<h4>Chapter Support</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes it easy to publish chapter information in the player to make access to structured episodes even easier. Full support for linking directly to any part of your podcast on the web with instant playback included.</p>
<h4>Flexible Templates</h4>
<p>To round it all up, a flexible template system enables you to published Podcasts in a defined fashion and change the style at any time without having to touch your individual postings later on.</p>
<p>And this is just the beginning. We have a rich roadmap that will bring even more interesting features: integration with helpful services, much improved timeline metadata support (show notes) and much more.</p>
<h4>Further Reading</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Publisher</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Project</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community</a></li>
<li><a href="http://docs.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues" rel="nofollow">Bug Tracker</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/donations/" rel="nofollow">Donate</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Development of the plugin is an open process. The current version is available <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher" rel="nofollow">on GitHub</a> Feel free to contribute and to fix errors or send improvements via GitHub.</p>
<p>Requires PHP 5.4+</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:410:"<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Publisher Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2474:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Publisher Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Is Podlove Podcast Publisher free?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! The core features of Podlove Podcast Publisher are and always will be free. <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow">Paid Professional Support</a> is available but not necessary to run the plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there Download Statistics?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! Podcast Downloads can be tracked and analyzed. You can easily see how many people downloaded you podcast episodes, which clients they used, if they prefer to subscribe to the feed or listen on your website using the web player—and much more.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I host my podcast files?</h4>
<p>
<p>Any storage where you have control over the file naming is compatible with Podlove Podcast Publisher. You can manage files using a simple FTP/sFTP or use services like Amazon S3.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I ask questions and get support?</h4>
<p>
<p>Free support where questions are answered by the community is available in the <a href="http://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community Forum</a>. There is a German community in the <a href="https://sendegate.de/" rel="nofollow">Sendegate</a>. <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/support" rel="nofollow">Professional Support</a> by the plugin developer is also available.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I help the project?</h4>
<p>
<p>The continued success of Open Source project relies on the community. There are many ways you can help:</p>
<ul>
<li>If you enjoy the plugin, please <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/reviews/#new-post" rel="nofollow">leave a review</a>.</li>
<li>You can answer questions of other fellow podcasters in the <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community</a>.</li>
<li>You can buy <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow">Support</a> to financially support the project.</li>
</ul>
<p>This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from http://www.maxmind.com.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:111309:"<h4>2.6.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>send <code>HTTP 410 Gone</code> when accessing a download URL to a depublished episode</li>
<li>fix Podlove Web Player 4 appearing on wrong positions when multiple players are embedded on the same page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix template bug (when a template returned an empty result, the template title was displayed instead)</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Flattr</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>rename &#8220;Flattr Username&#8221; to &#8220;Flattr ID&#8221;</li>
<li>insert <code>flattr:id</code> meta tag to page heads, which is required for their new system</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.0</h4>
<p><strong>New Module: E-Mail Notifications</strong></p>
<p>This is a new module complementing the existing contributor module. Once activated, it enables you to send emails to contributors when an episode gets published.</p>
<p>You can find the settings at <code>Contributors &gt; E-Mail Notifications</code>. The settings are:</p>
<ul>
<li><em>email subject and message</em>, customizable with all available template tags</li>
<li>a <em>time delay</em> until the message is sent after the episode was published</li>
<li>who will receive the message by using <em>groups and roles as a filter</em></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Podlove Web Player 4 Alpha</strong></p>
<p>After months of work we&#8217;re ready to show you what we&#8217;re working on: A new take on the modern Web Player. We learned from previous attempts and thought about responsiveness and embeddability from day one. Of course there&#8217;s full support for chapter marks, too.</p>
<p>Give it a try if you like. Be aware though that it&#8217;s marked as <em>alpha</em>, meaning we&#8217;re still working on new features and fixing bugs in existing ones when we find them. But if you&#8217;re curious, head over to <code>Podlove &gt; Podcast Settings &gt; Player</code>, switch to Podlove Web Player 4 and <a href="https://community.podlove.org/c/podlove-web-player" rel="nofollow">let us know what you think</a>.</p>
<p>Once Podlove Web Player 4 is stable, it will be the only actively supported Podlove Player. Podlove Web Player 3 isn&#8217;t being developed anymore.</p>
<p>And finally, all web players can now be previewed on the settings screen.</p>
<p><strong>Templates</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Assets now have an identifier <code>asset.id</code> to quickly access a file for an asset within an episode, for example: <code>episode.file("mp3")</code></li>
<li>Contributors already had such an id, but now there is a new accessor to get a single contributor by id, for example: <code>podcast.contributor("jerry")</code></li>
<li>DEPRECATED: id parameter in <code>podcast.contributors</code> to access a single contributor: <code>podcast.contributors({id: "jerry"})</code>.</li>
<li>Feeds can now be accessed the same way by their slug: <code>podcast.feed("mp3")</code></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Analytics</strong></p>
<p>Download tracking is now turned on by default in new setups.</p>
<p><strong>Bits &amp; Pieces</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>network dashboard statistics: fix average length and file size; remove &#8220;days between episodes&#8221;</li>
<li>episodes: prettify &#8220;detect episode duration&#8221; UI</li>
<li>episodes: enhance media file UI:
<ul>
<li>rename &#8220;update&#8221; button to &#8220;verify&#8221;</li>
<li>move &#8220;update all media files&#8221; button above &#8220;verify&#8221; buttons and rename it to &#8220;verify all&#8221;</li>
<li>show file URL even if url cannot be reached</li>
<li>show Bytes in human readable format</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>episodes: fix focus when adding contributors to episodes</li>
<li>episode asset settings: increase assets per page from 10 to 100</li>
<li>episode asset settings: fix format filtering by type</li>
<li>episode assets: new &#8220;name&#8221; attribute for reference in templates, for example <code>episode.file('cover').url</code> where &#8220;cover&#8221; is the asset name</li>
<li>support page: add Publisher icon to &#8220;Get Professional Support&#8221; callout</li>
<li>contributors: services only get deleted on &#8220;Save Changes&#8221;, not immediately</li>
<li>contributors: fix sorting by contribution count in the admin interface</li>
<li>contributors: fix minor PHP issue when creating new contributors</li>
<li>templates: immediately purge cache on updating any template</li>
<li>Podlove Subscribe Button: add module option to deliver locally instead of using the CDN, but continue to default to CDN</li>
<li>job dashboard: add mode description to jobs where necessary to distinguish between different run settings</li>
<li>be tolerant to missing PHP iconv module</li>
<li>fix Auphonic chapter import</li>
<li>update Hindenburg chapter parser</li>
<li>new PHP constant <code>PODLOVE_DISABLE_IMAGE_CACHE</code> to disable image caching</li>
<li>fix security vulnerability (thanks to DefenseCode, who found the vulnerability using their tool ThunderScan and kindly approached us)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix broken settings tabs (introduced by German translation)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix episode sorting by recording date (<code>podcast.episodes({orderby: 'recordingDate'})</code>)</li>
<li>services: use https URLs where available (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/911" rel="nofollow">#911</a>)</li>
<li>services: add Spreaker (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/912" rel="nofollow">#912</a>)</li>
<li>contributors: adjust description of &#8220;Public Name&#8221; because it was misleading (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/914" rel="nofollow">#914</a>)</li>
<li>services: fix URL encoding issue (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/915" rel="nofollow">#915</a>)</li>
<li>network: fix system report notice that ensures module is setup correctly (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/916" rel="nofollow">#916</a>)</li>
<li>remove ADN link from support page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.1</h4>
<p><strong>Enhance Chapter UI</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>fix encoding of &#8220;&amp;&#8221; character</li>
<li>add support for Hindenburg project files</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.0</h4>
<p><strong>New Chapter Management UI</strong></p>
<p>Until now if you wanted to add chapters to your podcast, you had to write the mp4chaps format by hand into a textfield. The Publisher now finally provides an easy-to-use interface to manage chapters that doesn&#8217;t require any knowledge about the underlying formats.</p>
<p>The new inferace makes it simple to import chapters from files. We currently support <a href="https://podlove.org/simple-chapters/" rel="nofollow">PSC (Podlove Simple Chapters)</a>, mp4chaps and Audacity Track Labels. <a href="https://community.podlove.org/c/podlove-publisher" rel="nofollow">Let us know</a> if we don&#8217;t support your favorite program&#8217;s export format.</p>
<p><strong>Module: Import/Export</strong></p>
<p>Podcast import has been rewritten to make full use of Background Jobs. That way podcasts of any size can be imported without running into system resource restrictions for large podcasts.</p>
<p><strong>Background Jobs</strong></p>
<p>The jobs dashboard on the tools page now shows job statuses in realtime (refreshes automatically).</p>
<p>Adjusted background job duration parameters and made them configurable. The change of defaults aims to make better use of available cron time (normally 30 seconds per request), which can speed up long running background jobs dramatically.</p>
<p>Please refer to the new <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/podlove-publisher/developer/background-jobs.html" rel="nofollow">Background Jobs page in the documentation</a> for more details.</p>
<p><strong>Bits &amp; Pieces</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>remove module: App.net (because they <a href="http://blog.app.net/2017/01/12/app-net-is-shutting-down/" rel="nofollow">are shutting down</a>)</li>
<li>fix tracking export</li>
<li>redirects (expert settings): redirect counter can be reset</li>
<li>contributor avatars use WordPress media picker</li>
<li>optimize use of JavaScript:
<ul>
<li>only load scripts on pages that require them</li>
<li>concatenate and minify some scripts</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.6 / 2.4.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Image cache: support non-pretty permalinks.</li>
<li>fix feed compatibility issue with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/relevanssi/">Relevanssi plugin</a></li>
<li>services: fix lastfm url scheme (thanks <a href="https://github.com/jazzcrack" rel="nofollow">jazzcrack</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.5</h4>
<p>Image cache: change URL encoding method to fix Gravatar issues.</p>
<h4>2.4.4</h4>
<p>Further image cache improvements:</p>
<ul>
<li>reject URLs that are not images</li>
<li>prefix query vars to avoid naming conflicts with other plugins</li>
<li>fix resizing sometimes not calculating the correct dimensions</li>
<li>enhancement: skip http when using images shipped with the Publisher; copy images from Publisher to cache directory on filesystem instead</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.3</h4>
<p>Fix issue with broken images introduced in 2.4.2.</p>
<h4>2.4.2</h4>
<p><strong>Improve Image Caches</strong></p>
<p>Images relevant to the Podlove Publisher are downloaded so they can be resized to desired dimensions. This makes it possible to deliver retina-images and improves the website performance because only the appropriate image size delivered.</p>
<p>This requires files to be downloaded. Until now, this happened in the background to avoid slow web page load times when the image is fetched. Until the cache existed, the original file URL to the unresized file was used. This worked alright, unless you were using a page cache plugin. The original file URL would be used much longer than necessary, causing big file downloads.</p>
<p>Now a different approach is used. Instead of the original file URL, a dynamic link is generated, looking like this one: <code>https://example.com/podlove/image/http%3A%2F%2Fexample.com%2Fmedia%2Fmypodcast%2Fmy-podcast-logo-1500x1500.jpg/300/300/0/my-podcast</code>. When this link is requested, the cached and resized image is either delivered or, if it doesn&#8217;t exist, generated on-the-fly. Once the cached file exists, the direct link to the cached file is delivered, just like before. The major improvement is that even if the initial URL is stuck in your page cache, the Publisher is now able to deliver a properly resized image anyway.</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>set correct feed Content-Type in HEAD requests and redirects</li>
<li>enhancement: repair &amp; clear cache tools print a notice about other cache plugins</li>
<li>fix &#8220;Last Month&#8221; download widget in analytics</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>services: Playstation Network Account now links to <code>http://psnprofiles.com</code></li>
<li>allow spaces in episode slugs</li>
<li>add help tab to analytics pages</li>
<li>fix Podlove Web Player 2 timecode share link</li>
<li>fix issue with image cache filenames (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/895" rel="nofollow">PR 895</a>)</li>
<li>fix WP-Rocket incompatibility with Podigee Player</li>
<li>fix Auphonic: when neither episode image nor post thumbnail are present, fallback to podcast cover art</li>
<li>fix PHP warnings in oembed module</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.0</h4>
<p><strong>Background Jobs System</strong></p>
<p>Crunching numbers for Analytics takes time, especially for popular podcasts with many downloads. The old system was written optimistically and &#8220;let&#8217;s-hope-we-finish-before-we-run-out-of-time&#8221;-ish. That was certainly good enough for podcasts with a few hundred downloads per episode, but more likely a gamble for popular shows.<br />
To solve this issue in a scaleable way, we built what is known as &#8220;background processing&#8221; or &#8220;queues&#8221;. That way we can break big tasks into small chunks and process them step by step. You don&#8217;t really need to know about this, since the main effect is that calculating analytics should be a smoother experience (if you have ever had troubles in that regard) but if you are curious, have a look at the new &#8220;Tools&#8221; section, which lists running and recently finished jobs.</p>
<p><strong>New Analytics Dashboard</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;Downloads per Day&#8221; is a stacked bar chart now so you can see which episode is responsible for peaks</li>
<li>Downloads table now shows downloads in time segments starting from the moment of episode release for better comparability</li>
<li>Show total number of all downloads in Analytics Dashboard</li>
<li>New information under downloads table: age of the data and when the next refresh is due</li>
<li><em>MUCH</em> better performance / page load times</li>
<li>New option to configure how many episodes per page should be shown</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Podlove Web Player 2 Facelift</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>simplified, modernised look</li>
<li>responsive layout for mobile devices</li>
<li>fix: updated mediaelement library to fix volume bar display bug</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Podigee Podcast Player</strong></p>
<p>The <a href="https://www.podigee.com/en/podcast-player" rel="nofollow">Podigee Podcast Player</a> is available as an alternative to the Podlove Web Players. It supports everything you can expect from a modern web player like chaptermarks. It is also embeddable.</p>
<p><strong>New &#8220;Tools&#8221; Menu</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>A new maintenance section gathers tools like the &#8220;Repair&#8221; button in one place</li>
<li>There is a new section for analytics related maintenance</li>
<li>Import &amp; Export is now in the &#8220;Tools&#8221; menu</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Improved Logging Display</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Logging is now in the &#8220;Support&#8221; menu</li>
<li>add filtering for different severities</li>
<li>hide &#8220;info&#8221; entries by default</li>
<li>improve readability of data sections</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>add Emoji support for episode subtitle, summary and chapter marks (requires WordPress 4.2 or newer)</li>
<li>Web Player setttings moved from Expert Settings to Podcast Settings</li>
<li>When activating the plugin, add mp3 asset and feed to help users get over the most confusing part of the setup.</li>
<li>Post thumbnails can be used as episode covers (see settings in &#8220;Episode Assets&#8221;). This is the new default.</li>
<li>add contributors shortcode to default template (Many people activated contributors and then wondered why they were not displayed in the episode. Now the shortcode is part of the default template, but only if the contributors module is active.)</li>
<li>add unmistakable warning if curl is not available and provide actionable steps for a solution</li>
<li>change feed setting &#8220;Include HTML Content&#8221; default to &#8220;on&#8221;</li>
<li>remove log entries for beginning and ending asset validations</li>
<li>move feed protection into separate module</li>
<li>move debug log from Dashboard to Support page</li>
<li>add ptm_request parameter to redirected tracking URLs which contains a uuid</li>
<li>add fyyd.de module</li>
<li>add option to enforce http or https in URLs inside feeds (enclosures, images) and the actual feed URLs; see <code>Expert Settings &gt; Website</code></li>
<li>improve tracking: ignore 1-byte requests</li>
<li>update user agent library (new/updated clients: Podcat, Downcast, iCatcher, BashPodder)</li>
<li>show total downloads per site in network dashboard</li>
<li>remove <code>&lt;itunes:keywords&gt;</code> from feed (it disappeared from the specification)</li>
<li>remove module: &#8220;Feed Validator&#8221;</li>
<li>update recommended image size to 3000&#215;3000 pixel</li>
<li>add heartbeat to keep note of when tracking is active</li>
<li><code>shortcode_exists($shortcode_name)</code> is now available in Twig templates</li>
<li>system report: add notice if ALTERNATE_WP_CRON is active</li>
<li>fix tracking export: keep httprange</li>
<li>fix compatibility with other plugins relying on Spyc library</li>
<li>fix <code>{{ episode.duration.totalMilliseconds }}</code></li>
<li>fix image caching issue (invisible characters)</li>
<li>fix: When plugin requirements are not met, admin notices are now still shown once but the plugin is automatically deactivated after that. This avoids faulty setups.</li>
<li>fix: show podcast covers in network site switcher</li>
<li>fix: expert settings not saving on some systems</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.3.16</h4>
<ul>
<li>security: fix SQL injection</li>
<li>security: remove several Cross-Site Scripting vulnerabilities</li>
</ul>
<p>All vulnerabilities require admin capabilities. That means they cannot be exploitet easily, but could be using Cross-site request forgery (CSRF).</p>
<p>Thanks to <a href="https://www.ripstech.com/" rel="nofollow">RIPS Technologies</a> for reporting these issues. The issues were found using their Static Source-Code Analyzer RIPS.</p>

<li>Some shared hosters seem to have problems with the plugin update process, which leads to the Publisher missing files and breaking the site. This is now also detected and a notice appears, asking the user to manually redownload the plugin.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.0</h4>
<p><strong>New Module: Seasons</strong></p>
<p>Do you have seasonal content? We got you covered. The new &#8220;Seasons&#8221; module allows you to group episodes into seasons. Each season has a title and other optional metadata, like a custom image. You can access all this data using the template system.</p>
<p>New Template accessors:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>episode.season</code> returns the season for the episode</li>
<li><code>podcast.seasons</code> returns a list of all seasons</li>
<li><code>season.episodes</code> returns a list of all episodes in a season</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>New Module: Flattr</strong></p>
<p>Everything Flattr related was moved into its own module.<br />
If you don&#8217;t use Flattr, you can turn it off and it gets out of your way.</p>
<ul>
<li>If you are using the Flattr module, we write Flattr payment information into podcast feeds. This way you don&#8217;t need to rely on the official Flattr plugin to do this. You can probably deactivate it if you were using it since we provide the main functionality within the Publisher now.</li>
<li>We recently changed the default <code>flattr</code> parameter in shortcodes. Now there&#8217;s a setting in Flattr Podcast Settings where you can define the default parameter for contributor shortcodes.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>New Module: Related Episodes</strong></p>
<p>You can now express that episodes are related to each other. You can list all related episodes using the new shortcode <code>[podlove-related-episodes]</code> or using the template accessor <code>episode.relatedEpisodes</code>.</p>
<p><strong>Templates &amp; Themes</strong></p>
<p>If you are developing themes, you now have full access to the Publisher Template system. The API is exactly the same as in Twig, just the syntax is different. At the moment, there are 4 entry points:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>\Podlove\get_episode()</code></li>
<li><code>\Podlove\get_podcast()</code></li>
<li><code>\Podlove\get_flattr()</code></li>
<li><code>\Podlove\get_network()</code></li>
</ul>
<p>Please see the <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/guides/understanding-templates/" rel="nofollow">&#8220;Understanding Templates&#8221; guide</a> for more details.</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Use WordPress Object Cache API to cache model objects. All entities fetched by id are cached and reused within the same page call. Performance gains are most notably in complex templates, which often access the same data repeatedly.</li>
<li>Analytics: Update &amp; improve user agent detection library so you can have more accurate analytics.</li>
<li>Canonical feed URLs. WordPress respects if you want your URLs to end with a slash or not (you do that by adding or removing the trailing slash from your WordPress permalink settings custom structure). Our feed URLs now respect this choice, too. Furthermore, we permanently redirect to the canonical URL if another one was accessed to ensure all clients access <em>exactly</em> the same feed URL.</li>
<li>News from podlove.org are displayed in the Podlove Dashboard</li>
<li>Users with role &#8220;author&#8221; and higher now have access to the Podlove Dashboard and Analytics. They only have access to dashboard sections that make sense for authors, so they won&#8217;t see logging, feed or asset validation.</li>
<li>Contributors can now be edited in <em>Contributor Settings</em> (instead of <em>Episodes &gt; Contributors</em>)</li>
<li>Contributors Social Services: It is now possible to add a YouTube &#8220;Channel&#8221;, not just user profiles</li>
<li>Contributors Social Donations: Add &#8220;paypal.me&#8221; option</li>
<li>Add functionality to automatically determine the duration for episodes. This is especially useful for people who don&#8217;t use Auphonic, which already determines the duration automatically.</li>
<li>We are now able to handle media files that are served without a &#8220;Content-Length&#8221; header. A specific warning is generated and the size is displayed as &#8220;unknown&#8221;, but the files are treated as valid so they can be played.</li>
<li>Add support for Auphonic webhooks. This allows us to import your episode metadata once an Auphonic production is finished — even if you navigated away from the episode page.</li>
<li>Podcast cover image can now be uploaded using the WordPress media uploader.</li>
<li>Add <code>contributor.gender</code> template accessor</li>
<li>Rename network list &#8220;description&#8221; to &#8220;summary&#8221; for consistency. In templates <code>list.description</code> is now deprecated. Please use <code>list.summary</code> instead.</li>
<li>fix: Shortcodes in episode subtitle and summary are not interpreted any more. Both fields were always considered plain text and having shortcodes leads to various issues, especially in feeds.</li>
<li>export files are now gzipped if possible</li>
<li>fix JavaScript incompatibility related to Diaspora plugin (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/771" rel="nofollow">#771</a>, <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/770" rel="nofollow">#770</a>, <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/425" rel="nofollow">#425</a>, thanks <a href="https://github.com/noplanman" rel="nofollow">@noplanman</a>!)</li>
<li>fix: failing geo-lookup does not break tracking links</li>
<li>fix: Remove WordPress favicon (since WP 4.3) from podcast feeds if a podcast image is set</li>
<li>fix: pasting into a template creates change-marker</li>
<li>fix: tracking import does not skip the last few entries</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.2.0</h4>
<p><strong>Image Caching, Resizing &amp; Retina Support</strong></p>
<p>We now take better control of podcast images, episode images, contributor avatars and our own social icons.<br />
We are able to <em>resize</em> them to ideal sizes, which results in <em>faster page load times</em> for your users. <em>Retina<br />
images</em> for higher-resolution displays are also supported. We do this automatically, so all you need to do<br />
is click update, lean back and enjoy.</p>
<p>Read all the details in our blog post <a href="http://podlove.org/2015/05/20/podlove-publisher-2-2/" rel="nofollow">&#8220;Podlove Publisher 2.2: Say hello to image caching&#8221;</a></p>
<p>This update increases the WordPress requirement from 3.0 to 3.5 (due to the required image editing functionality).</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>fix: duplicate feed discovery</li>
<li>fix: ignore incomplete feed configurations</li>
<li>fix: don&#8217;t include network admin module css in frontend</li>
<li>fix: dashboard episode edit links</li>
<li>fix: when deleting WordPress Network sites, trigger plugin uninstall to remove database tables</li>
<li>fix: web player flash fallback</li>
<li>fix: network templates now also appear in the template widget and template auto-insert setting</li>
<li>fix: issue where some database tables were not created</li>
<li>fix: podcast covers are displayed in frontend admin menu bar</li>
<li>show Twig template errors in dashboard log</li>
<li>web player template tag can set tracking context: <code>episode.player({context: 'landing-page'})</code></li>
<li>add <code>episode.categories</code> template tag</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Deprecations</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>deprecated <code>episode.imageUrl</code>, use <code>episode.image</code> instead</li>
<li>deprecated <code>episode.imageUrlWithFallback</code>, use <code>episode.image({fallback: true})</code> instead</li>
<li>deprecated <code>podcast.imageUrl</code>, use <code>podcast.image</code> instead</li>
<li>deprecated <code>service.logoUrl</code>, use <code>service.image</code> instead</li>
<li>deprecated <code>contributor.avatar</code>, use <code>contributor.image</code> instead</li>
</ul>
<p>While you are changing these, consider scaling them down appropriately. Your images are probably huge but in many cases you don&#8217;t need the full size. So instead of <code>episode.image</code> or <code>episode.image.url</code>, specify a size, like this <code>episode.image.url({width: 200})</code>.</p>

<ul>

<h4>2.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: remove obsolete &#8220;Add New&#8221; template button from network templates screen</li>
<li>fix: template autoinsert does not use deprecated &#8220;id&#8221; parameter</li>
<li>fix: template widget does not use deprecated &#8220;id&#8221; parameter</li>
<li>fix: duplicate episodes in feeds</li>
<li>fix: some server configurations (especially on shared webhosting) break cURLs ability to follow HTTP redirects. We now check for that configuration and, if necessary, resolve the URL manually before continuing normally.</li>
<li>fix: XSS vulnerabilities in contributors search</li>
<li>fix: Template accessor <code>contributor.id</code> now correctly returns the id, not the uri. <code>contributor.uri</code> is the new accessor to get the uri.</li>
<li>fix: Filtering contributions by id is now correctly affected by other filters, like group and role. Until now, <code>podcast.contributors({id: 'james', role: 'on-air'})</code> always returned James, no matter if he had the given role or not. </li>
<li>add &#8220;Add New Contributor&#8221; item to contributor select list. Selecting it opens the screen to add a new contributor.</li>
<li>add Twig version to system report</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.0</h4>
<p><strong>Networks: WordPress Multisite Support is Here</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>dedicated WordPress Multisite support</li>
<li>&#8220;My Sites&#8221; menu features podcast covers and menus include often used pages like &#8220;Podlove Dashboard&#8221; and episodes</li>
<li>Network Dashboard provides a birds-eye view over your podcast empire</li>
<li>Network-Templates that are accessible in every podcast</li>
<li>Podcast lists: give templates access to multiple podcasts at once, allowing you to automatically list all podcasts in your network, the 10 last episode releases in your network and much more</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Widgets</strong></p>
<p>We added a happy bunch of widgets to make your life easy.</p>
<ul>
<li>Podcast Information: Display cover, subtitle and summary of your podcast</li>
<li>Recent Episodes: Display a list of recent episodes, with cover art and duration if you like</li>
<li>Template: Display any Publisher template in a widget area</li>
<li>Podcast License</li>
</ul>
<p>The Subscribe Button Widget now defaults to &#8220;Big with Logo&#8221; and auto-width. It has also been renamed to &#8220;Podcast Subscribe Button&#8221; to be distinguishable from the new standalone plugin.</p>
<p><strong>Templates</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>add accessors <code>{{ podcast.landingPageUrl }}</code>, <code>{{ podcast.subscribe_button }}</code> (see http://docs.podlove.org/reference/template-tags/#podcast)</li>
<li>add accessor <code>{{ flattr.button }}</code> (see http://docs.podlove.org/reference/template-tags/#flattr)</li>
<li>add accessor <code>{{ episode.podcast }}</code></li>
<li>
<p>add query parameters to &#8220;{{ contributor.episodes }}`:</p>
<ul>
<li>group: Filter by contribution group. Default: &#8221;.</li>
<li>role: Filter by contribution role. Default: &#8221;.</li>
<li>post_status: Publication status of the post. Defaults to &#8216;publish&#8217;</li>
<li>order: Designates the ascending or descending order of the &#8216;orderby&#8217; parameter. Defaults to &#8216;DESC&#8217;.
<ul>
<li>&#8216;ASC&#8217; &#8211; ascending order from lowest to highest values (1, 2, 3; a, b, c).</li>
<li>&#8216;DESC&#8217; &#8211; descending order from highest to lowest values (3, 2, 1; c, b, a).</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>orderby: Sort retrieved episodes by parameter. Defaults to &#8216;publicationDate&#8217;.
<ul>
<li>&#8216;publicationDate&#8217; &#8211; Order by publication date.</li>
<li>&#8216;recordingDate&#8217; &#8211; Order by recording date.</li>
<li>&#8216;title&#8217; &#8211; Order by title.</li>
<li>&#8216;slug&#8217; &#8211; Order by episode slug.</li>
<li>&#8216;limit&#8217; &#8211; Limit the number of returned episodes.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>add gender contribution statistics to dashboard</li>
<li>add expert setting &#8220;Allow to skip feed redirects&#8221;</li>
<li>add warning in tracking settings when default permalink structure is used</li>
<li>add support for Auphonic cover art</li>
<li>add support for Jetpack &#8220;Publicize&#8221; module to podcast post type</li>
<li>add warning when open_basedir is set to system report</li>
<li>add daily cleanup of logging table (only keep entries of previous 4 weeks)</li>
<li>contributor editing has a tabbed interface</li>
<li>improved Podlove Dashboard performance</li>
<li>Open Graph title does not include episode subtitle any more. If a subtitle is available, it is put in front of the summary in the description tag.</li>
<li>fix: remove Jetpack &#8220;Site Icon&#8221; from podcast feeds</li>
<li>fix: empty template editor when last template is deleted</li>
<li>fix: empty caches when a scheduled episode gets published</li>
<li>fix analytics episode average calculation for ancient episodes</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>API changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Flattr parameter in <code>[podlove-episode-contributor-list]</code> now defaults to &#8220;no&#8221;. If you need to reactivate it, use <code>[podlove-episode-contributor-list flattr="yes"]</code></li>
<li><code>[podlove-web-player]</code> was renamed to <code>[podlove-episode-web-player]</code> to avoid clashes with the standalone web player plugin. For now, the old shortcode still works.</li>
<li><code>[podlove-subscribe-button]</code> was renamed to <code>[podlove-podcast-subscribe-button]</code> to avoid clashes with the standalone button plugin. For now, the old shortcode still works.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.0.3</h4>
<p><em>Allow Non-Admins to access Analytics</em></p>
<p>Analytics have a new capability called &#8220;podlove_read_analytics&#8221;.<br />
You can provide access to, for example, editors, using the following code snippet:</p>
<pre><code>function podsnip_add_capability() {
    // default roles: editor, author, contributor, subscriber
    $role = get_role('editor');
    $role-&gt;add_cap('podlove_read_analytics');
}
add_action( 'admin_init', 'podsnip_add_capability');
</code></pre>
<p>You can add snippets using the &#8220;Code Snippets&#8221; plugin.</p>

</ul>

<h4>2.0.0</h4>
<p><strong>Download Analytics</strong></p>
<p>You want to know more about who listens to your podcast? We got you covered.</p>
<p>We spent months of research and prototyping to find a reliable way of tracking. We are confident that our approach works and produces trustworthy data. If you have not done so yet, you have to activate tracking in <em>Expert Settings -&gt; Tracking</em>.</p>
<p>If you are interested in all the technical details, head over to http://docs.podlove.org/guides/download-analytics/.</p>
<p>But what you are seeing now is just the beginning. We have a plethora of ideas on how to give you even more insight into the data available. Stay tuned!</p>
<p>We are curious what you think about the current analytics interface? What do you love? What do you hate? What do you miss? Head over to our new community site and share your thoughts: https://community.podlove.org/</p>
<p><strong>Bugfixes</strong></p>

<p><strong>Deprecations &amp; Migration</strong></p>
<p>If you are using <code>{{ contributor.publicemail }}</code> in your templates, you should change it to something like the following:</p>
<pre><code>{% for service in contributor.services({type: "email"}) %}
    &lt;a target="_blank" href="{{ service.profileUrl }}"&gt;{{ service.rawValue }}&lt;/a&gt;
{% endfor %}
</code></pre>

<h4>1.10.14</h4>
<p><strong>Performance</strong></p>
<p>A simple yet effective caching strategy has been implemented. This is used to cache rendered site segments. A complete cache invalidation happens when podcast related data changes. This should be a good start since such data rarely changes (mostly when a new episode is published). In a Multisite setup, each site handles its cache separately.</p>
<p>This is implemented using the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Transients_API" rel="nofollow">Transients API</a>. By default, WordPress uses the database as a caching backend. If you want to squeeze out even more speed, consider installing a <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Class_Reference/WP_Object_Cache#Persistent_Cache_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Persistent Cache Plugin</a> which replaces the database with a more efficient caching backend, such as memcached or APC. That might require some fiddling around, though.</p>
<p>Caching can be deactivated in the <code>wp-config.php</code> with the following line: <code>define('PODLOVE_TEMPLATE_CACHE', false);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Cache Publisher templates</li>
<li>Cache feed discovery header</li>
<li>Cache Bitlove widget</li>
<li>Other minor performance improvements</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Templates</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>There is now a default template containing the player and download section</li>
<li>Episode contributions can be sorted by comment and position, for example: <code>episode.contributors({orderby: "comment", order: "DESC"})</code> or episode.contributors({orderby: &#8220;position&#8221;, order: &#8220;ASC&#8221;})</li>
<li>Iterate over the list of episode tags: <code>{% for tag in episode.tags({order: "DESC", orderby: "count"}) %} {{ tag.name }} {% endfor %}</code></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Display available processing time in Auphonic production box</li>
<li>Episode slugs may contain a wider variety of characters now, such as umlauts.</li>
<li>Feeds now only contain contributors with an URI. Also, output of contributors in feeds can be filtered by group and/or role.</li>
<li>New donation option for Auphonic Credits</li>
<li>Remove scary debug output on failed media file validations. This can be found in the log now.</li>
<li>Fix Auphonic authentication issue by providing the whole certificate chain</li>
<li>Fix contributor related feed rendering issue</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.13</h4>
<p>We decided to remove the &#8220;Force Download&#8221; feature. Its purpose was to guarantee that a click on a download button results in a download dialogue, rather than playing the media file in the browser. The way we implemented it worked, but came with many downsides. Just to name two of them:<br />
1) We doubled the traffic and significantly increased load since we had to pull all the bytes through the webserver in addition to the download server (even if both are the same).<br />
2) It was impossible to support HTTP range requests. That means no client was able to resume a broken or paused download. It also seemed to lead to strange behaviour in the web player.</p>
<p>But there is another, superior way to force downloads: configure your download server. The important setting here is <a href="http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec19.html#sec19.5.1" rel="nofollow">Content-Disposition</a>.</p>
<p>In <em>Apache</em>, you need the <code>headers</code> module (<code>a2enmod headers</code> on Debian-ish distributions). Then you can add this to your configuration:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;FilesMatch "\.(mp3|m4a|ogg|oga|ogv|opus|mpg|m4v|webm|flac|pdf|epub|zip)$"&gt;
    Header set Content-Disposition attachment
&lt;/FilesMatch&gt;
</code></pre>
<p><em>lighttpd</em>:</p>
<pre><code>$HTTP["url"] =~ "\.(mp3|m4a|ogg|oga|ogv|opus|mpg|m4v|webm|flac|pdf|epub|zip)$" {
    setenv.add-response-header = ("Content-Disposition" =&gt; "attachment")
}
</code></pre>
<p><em>Nginx</em>:</p>
<pre><code>if ($request_filename ~ "\.(mp3|m4a|ogg|oga|ogv|opus|mpg|m4v|webm|flac|pdf|epub)$"){
    add_header Content-Disposition 'attachment';
}
</code></pre>
<p><strong>Other Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Trim whitespace around some URLs that appear in the podcast feed.</li>
<li>Update certificate for auth.podlove.org</li>
<li>Fix an issue with saving contributors in <code>Podlove &gt; Podcast Settings &gt; Contributors</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.12</h4>
<p><strong>Tracking</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Never redirect media file URLs to trailing-slash-URLs (WordPress has a habit of adding a trailing slash to every URL via redirect. That is undesirable here, since it create two download intents).</li>
<li>Handle empty user agent strings</li>
<li>Do not write anything to tracking-database unless tracking is in analytics mode.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Compress export files via gzip.</li>
<li>Add tracking data to export files.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.11</h4>
<p><strong>Tracking</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>For increased compatibility (we are looking at you, iTunes), new file URLs without parameters are used when analytics are active.</li>
<li>Add <code>&amp;ptm_file=&lt;episode-slug&gt;.&lt;file-extension&gt;</code> parameter to the end of Parameter-URLs, so tools like wget generate a filename with a correct extension by default.</li>
<li>Feed URLs now support a <code>&amp;tracking=no</code> parameter, which dynamically disables tracking parameters in feed enclosures. This is introduced for debugging purposes and is only mentioned here for the sake of completeness.</li>
<li>Fix PHP glitch that caused tracking to go into &#8220;Tracking URL Parameters&#8221; mode even when it was disabled</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>ADN Module</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix issue that could lead to repostings</li>
<li>Fix tags description</li>
<li>Messages longer than 256 characters will be shortened now and &#8220;…&#8221; will be appended</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix: reenable &#8220;force download&#8221; option</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.10</h4>
<p>We discovered incompatibilities between our tracking implementation and some clients. To avoid further trouble, we are <em>deactivating tracking</em> until we solve the issue. The option is still available, we just switch it off automatically with this release and it isn&#8217;t on by default any more.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re of the curious type, feel free to activate it and tell us any issues you run into. Thanks!</p>
<h4>1.10.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: When tracking was active but no geo-location database available, downloads would fail. This exception is handled correctly now. You can check the status of tracking and the geo-location database in <code>Expert Settings &gt; Tracking</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature: Services in templates can be filtered by their type. That way, you can, for example, iterate over all Twitter accounts via <code>podcast.services({type: "twitter"})</code>. The previous &#8220;type&#8221; parameter (for choosing between &#8220;social&#8221;, &#8220;donation&#8221; and &#8220;all&#8221;) has been renamed to &#8220;category&#8221;. All default templates have been adjusted accordingly <em>but if you were using this API in a custom template, you need to change it</em>.</li>
<li>Feature: <code>podcast.contributors</code> in templates are sorted by name now. You can change the order by writing <code>podcast.contributors({order: "DESC"})</code>. When using grouping, each group will be sorted separately.</li>
<li>Feature: <code>podcast.contributors({scope: "global-active"})</code> is limited to contributors with at least one contribution in a published episode. To list contributors ignoring this limitation, use <code>podcast.contributors({scope: "global"})</code>. &#8220;global-active&#8221; is the new default.</li>
<li>Feature: Allow manual posting of ADN announcements</li>
<li>Feature: Add contributor support to ADN announcements</li>
<li>Feature: We are beginning to implement download intent tracking and statistics. As a first step, we are now tracking download intents. A following release will contain an analytics section where you can examine the statistics.</li>
<li>Feature: The feed <code>&lt;link&gt;</code> can be configured in <code>Expert Settings &gt; Website</code> now. It still defaults to the home page. Other options include the episode archive and any WordPress page.</li>
<li>Enhancement: remove encryption for &#8220;protected feed&#8221; password to prevent autofill browser features to destroy contents</li>
<li>Enhancement: default WordPress search now covers episode subtitle, summary and chapters</li>
<li>Enhancement: add Vimeo, Gittip and about.me to services</li>
<li>Enhancement: The expert setting &#8220;Display episodes on front page together with blog posts&#8221; changed to &#8220;Include episode posts on the front page and in the blog feed&#8221;. So if you set it, episodes will additionally appear in <code>/feed</code>. However, only in the form of a post. You will not find enclosures, iTunes metadata etc. in <code>/feed</code> items.</li>
<li>Enhancement: sort chapters imported from Auphonic by time</li>
<li>Enhancement: Changes to feed list: redirect URL is shown and added screen options to hide columns</li>
<li>Enhancement: Added Publisher version as an attribute to the export file. If a file is imported with a version different from the current Publisher, a warning is displayed.</li>
<li>Fix: enable group and role selection in contributor shortcodes</li>
<li>Fix: failing delayed ADN broadcast</li>
<li>Fix: stop sending ADN announcements for old episodes</li>
<li>Fix: refresh of Auphonic presets keeps current preset</li>
<li>Fix: <code>contributor.episodes</code> does not return duplicate episodes any more</li>
<li>Fix: Jabber URL scheme is now prefixed with <code>jabber:</code></li>
<li>Fix: Display podcast subtitle in feed description (it was the blog description before)</li>
<li>Fix: Hide contributors missing a URI from feeds</li>
<li>Fix: Escaping issue when saving podcast description settings</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature: Direct episode access in templates via <code>{{ podcast.episodes({slug: 'pod001'}).title }}</code></li>
<li>Feature: Episodes in templates can be filtered and ordered, for example <code>{{ podcast.episodes({orderby: 'title', 'order': 'ASC'}) }}</code>. For details, see <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/ref/template-tags.html#podcast" rel="nofollow"><code>podcast.episodes</code> documentation</a></li>
<li>Feature: Direct contributor access in templates via <code>{{ podcast.contributors({id: 'john'}).name }}</code></li>
<li>Feature: Add shortcode <code>[podlove-podcast-social-media-list]</code>, which lists all social media accounts for the podcast</li>
<li>Feature: Add shortcode <code>[podlove-podcast-donations-list]</code>, which lists all donation accounts for the podcast</li>
<li>Feature: Add tag support for Auphonic</li>
<li>Enhancement: Add &#8220;Save and Continue Editing&#8221; buttons to all table based management screens</li>
<li>Enhancement: Use translations for month and day names in formatted template dates (if a language other than english is used)</li>
<li>Enhancement: Add refresh buttons for Auphonic preset selector</li>
<li>Enhancement: Pass more data to web player (as preparation for the next release)</li>
<li>Enhancement: Improved export format: It has its own namespace and a version now. Publisher version and export date are included as XML comments. XML elements are indented for better readability.</li>
<li>Remove default content for new templates</li>
<li>Fix: &#8220;Network Activate&#8221; works now</li>
<li>Fix: group and role filters for <code>[podlove-podcast-contributor-list]</code> shortcode work as expected now</li>
<li>Fix: Add services and donations to export format</li>
<li>Fix: <code>episode.player</code> in episode loops, outside the WordPress loop works now</li>
<li>Fix: Auphonic chapter integration issue</li>
<li>Fix: Instagram URL scheme</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: contributor services will be saved correctly</li>
<li>Enhancement: add a donation column to contributor management table</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.5</h4>
<p><strong>Changes to the Templating System</strong></p>
<pre><code>episode.recordingDate and `episode.publicationDate` are DateTime objects now. Available accessors are: year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds. For custom formatting, use `episode.recordingDate.format("Y-m-d H:i:s")` for example. Calling `episode.recordingDate` directly is still supported and defaults to the format configured in WordPress.
</code></pre>
<p><strong>Other Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Enhancement: Add refresh buttons for ADN patter and broadcast channel selectors</li>
<li>Fix: Avoid &#8220;Grey Goo&#8221; scenario of self-replicating contributors</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Hotfix: solve migration issue</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.3</h4>
<p><strong>Changes to the Templating System</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>New filter: <code>padLeft(padCharacter, padLength)</code> can be used to append a character to the left of the given string until a certain length is reached. Example: <code>{{ "4"|padLeft("0",2) }}</code> returns &#8220;04&#8221;;</li>
<li>For consistency <code>{{ contributor.avatar }}</code> is now an object. To render an HTML image tag, use <code>{% include '@contributors/avatar.twig' with {'avatar': contributor.avatar} only %}</code>.</li>
<li><code>{{ episode.duration }}</code> has been turned into an object to enable custom time renderings. The duration object has the following accessors: hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds and totalMilliseconds.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>DEPRECATIONS/WARNINGS</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><code>{{ episode.duration }}</code> should not be used any more. The default templates are updated but if you have used it in a custom template, you must replace it. Example: <code>{{ episode.duration.hours }}:{{ episode.duration.minutes|padLeft("0",2) }}:{{ episode.duration.seconds|padLeft("0",2) }}</code></li>
<li><code>{{ episode.license.html }}</code> and <code>{{ podcast.license.html }}</code> are deprecated. Use <code>{% include '@core/license.twig' %}</code> for the previous behaviour of choosing the correct license based on context. If you want to be more specific, use <code>{% include '@core/license.twig' with {'license': episode.license} %}</code> or <code>{% include '@core/license.twig' with {'license': podcast.license} %}</code>.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Feature: ADN Module supports broadcasts</li>
<li>Enhancement: Contributor shortcode defaults to <code>donations="yes"</code> to avoid confusion</li>
<li>Enhancement: <code>[podlove-episode-downloads]</code> now uses templates internally</li>
<li>Enhancement: Added 500px, Last.fm, OpenStreetMap and Soup to Services</li>
<li>Enhancement: Use custom contributor social/donation titles as icon titles</li>
<li>Enhancement: Template form has a &#8220;Save Changes and Continue Editing&#8221; button now</li>
<li>Enhancement: feed validation is asynchronous now and has improved performance</li>
<li>Enhancement: Licenses have a new interface and are compatible with Auphonic now: they can be imported from a finished production and are included when creating a production.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Default MySQL character set is utf8 now when creating tables</li>
<li>Enhancement: Add datepicker for episode recording date</li>
<li>Fix: all default contributors appear in new episodes again</li>
<li>Fix: change Tumblr URLs from https to http since Tumblr does not support them</li>
<li>Fix: <code>[podlove-podcast-contributor-list]</code> shows the correct contributors now</li>
<li>Fix: internal template warning when accessing empty contributor roles or groups</li>
<li>Fix: episode rendering when no files are available</li>
<li>Fix: flattr script in rss feeds</li>
<li>Fix: importer issue where sometimes modules would not activate properly</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature: add template filter <code>formatBytes</code> to format an integer as kilobytes, megabytes etc. Example: <code>{{ file.size|formatBytes }}</code></li>
<li>Feature: New accessor <code>{{ file.id }}</code>. This is required to generate download forms.</li>
<li>Fix: <code>[podlove-episode-contributor-list]</code> shortcode: Firstly, the &#8220;title&#8221; attribute works again. Secondly, output by group is optional now and defaults to &#8220;not grouped&#8221; (as it was before 1.10). If you are using contributor groups and would like grouped output, use <code>[podlove-episode-contributor-list groupby="group"]</code></li>
<li>Fix: division by zero bug in statistics dashboard</li>
<li>Fix: parse time in statistics dashboard correctly as normalplaytime</li>
<li>Fix: add missing template accessor <code>{{ episode.recordingDate }}</code></li>
<li>Remove separate &#8220;publication date&#8221; field in episodes. Instead, use the episode post publication date maintained by WordPress. It can be accessed via <code>{{ episode.publicationDate }}</code></li>
<li>Fix: missing contributor-edit-icon on last entries</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix: podlove-episode-contributor-list shortcode: add support for &#8220;group&#8221; and &#8220;role&#8221; attributes</li>
<li>Fix: podlove-episode-contributor-list shortcode: fix broken flattr button</li>
<li>Fix: feed widget: only compress if zlib extension is loaded</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10.0</h4>
<p><strong>All-new, mighty Templating system</strong></p>
<p>You can now use the <a href="http://twig.sensiolabs.org/documentation" rel="nofollow">Twig Template Syntax</a> in all templates. Access all podcast/episode data via the new template API. Please read the <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/tut/understanding-templates.html" rel="nofollow">Template Guide</a> to get started.</p>
<p>If you have used templates before, please note that some shortcodes are now <em>DEPRECATED</em>. That means they still work but will be removed at some point. Following is a list of affected shortcodes and their replacements:</p>
<p>Instead of <code>[podlove-web-player]</code>, write <code>{{ episode.player }}</code>.</p>
<p>Instead of <code>[podlove-podcast-license]</code>, write <code>{{ podcast.license.html }}</code>.</p>
<p>Instead of <code>[podlove-episode-license]</code>, write <code>{{ episode.license.html }}</code>.</p>
<p>Instead of <code>[podlove-episode field="subtitle"]</code>, write <code>{{ episode.subtitle }}</code>. Instead of <code>[podlove-episode field="summary"]</code>, write <code>{{ episode.summary }}</code> etc. When in doubt, look at the <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/ref/template-tags.html#episode" rel="nofollow">Episode Template Reference</a>.</p>
<p>Changing the podcast data shortcodes works exactly the same: Instead of <code>[podlove-podcast field="title"]</code>, write <code>{{ podcast.title }}</code> etc. When in doubt, look at the <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/ref/template-tags.html#podcast" rel="nofollow">Podcast Template Reference</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Other Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Feature: The Podlove dashboard includes a section for feeds if you activate the &#8220;Feed Validation&#8221; module. It is intended as an overview for the state of your feeds. It shows the latest modification date, the number of entries, compressed and uncompressed size and the latest item. Additionally, you can validate your feeds against the w3c feed validator right from the dashboard.</li>
<li>Feature&#8221; Better Bitlove integration. There is a new setting in <code>Podlove &gt; Podcast Feeds &gt; Directory Settings</code> called &#8220;Available via Bitlove?&#8221;. It checks if there is a corresponding Bitlove feed and verifies it on a regular basis.</li>
<li>Feature: Support for the oEmbed format</li>
<li>New shortcode: <code>[podlove-episode-list]</code> lists all episodes including their episode image, publication date, title, subtitle and duration chronologically. This replaces the archive pages generated by the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/archivist-custom-archive-templates/">Archivist &#8211; Custom Archive Templates</a> plugin, if you are using it right now.</li>
<li>New shortcode: <code>[podlove-feed-list]</code> lists all public feeds</li>
<li>New shortcode: <code>[podlove-global-contributor-list]</code> shows all podcast contributors and lists related episodes.</li>
<li>New shortcode: <code>[podlove-podcast-contributor-list]</code> shows regular podcast contributors</li>
<li>Enhancement: The feed title may now include the asset title for easier discovery. This setting can be found at <code>Podlove &gt; Feed Settings</code></li>
<li>Changed shortcode: <code>[podlove-contributor-list]</code> is <em>DEPRECATED</em>. Please use <code>[podlove-episode-contributor-list]</code> instead.</li>
<li>Enhancement: add &#8220;autogrow&#8221; feature to chaptermarks text field</li>
<li>Enhancement: globally hide the migration-tool banner once dismissed rather than per-client via cookie</li>
<li>Fix: When setting the chapter asset to manual, delete all chapter caches to avoid hiccups</li>
<li>Fix: Contributor links in the backend use an ID now rather than the contributor slug. That way they work when no slug is set.</li>
<li>Fix ADN backslash escaping issue in post titles</li>
<li>Fix: all contributions can be deleted</li>
</ul>

You can configure default contributors in &#8220;Contributor Settings &gt; Defaults&#8221; and podcast contributors in &#8220;Podcast Settings &gt; Contributors&#8221;. Display podcast contributors using the shortcode <code>[podlove-podcast-contributor-list]</code>.</li>
<li>Enhancements: Plethora of adjustments in contributor interfaces to avoid confusions and smoothen workflows</li>

<h4>1.9.0 / 1.9.1</h4>
<p><strong>New Module: Contributors</strong></p>
<p>Podcasts are not possible without their active communities. Huge contributions are being made behind the scenes and nobody notices except the podcaster. The contributors module shines light on all those diligent people. It&#8217;s now easy to manage contributors of an episode and list them on the blog. The list contains references to their social profiles and the donation service Flattr. Shortcode to display them in an episode post: <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/ref/template-tags.html#contributors" rel="nofollow"><code>[podlove-contributor-list]</code></a>.</p>
<p><strong>Simple Protected Feeds</strong></p>
<p>You can now protect some or all of your feeds using HTTP authentication. Authenticate via a defined username and password or use the WordPress user database as backend.</p>
<p><strong>License Selector</strong></p>
<p>We built an interface to generate a Creative Commons license for your podcast and episodes. You can still use a custom URL and name if you don&#8217;t want a CC license. Use <code>[podlove-podcast-license]</code> and <code>[podlove-episode-license]</code> to display them in your episode posts.</p>
<p><strong>Other Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Feature: Add &#8220;Expert Settings&#8221; option to always redirect to media files instead of forcing a browser download. This is interesting for you if you want to minimize traffic on your server hosting the Publisher.</li>
<li>Feature: add global setting to configure feed item limits</li>
<li>Feature: Set &#8220;itunes:explicit&#8221; tag per episode if you want to (you have to activate the feature in the expert settings)</li>
<li>Enhancement: Feeds are delivered with gzip compression if possible</li>
<li>Enhancement: Support for temporary redirects in expert settings</li>
<li>Fix: keep ?redirect=no flag in paged feeds</li>
<li>Fix: <em>Module: Import/Export</em> Importing episodes no longer causes floods of ADN posts.</li>
<li>Fix: <em>Module: Auphonic</em> respect Auphonic chapter offset</li>
<li><em>DEPRECATED</em>: <code>podlove-contributors</code> shortcode. Use <code>podlove-contributor-list</code> instead</li>
</ul>
